Reviews.Title: “Great harbour view.”
Reviews.Author: Karl S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in a ninth floor standard room with a great view of the harbour and towards the city. Rooms are clean, comfortable and of a good size. We only had the buffet breakfast, which was excellent, in the Silk Restaurant and dinner in the ground floor Silk Bar which also serve first class meals. Although a little out of the city centre, trams, trains and canal boats are all at the front on the hotel. If one is adventurous, there is a Segway hire shop next to the hotel and they conduct city tours on these machines.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great views”
Reviews.Author: Nics17
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a junior executive suite and were rewarded with a 17th floor room with fabulous views plus some amazing sunrises. The beds were comfortable, there was more than adequate wardrobe and floor space and an endless supply of towels, bathrobes and slippers. This did irk me a bit as Moevenpick pride themselves on green credentials but the towels and bathrobes were changed daily even when we put them in the 'please don't change' rail in the bathroom. There were some nice touches - a bottle of water and a chocolate every night when we got back. The decor of the hotel was a bit bland/characterless - there was no feeling of being in Holland, which was a shame. The reception service was patchy - some staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, others were curtly professional. The concierge staff were helpful. The breakfast (which was included) offered a huge array of fresh produce to suit most tastes - Caffe Ipo a few doors along from the hotel offers fantastic coffee, sandwiches and pastries at a reasonable price as an alternative. The junior executive option offered access to the executive lounge, with free coffee, chocolates and computers plus a quiet environment to relax. The food and wine in the restaurant was very good, if a little pricey. I was glad we booked as people were being turned away when we ate there. The location of the hotel wasn't the greatest for sightseeing, although there is a regular shuttle (which you need to pre-book) to and from the station and it is one tram stop to the station. Jamie Oliver's Fifteen is a short walk away (booking necessary) and there was an Italian restaurant close by (which we didn't try). It was a shame the weather was arctic during our stay as it would have been nice to walk round the docks. Overall the hotel offers a good (if not great) location, good food and clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel but location is less than ideal”
Reviews.Author: Sergio T
Reviews.Content: The rooms are excellent and the service is exceptional. In fact, the rooms are much larger than a typical hotel at the same level in Amsterdam. The location seems great; it is very close to Central station. But you're in a somewhat isolated area in the wrong side of the canal. Tram service from the hotel is very good (the hotel also has a shuttle, but it is infrequent and small; you're much better off buying a long-term tram ticket at the central station). It is not hard to get to places. But if you like to wake you and go for coffee or breakfast or just step out of your hotel and go for a walk, this is not the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Premium prices for passable service.”
Reviews.Author: Cathynevza
Reviews.Content: The view from the windows of the hotel are wonderful. The room was very clean, spacious and overall nice. The hotel offered a free shuttle service to and from the Central station, although the shuttle was very small and one had to book to get spaces (you would be lucky to get one). The station was a walking distance, in nice weather which it was not, unfortunately, in the middle of April. The tram stop is across the road, around 7 minutes by walk. The concierge were very helpful and gave good guidance. The food at the restaurant was very good, although the service was rather sloppy. It took half an hour to bring spinach soup.It took an hour to bring bread for the complimentary soup, as the bread was burnt and it eventually ended up arriving alongside the starters. The main course took another half an hour, so we decided not to order puds! We had gone out of the hotel for almost half a day, and were disappointed to find our room not cleaned. We asked the cleaning service for the floor to clean it and eventually, after we had gone and come back again it was done. In the reception you have to wait for quarter of an hour to talk to anyone, and the staff there do not seem to be very efficient or in sync with each other. Overall, the hotel was average for the price we paid and the customer service should be re-organised.

Reviews.Title: “Customers service not great but decent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: YYCTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to getting on a river cruise. Checked in after arriving early morning and told we would have to wait till rooms ready in afternoon which is totally understandable. As we sat in the lobby I proceeded to watch the next 10 couples be given keys to their room. Went back to counter and spoke with different person who immediately had a room ready. I guess I needed to be clear I was with the river cruise company and next time send my elderly mother up to do the talking. Food in the hotel is great and loved the breakfast buffet which was included with our stay. Views from the room also wonderful. Conceariage could be more helpful and friendly. Rooms are big by European standards and the bathrooms are very large. Flat screen TV and free Wi-fi were top notch. Lobby is dated and needs new, more comfortable furniture. Took 2 hours for housekeeping to bring up some different pillows. Card keys for the room were shut off after first of 3 night stay so had to make trip back downstairs to get them reacivated. Over all average for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city experience”
Reviews.Author: Barrie B
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault our stay. The rooms were both spacious and modern with every facility you could wish for and a spectacular view. Breakfast was excellent quality to suit every taste. DSefinitely would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinxmcr
Reviews.Content: We chose the Movenpick for a 3 night stay in the city. Our room was located on the 12th floor with beautiful views of the city and water below. The room was spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast at the hotel is amazing, the best I've ever had at a hotel. I was worried that the hotel was too far from the centre of Amsterdam, in reality it is only 1 stop on the 26 tram to the Centraal Station. I would definitely recomend this hotel. However, there is only one slight draw back of the hotel and that is that the entrance is not that easily accessed as there is a walk down and round to the main entrance which doesn't seem a problem at first but after a day of non-stop shopping its a little more annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyHolidayMaker66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Moevenpick from 9th to12th April 2012. We travelled from the Airport to Central station by train (please note you need coins for the ticket machines which also translates into English but also tickets can be bought from the desk.) We arranged for the hotel shuttle bus to collect us from the station. We arrived early and checked in but could not gain access to our room until 3pm. Which was fine as we went out exploring. The weather was hit and miss whilst we was there but it did not stop us sightseeing. There is so much to see and do whilst you are there. The rooms/bathrooms are exceptionally clean with tea/coffee making facilities. Towels & toiletries are replenished daily and the rooms are cleaned. There is a minibar in the room but you have to notify reception if you wish to use it and they will stock it for you. There is also a safe which can be used free of charge. Our room was very cold and we asked that this be checked but apparently room 630 had a problem with the air con turning to heat. We were given extra duvets for warmth. We ate in the Silk Bar one evening (â‚¬18 per head for a bowl of noodles) but chose to eat out for the rest of the time. The Silk Restaurant (Al la carte) is available for dining but I think you have to make reservations. We used the shuttle bus on a number of occasions which runs from the hotel on the hour and half hour and from Central station every 5 past and 35 past the hour. Reservations must be made for this service as the shuttle only holds 8 people. If you choose to walk it is a good 20 minute walk into the city centre. We use to walk back in the evenings (a very safe walk) as the shuttle runs from 7am to 7.30pm. Both my husband and I used the gym. Small but useful. My husband used the spa facilities and was surprised that many people using this facility were unclothed. A little off putting if you are not use to this. All in all a lovely hotel with really friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel food”
Reviews.Author: BristolMaccer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a business meeting & the food in the hotel was the best I've had at a business meeting. Everyone in our group was really impressed with the variety & quality on offer. It was great that you could choose something healthy & make room for the most amazing lemon tart for dessert! Room also very comfortable. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another positive experience with Moevenpick hotels”
Reviews.Author: Dinko P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotel four nights and were really surprised from day one. Rapid check in, the room we have booked was a standard room, no breakfast included. During check in, we found out that our room was upgraded to executive and that breakfast is included in the price (25EUR per person). Staff at reception and concierge was very helpful in giving useful information about excursions, things to do, places to visit. You can also buy tickets for excursions there and charge it to your room, some tickets are also discounted (canal cruises). We have also used Taxi E, fully electric car from and to airport. As Taxi E has a deal with Moevenpick hotel, the price is fixed at 40EUR for each trip, comparing to minimum 60EUR of regular taxis, so it is worth booking it in advance. Also, hotel has a free shuttle to the Central station from where you can walk to the Dam square, it takes some 15-20 minutes walk. Hotel location is not in the city center, but you can always take a walk or use tram or taxis to the center. Breakfast was delicious, with plenty of choices and we really enjoyed having cappuccino in the quite executive lounge...

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovingsunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel and were not very impressed. It is a 20 minutes from central Amsterdam and it is not a very pleasant walk. The bed is super uncomfortable with two little pillows and two small light duvets which is strange considering we had a queen size bed and the weather was freezing in Amsterdam in the middle of April. The shower pressure was terrible and the the water didn't get too hot. The service was ok. When we asked for extra clean towels they arrived 1/2 hr later and we had to call twice. The free shuttle service to central station was great and the driver was really nice. Overall a very basic hotel. Would suggest you find something better for the same price in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Stay”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast34
Reviews.Content: Stopped on high floor with excellent view. Excellent business style of hotel. Slightly out of town, but only a short walk or tram ride to Centraal Station. Offers a shuttle from station to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: MJ_SG2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 15 minutes from Centraal station by car but you can catch the tram and it is only a stop away. Make the most of the free shuttle service although you have to book before and there may be times when it is too full. You can get tram tickets from the hotel itself which makes it easier if you need to travel by public transport. There is free wifi in the rooms and you get beautiful views of the harbour from your room. The restaurant can be a bit pricey and we chose to eat in the city instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: mojosbabe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights in Amsterdam from 5th to 9th April. The hotel is just on the outskirts of the City Centre but there is a no. 26 tram which runs every 4 mins directly opposite the hotel. It takes approximately 3 minutes to Central Station and from there there are endless trams to take to get you where you want to be, or you could just walk. We bought a 72 hour transport ticket when we arrived which means you can hop on and off any tram, bus or water taxi, just remember to check in and out each time you use it. It costs 16 euros and is great value. The hotel was excellent. Because we were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary they upgraded us to a room on the 18th floor with spectacular views. Especially good when the cruise liners were in right under our room. The bar was lovely serving really good food and the restaurant was excellent. Free wifi too. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again. This is our 6th visit to Amsterdam and the best hotel we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the water”
Reviews.Author: Essex08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over Easter, perfect location right on the water, only 15 min walk into town, or catch the tram at the stop directly opposite the hotel. We stayed on the 10th floor and had perfect views looking across the water and all of the town, you could see for miles on a sunny day. It's great to watch all the boats come and go. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and spacious, the bathroom looks brand new with a lovely big walk in shower! The staff are very polite, friendly and helpful. Recommend getting a multi day tram ticket, the trams are very frequent and are great for jumping on and off. Don't bother with the Tourist Bus, waste of time and they leave you stranded at the Diamond factory which is not worth a look anyway. The canal boat trip is very worthwhile and of course the Anne Frank house is worth a visit, but a tip is too go at 8.30 in the morning before the queue gets too long. It was the hotel that made our trip worth while though!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly lacklustre.”
Reviews.Author: N L
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel on the strength of the reviews that I had seen. Unfortunately both my wife and I were thoroughly disappointed with the experience and will most definitely not be staying there again. This is for the reasons that I have summarised below. 1) The location. One of he main attractions to this hotel was the supposedly 'amazing' location and its proximity to the station. Frankly, other than the views from the hotel, I was not impressed with the location. There is very little adjacent to the hotel and it is a good solid twenty minute walk from the station and a good half an hour walk to the city centre (if you walk at a brisk pace). Alternatively it was 15 euros for a taxi or a ten minute bike ride. For the price, I personally would rather stay in the city centre itself and be far closer to the action and fail to see why there have been so many reviews that rave about the location of this hotel. 2) The room. For some reason, we were given a room right next to the lifts on the seventeenth floor. This was incredibly noisy and both my wife and I had about two hours sleep due to the sheer noise of the lifts whizzing up and down all night. We asked to change the room after the first night and the staff at the desk seemed somewhat begrudging to provide us with a different room. Firstly they stated that they were fully booked then literally five seconds later they said that they had a room available on the fifteenth floor. When we arrived in the second room, we were disappointed to note that the double bed consisted on two single beds pushed together. Not particulalry spectacular considering that I paid in excess of Â£100 a night. It also transpired that the safe in the room was broken. After fifty minutes of waiting around, we were simply told that the safe would remain that way and that as an alternative we could put our goods in the safe at the front desk. Again we were not particularly impressed with this. The decor in the room was very modern and in my opinion, not particulalry homely. There were also no additional pillows in the room, which is something that we found particulalry unusual. We were also disappointed to note that there were no baths in either room, only a shower. This is despite there being a huge space that would have easily allowed for the installation of a bath. Despite the size of the shower(s), the water pressure was very low and not what I would reasonably expect from a shower of that size. 3) The maids. Neither of us were particularly impressed by the performance of the maids. During the course of our stay the hotel staff: - Failed to replace, clean or even move any of the cups/glasses that we used; - Did not empty the bins in the room; - Failed to replace the empty boxes of tissues in the bathroom. Neither of us are particulalry messy or indeed fussy people, but when you pay that much for a room, then you do expect a reasonably high standard of service. 4) The Room Service. The one positive thing that I would have to say is that when we ordered room service, both the food and the service were excellent. The member of staff that delivered the food was an absolute pleasure to deal with. We have been to Amsterdam numerous times and I can categorically state that we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views & first class room”
Reviews.Author: Caroline P
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay in a 20th floor suite (not for the faint hearted!) overlooking the cruise terminal, river, docks area and far beyond. The room was fabulous with everything catered for. Being on one of the two executive floors (19th & 20th) brought with it lots of extras - free Wifi, free (limited) minibar, Nespresso coffee, free fruit, chocolates each evening & use of the special executive lounge, plus a whole host of other little thoughtful touches. All the hotel staff were friendly and efficient throughout. The room was really well appointed with a sitting area (the sofa made up to a bed for our son) and a large bed in the separate bedroom. Each area had large flat screen TV's with a good choice of TV channels. There was a lovely bathroom with bath, shower & twin basins. We really felt spoilt throughout. We didn't eat in the restaurant (except to enjoy the lexcellent breakfast), but enjoyed two lovely evening meals in the Silk Bar. The location away from the centre of town was a plus for us as Amsterdam centre was getting very busy in the run up to Easter and we didn't mind the walk to and fro each day. The room was excellent value when I consider what we've paid for similar facilities in other hotels in major cities around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stella R
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 who had a very pleasant stay at Moevinpick Hotel. We stayed here for 1 week. Very good service, nice view (we had 2 connecting executive rooms on the 19th floor), free minibar that they refreshed daily, free internet and good staffs. We like the location as it is not in the very core of the city. My 7 yr old son likes the Playstation corner near the restaurant. Breakfast buffet was also good. As we were always out, we used the executive lounge only twice. They served snacks and beverages (also with alcohol) free of charge. It is just a walking distance to the central station, but there is a tram station on the front of the hotel which we used once just for a try, or else we walk. I highly recommended this hotel for people travelling with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pammy123
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a week in Amsterdam and were so pleased with the Movenpick that we wanted to write a review to encourage others to experience this excellent Hotel..... The Hotel is a tram ride away from Amsterdam Centraal ( dont be put off by this as Trams ran regularly and the longest we ever waited was a few mins at any one time) and we were treated like royalty...Staff were always very attentive and helpful, breakfast was fantastic and we had free h'orderves and drink between 5-7 pm every day as we had booked an Executive room. Also, the Hotel had a very small gym so the only thing that would have been nice would have been a nice swimming pool :-) Our room had fantastic views of the city / canals / river....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vivzkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from March 23-28, it was nice staying at this hotel. They even have a gift for our anniversary chocolates and card, although it's a bit far from the city centre ( they actually provide a shuttle but we did not take this as it was great walking to and fro (especially good weather, it was a memorable stay and the receptionist are very friendly especially Annika who attended to us. The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The Moevenpick Hotel wins hands down”
Reviews.Author: 45thAnnivesary
Reviews.Content: The hotel building must be the tallest building ideally situated just outside the centre (1 tram stop) ride takes you to front of Train station, where may more trams are available to take you to various sights in and around Amsterdam. Perfect once you have the hotel map of Amsterdam. My wife and I asked for a high room for the views. The hotel obliged by giving us the 17th floor which overlooked the Boarding area for all Cruise ships entering Amsterdam from Switzerland etc. The room was spacious and very clean, excellent. Unfortunately the Queen Mary did not dock as we would have had the best view. Room 1st class. Spa area small, 2 saunas, cold showers, and 4 beds in rest area. My wife and I booked for a fabulous massage our 45th Wedding Anniversary treat, (expensive in UK terms) but there is only one massage room so I waited but rested well. The concierge are extremely helpful, efficient and courteous as are most of the staff. The 30 mins. courtesy bus needs to be booked otherwise - tough! The downside to this is that it takes you to the back of the Train Station and to get to the city centre you need to walk directly through the centre of the station and it's busy. Great few days thanks Moevenpick, Hope to return soon. The weather was superb and warm - lucky eh!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service !”
Reviews.Author: Marin C
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend! Unfortunately the hotel is modern and beautiful, the rooms are clean and tastefully decorated. But the reception services are terrible, I have not seen anywhere more incompetent receptionist. When I arrived at reception to check-in we have been surprised to be asked to pay for room + another 50 euros per night (200 total) as security for the minibar (in case we'll eat something from the minibar). But surprise, in room minibar was empty. It took 35-40 minutes to do the check-in, because those who work at recpetie are completely incompetent. Initially we were stuck on the card 650 euros for 4 nights + 200 euro guarantee for the Check-0ut then prevent us another 450 euros for 4 nights accommodation so in total cost us 1100 euros instead of 450. I forgot a souvenir room, I checked out at 10 am then walked into town, when we returned after the luggage, I asked at reception if you check the room and give me back a souvenir, unfortunately after 30 minutes are not expected to verify relapse room and had to leave the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sian67
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - quick check-in with very pleasant staff, a clean, modern room with very comfortable bed, good view over the river, excellent breakfast buffet and also a very nice meal in the restaurant. The location is about 10 - 15 minute walk from Centraal Station but the hotel offers a free shuttle service every half hour, but only available for 8 persons at a time so best to pre-book this (although we only booked it about 20 minutes in advance).....would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but good things to say...”
Reviews.Author: Diane E
Reviews.Content: The Moevenpick Hotel was our (pre-Rhine River cruise with Viking Cruise LIne) Amsterdam excursion hotel. When I first tried to look at the hotel location on the map, it looked a little far from downtown Amsterdam. But I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel's location was actually good, on the water with a great view toward the North Sea. The Moevenpick provides a shuttle to the Centraal Station every half hour (make sure to reserve your seats!) which is very convenient. There is also a tram stop in front. The hotel was very modern, clean with everything we needed. The breakfast buffet was included with our stay -- great service, wonderful selection of tasty food. The staff at the concierge desk was wonderful: ready to help with luggage, reservations, directions, information. The shuttles were so convenient and on time. There are two concierge staff that I want to compliment, Frits and Daniel. They went out of their way to make our first stay in Amsterdam more enjoyable. Also, when we had a problem with our television (brand new Philips HD flatscreens), the security oficer came up on Saturday night and fixed it with a smile. Also a plus, just down the street from a great restaurant, Fifteen owned by Jaime Oliver. We would definitely stay there again. Good choice of hotel, Viking Cruise Line!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, clean”
Reviews.Author: IkeaRules
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 10 minutes from the central station (by foot). Descent and clean rooms. The breakfast has a wide variety of servings but is a bit overpriced (around 25 euro per person), also very crowdy and LOUD. They do not have private parking but you can park in a public parking just in front of the entrance at a cost of 50 Euro's per 24h (way too expensive). In room digital tv. Limited free (slow) wifi connection. We paid 250 euro's city taxes and breakfast for 2 included. I would say it is 50 Euro's overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: tankman84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while traveling to watch my national team play football. The hotel is very clean and modern - it all looks relatively new and trendy. The room was a decent size and had spectacular views over the river. The hotel is a little out of the way, which some may consider to be a benefit. The hotel car park is a little expensive at â‚¬30 a day. I was also charged for mini bar items I didn't drink, but this was promptly sorted out when I reported it to reception. Overall this is still a great hotel and I would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, location great”
Reviews.Author: AMacklin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room (three friends). The hotel was brilliant, it was one friends birthday during the stay and on check in they gave her chocolates and jam as a gift and on the actual day of her birthday more chocolate appeared in our room. We used the spa and the only downside was there was no steam room. The hotel is situated at the port and only a ten minute walk to the centre but there is a tram stop directly outside the hotel and takes you to the central station (tickets for an unlimited day pass is available from the hotel) the areas taxi rank is situated right outside the front door too! We opted to walk to the centre each day which was very safe (and flat) so wasn't an issue. Lovely hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mariia
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers commented before, this hotel is 10-15 mins walk from the Central Railway station and there are not too many services nearby: Subway sandwich bar and Zouthaven restaurant at the Music Hall. We had a room at 19th floor with spectacular river view. The room was spotless, the decoration was modern, but pretty average. The water pressure was poor in the bathroom, which tends to be the case in new European hotels. Frustrating, at least for folks from Nordic countries... There was a convenient internet corner with the printer at ground floor, where I could make the internet check-in and print the boarding pass for my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: canislupus1
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Excellent spacious room on 3rd floor with separate dressing area and double bathroom. - Bedroom windows can be opened and air con/heating deactivated if necessary. - Very comfortable bed, sofas and chairs. - Flat screen TV with multitude of UK channels, hi fi, fridge, modern kettle and nice clean crockery. - Bathroom 100% clean and nice to have separate walk in shower. - Good range of food and drinks in the Silk Bar (you must try the Moevenpick ice cream). - Faultless check-in / check-out service and professional, friendly staff. The not so good: - It's a good 15 min walk to the city centre. There is a hotel shuttle which departs every 30 minutes but you need to book in advance as it is a small Ford Transit with room for 8 people. - The more spacious rooms have a view of a neighbouring bulding. - Bedroom contained a number of stains and marks on upholstery and carpets which took away from the overall clean feeling. - Not enough staff serving in the bar. We counted one staff member for well over 40 customers. We would have ordered more drinks if we had been approached more regularly. Overall a nice hotel and would certainly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was pretty well perfect”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRA
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean spacious modern room with a great view, comy bed and all mod cons, Reception staff friendly and professional. Not too far from the centre, with good tram and free shuttle service. Great value for money. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel does not live up to the brand.”
Reviews.Author: Franciswon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit far from the city centre but getting to town is quite easy, especially with the hotel shuttle bus which departs every half hour and the tram station is in front of the hotel. The facilities are appropriate for its level. However the service are pretty cool. I can understand why other visitors made similar comments after I stayed there. The staff are polite but lack the passion. One driver in particular was pretty rude and does not really make the passengers feel welcome. I have a few days my hotel amenities were not refilled, including the fully using shampoo. I put down a note requesting for no coffee but only English breakfast tea everyday but was totally ignored. If you can get a good rate for this hotel, fine. Otherwise better forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor99
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights recently,what a hotel, there was'nt a fault in any aspect of this hotel,we had a stunning view from our 10th floor room,there was a courtesy mini bus every 30 mins to the central station which was the centre of town,furthermore it was actually only a 5 min walk so the transport was a bonus. The food was excellent,the bar even had a happy hour on the Friday night, and the beefburger supper was the size of a victoria sponge cake,enough to share with someone. All staff were very helpful,we would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janine R W
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here for my trip in amsterdam. It was close to the main part of the city, close to any tram links and a short walk from the main station there. The room was amazing with a beautiful view over the city. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay here again. The staff were helpful and friendly, the hotels bar and food was amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and view.”
Reviews.Author: bajenleker
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with my youngest son early March and got a 40% discount. ItÂ´s a 10-12 mins walk from the Central Station, separated from the cyclists or one stop with the tram. The room was fresh and modern, decent space, a fridge and a safety-box and like 60 channels on the tv. Coffe/tea-maker. Good bed. Nice bathroom, with shower and tub. Cleaning was ok, however they did not dish the glasses/cups all the time. Staff very nice and friendly. Did not eat at the hotel. We stayed on the 16th floor, overlooking the station and the lively canal/river. A "Subways" is close to the hotel but thatÂ´s it. Overall a pleasant stay. The only drawback would be the location, I did not mind the walk but others might do. Felt safe every time.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Lesley1804
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Movenpick Hotel in Amsterdam recently, it was only for 1 night but I was so impressed with the high level of Customer Service, from Check-in to the concierge staff nothing was a problem. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam as it's location is a mere 10 minute stroll to the heart of the city, yet nice and peaceful, if you don't fancy the walk there is a free commuter bus every 30 minutes. I'm intending to return for a longer stay soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: Shane59
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of Trip Advisors members rating and its location. We were made to feel important at every moment. Five walk in city centre and central station. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “faultless”
Reviews.Author: Melanie A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our short stay was relaxing, helped by the lovely hotel and warm, friendly service from the staff. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and quiet, i thought being near the railway lines and roads we would hear a lot of traffic, nothing could be heard. Amsterdam is easily accessible, either walking, tram, or boat. We would be using this hotel again and hopefully have more time to enjoy amenities the hotel has available.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel, no smoking policy”
Reviews.Author: pinkmambo
Reviews.Content: Moevenpick Amsterdam is located out of the main tourist district of Amsterdam- by tram (no 26), it's about 5 minutes away from the Central station or about a 1km walk.The area around the hotel is quiet- the views of amsterdam is breathtaking. The hotel advertises itself as a 4 star hotel and it's a good 4 star- the rooms are spacious for european standards and well-insulated to external sounds- the beds comfortable- the room has a nice couch and a very big bathroom with a nice shower powerful shower and good hair-dryer. Coffee-tea amenities provided. The best thing about this hotel is their strict 'no-smoking' policy hotel-wide and in Amsterdam, it's a good thing as the last hotel i stayed at, the second hand marijuana smoke from the adjoining rooms seeped into my bathroom/room. Only downside is the check-in and check-out process was a bit slow due to the amount of people coming in and out. The staff however, are friendly and nice. Will not hesitate to recommend this hotel- despite the distance to the city centre and other tourist attractions, Amsterdam is a small city and easily walkable and the trams system is very efficient and connects well throughout. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT HOTEL......week since got back.....STILL MISSING IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Iftikhar I
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Wed 15th Feb in the morning at 10.30am. I think because they were quiet, we were able to check-in right away - which was fantastic! We were able to change and get into our winter clothes as it was freezing in Amsterdam........colder than Manchester! Got checked in by Chris on reception - he was very professional & presentable (you would never guess he had been a mechanic in his former life!!). During our stay we would take the complementary shuttle to Centraal Station in the morning when embarking on our daily tours, and then walk back in the evening to the hotel. The walk from Centraal to the hotel is about 15mins and from the city (Damrak) again 15 mins. Breakfast was included in the price and this was exceptional!! The wife loved the variety - hot/cold. Fryed eggs/scrambled/omlets on demand. Service and variety was excellent. On my next trip I was considering going to the Mint/Hilton hotel which is between Centraal and Movenpick hotel - but I think I would rather go to this hotel again. Thanks again to Chris on reception (and to the irish chap who drove us daily to the station). Just remember that you require to leave a daily deposit of 50 euros whilst staying at the hotel. We stayed for 4 nights so we deposited 200 euros which we got back fully on checking out on Sun 19th Feb. You can also pick up a free city map from reception which is very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: JATG001
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, just one stop by tram (No. 26) of Centraal Station. You can also walk to the hotel (about 800m). For me it was the best hotel I've ever been, because in everything there is a note "touch" of quality. The rooms are excellent as well as the views of the city. The breakfast is very good, with plenty of choice and to my surprise, with "kitchen" live, as seen in the resorts of the Caribbean! The service is personalized. Even the LCD of the room had a welcome message! The only con is that the area around the hotel, it has little or nothing to enjoy. However, in just 10 minutes we are in the city center. In short, in Amsterdam to find a hotel like this for only 99 â‚¬ with breakfast included, was a find!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: sibulka
Reviews.Content: We spent in Moevenpick 2 nights. Hotel is well situated -10 minutes walking distance from the Train Station, or one stop by tram (tram stop is just in front of the hotel, trams are going often), in a harbour - with a beautiful view! By check-in we asked if we can change room for one on a higher floor (originally we've got on the 2nd floor) - it was not a problem, we've got one on 16th floor. Receptionist "warned us" thats it's a room next to the lift (implying it might disturb us), but we didnt hear anything and it was worth changing for the view! Anyway, Amsterdam offers so much that we only slept there. Staff was nice and friendly, rooms spacious and clean, bathoorm as well - big and clean, tv with most of the international chanels. Restaurant and bar deserve also a good word. We had drinks in a bar (nice staff, nice ambient), before that we made a reservation for a dinner in the restaurant and asked for a table by the window. When we came all the tables for 2 were taken, but weve still got one next to the window for 4 - nice gesture:-) Food was amazing! Overall, happy with a choice. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, both for leisure as for business”
Reviews.Author: Keppebolletje
Reviews.Content: The hotel has much to offer and is well located. the room was spacious, nice bathroom and an amazing view. Staff was ok, although I was a bit shocked that the employee at the check in could not speak Dutch.... Meetingrooms were very good. Food (breakfast, lunch and dinner) were amazing. we were a very big group, so thumbs up to make it so delicious.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: MomandZach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. We were given a room upgrade for no apparent reason - yeah! Walked in to our room and were instantly captivated by the view of the harbor and city. Room was large - bathroom was huge by European standards. (Large enough to do some laundry and have it all dry by the next morning on the heated racks). Ate in the restaurant - didn't have a reservation which seemed the host did not like, but were seated quickly. Food was very good and service quick and efficient Breakfast was incredible - many choices, quality food, beautiful view. Most days we just had breakfast in the hotel and paid for one other meal for the whole day. The canal boats dock just across from the hotel - buy a one or two day pass and travel in style. About seven minute walk to the main train station to catch buses and trains to everywhere. This was the nicest hotel we've found yet in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice of hotel as part of a mini-cruise”
Reviews.Author: diggybokbok
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick provided an excellent choice of stay as part of the Hull-Amsterdam mini-cruise. The hotel is splendidly located at the waterside, with panoramic views across the city. It is a straightforward easy ten minute stroll to and from the central station. The welcome and friendliness of staff is characterised by giving you what you need and not being seen to make a big effort. The whole experience is an effortless glide from bar to restaurant to room! The leisure facilities are simply first rate. The bedrooms are tastefully decorated and accompanied by a huge bathroom, which is more like a salon. Don't think twice - stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireRosie
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights and 4 days at this hotel and it could not be faulted. All the staff were all friendly, efficient and couldn't be more helpful.We had an early flight in and a late flight home but there was no problem storing the luggage. The room had space for a bath, but instead had a large walk-in shower. We didn't realise baths were available until I started writing this review. Therefore, if you want a room with a bath, you will have to request it! The breakfast was excellent and if you get the chance, get one of the Movenpick yoghurts, they were great (they didn't have them on the last day). We had a meal in the restaurant on the 2nd floor and the food, albeit a tad expensive, was excellent. For 2 of the other nights we ate at the bar on the ground floor. The food was good, but a little cheaper. The waste to the wash basin in the room got blocked one afternoon. We reported it on the way out and by the time we had got back (3 hours) it had been sorted. The Concierge arranged for a taxi (electric car) back to the airport which was cheaper than the one we took from the airport at the start of the break. May be best to email or ring the hotel to arrange? We tended to walk everywhere, but on a couple of occasions we took the shuttle bus which drops off behind the central station. To be honest, it doesn't take long to walk that distance, but when the wind coming off the river is biting, it's most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie62Hampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moevenpick this month and I would recommend it to other travellers. It's a one stop, short tram ride away from the city centre and central rail station. Our room was lovely and large for the 3 of us with an excellent bath and shower, probably one of the most spacious rooms we have ever had. The sofa bed wasn't made up as promised for our daughter when we were told it would be but a quick phone call put that to rights as well as requesting tea bags and milk which didn't seem to be routinely stocked sufficiently. The buffet breakfasts were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Lovely Views”
Reviews.Author: klb504
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a 10 min stroll behind the central station (away from the centre of town) with a very convenient tram (number 26) that stops across from the hotel. Downstairs in the lobby the hotel is very open and the concierge were lovely. We were able to drop our bags off (we arrived very early) and wander around the city all day with no trouble. We requested a high floor as we had read they had the best views and we were accommodated, our room was bright and airy on the 14th floor and looked out over the harbour. As we were there in winter it was a quite snowy harbour, but beautiful. Everything worked very well, was modern and clean with helpful, polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel5962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Moevenpick this past September. The hotel was perfectly located just minutes from the train station and our other sites of interest. We will definitely stay again at Moevenpick again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but a bit jaded.”
Reviews.Author: slueth50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Movenpick from the 6/2/12 to 10/2/12. We booked an Executive Room because we like the complimentary beer and soft drinks in the room, free internet access (512kb not wireless in the room) and the access to the Executive lounge which served hot/cold snacks and free wine, beer and soft drinks every evening between 5pm and 7pm. The hotel is 20 minutes walk from the central station and runs a free shuttle bus between 7am and 7pm on the half hour. The route 26 tram runs past the hotel every five minutes and the trip to the central hotel takes 5 minutes. On arrival the greeting was warm and even though we were early, check in is 3pm, staff went to great lengths to find a room for us. The first Executive suite we were offered was small and a bit tatty. No bath. We pointed this out to the concierge who had brought our bags up and he immediately phoned our concerns to reception. we were then offered a free upgrade to a junior suite on the same floor (19th) This was bigger, 3 rooms, with a bath and shower but still a bit jaded/tatty. Very clean. I am type 2 diabetic so I can't drink regular beer and when we mentioned this to the guest services they immediately changed the beer in the fridge to complementary Pilsner which I can drink. The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast which is an extensive buffet from served until 10.30am. Unfortunately the hot food was usually only lukewarm and daily we had to ask for it to be reheated or cooked fresh. This was not to much trouble for the staff, they were happy to oblige. The Executive lounge is a bit small but the staff were excellent. On Monday and Tuesday we could not access the internet on their desktop computers. After a couple of attempts we managed to connect via the hotels wireless network but access is only free for 24 hours. The daily hot/cold snacks in the Executive Lounge were excellent and included palma ham, goats cheese, caviare, smoked fish, chicken, prawns and fruit. When my wife expressed a preference for pinot grigio wine it was provided as was a plentiful supply of pilsner beer. Staff have a friendly 'can do' attitude and nothing is to much trouble for them. The concierge desk is particularly good. The executive rooms and junior suites have a Nespresso Machine but these don't impress me much. Views from our window on the 19th floor were to the east and day and night were awesome. Overall we thought the hotel was a little expensive but compared with others we have stayed at in Amsterdam we rate it as very good.

Reviews.Title: “decent amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: proscreen
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights last week,on 14th floor,verygood business hotel albeit its out of the way about a mile walk from central station.parking on site is 45 euros per night so be aware. bathrooms are large and have small amount of amenities ie soap,beds are comfortable and there is a non stocked refrigerator in your room,irons are in the room along with hairdryers. breakfast is great buffet style with all the usual offerings. to be fair it wasnt memorable in any way but it is a decent business 4 star hotel that i wouldnt recommend if your going for a short break as it requires taxis to get anywhere and at a minimum 7.50 euros per ride it does add up on your trip and better to stay nearer to the station or dam sq.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rae93
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely modern which almost didn't seem quite right for the charm of Amsterdam itself. If I had to sum up the atmosphere in one word, it would be sterile. It is very clean. The staff are helpful. Especially the Irish man who drove the shuttle. He gave us so much information and made us feel very welcome. It was nice having a refrigerator and also a coffee/tea service in the room. The location, coming in during the very cold weather, was not easy or intuitive. It was especially difficult with baggage. The bathroom is supposed to be modern I suppose, but the bathroom door is designed not to close, so if you are at all modest, this could be uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: thomas211007
Reviews.Content: Spent our weekend in Amsterdam staying at Moenenpick Hotel the service at this hotel was excellent. Partucularly the concierge who went out of there way to help us with a transport problem. (none of there doing). Hotel was excellent we were on the 18th floor with brilliant views. Visited Ann Frank's house, tour on the canal, visited cheese making and clog making and windmills. All this in two days. Worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dominique1986
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed in, rooms clean and large, fantastic view over the port. Staff helpful, free shuttle to town, gift shop well stocked. Not like us, but we got to the hotel at 5pm and ordered room service and enjoyed the hotel rather than going back out. It was that nice! Breakfast has a large selection and tasty st that too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise Choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Alternatives
Reviews.Content: I booked a 'surprise 4* hotel' with the Easy-to-Book service and only found out after that we would be at the Moevenpick Hotel. This hotel falls into what I call 'affordable luxury'--spacious room, big, comfortable bed with quality bedding, sofa, fridge, and a fabulous view out over the Amstel River. Because the hotel is not directly in the center of Amsterdam it doesn't have the street noise that one must deal with at most other city hotels but that does mean there is a bit of walk to get into town. The hotel does run a shuttle that drops you off at the train station (note: shuttle stop is on the opposite side of the station that leads to the city) and there is a tram just across from the hotel that you can use if you don't want to to the 20-30 minute walk. If I could get the same rate I got (~$130/night) I'd choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice time at movenpick hotel”
Reviews.Author: lo_shamano
Reviews.Content: very nice place, big room with wonderfoul viewing on the city from the higher floor. Not so far from the central station (10 min walking time) and a taxi stop is in front of the entrance, and a free shuttle bus depart every 30 min in early morning and late evening from the hotel to the station and back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business hotel close to the main train station”
Reviews.Author: Australienkenner
Reviews.Content: The location is good if you have a conference in the nearby harbour area, but rather inconvenient if you want to do sightseeing in the city center. It's more of a business hotel anyway. The room was very nice and also had a nice view over the harbour. The only thing that did not work properly was the TV which couldn't be switched off with the remote control. Hotel staff came to fix this once, but the problem reoccured and I just turned the receiver off afterwards. The service was generally very good. The only thing which I found strange for a business hotel was that they did not have a spare charger cable for a Blackberry and therefore - since I had forgotten my own cable - I had to charge my mobile phone at a charging station in the lobby which meant standing next to it for almost half an hour. The breakfast buffet was very varied, but a bit overpriced at 23 Euros. If breakfast is not included in the room rate one might considered having breakfast elsewhere instead. The food I ordered from room service wasn't very good - again I would recommend eating elsewhere (I strongly recommend trying Jamie Oliver's Fifteen restaurant which is only a ten-minute walk away). All in all I would recommend this hotel for business travellers and would stay here again, but would forego the breakfast buffet and room service food.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you want on a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Hillier
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, good size room for a city hotel. Excellent food. Not in the city centre though, please beware. Not stock in the mini bar and 8 Euro's for a large bottle of water. Bar closes at 1AM. Minor changes would make this a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jonsBeds
Reviews.Content: Third stay and the standards are maintained. Rooms are good with fabulous walk in showers. The bar is friendly with really good staff and good food. The Breakfast is also very good. Location is close to the centre so ideal for site seeing and there are some bars and restaurants within 100ms. If you run then there is a nice canal side 5k from the hotel. I stay on business and it's perfect however like any modern hotel it lacks character so if you want somewhere which reflects Amsterdam more closely then I would consider a central older town house hotel. This does not take away from a really good hotel which will not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Movenpick jan/feb 12”
Reviews.Author: wallaseywhite
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Please though be careful as the bar prices are silly (21 euro for 3 drinks). The location is superb 5 mins from amsterdam central station. Breakfast had a great diversity with cooked meats, fruit, yoghurts and sausage and bacon. The toaster need adjusting though as you get slightly warm bread rather than golden toast. Minibus runs from hotel to train station every 30 mins (not from station to hotel come on people) but beware as they charge you 5 euro for this without really telling you that it will cost. Great view from my room over the harbour and only a 10 euro taxi ride from the town centre when your night out is complete. In conclusion expensive but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Brillaint Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Palpy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel just after 10am having been met by the Hotel Shuttle at the Central Station . As it was a birthday weeekend we decided to upgrade to an Executive room and were delighted to be given a Junior Suite plus a small gift of chocolate/biscuits and apricot jam ( a nice touch ).We couldn't fault service /staff/ food or location all were excellent . If I have one complaint it would be that although the toilet in the bathroom as clean the bottom of the bowl was very grey, maybe some bleach would be good.

Reviews.Title: “High quality stay”
Reviews.Author: ArranBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very high quality - thanks to skilled, friendly staff and a clean modern building. The bedroom was excellent, spacious and comfortable in a modern European style. Central - 15 mins walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Brighten B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in January 2012 twice at the suite and I was very surprised, the room is very clean and modern with great view. The staff is very friendly and has great customer service. The location is very convenient, it is a 10 minutes walk to the central station and shopping area. The breakfast is something you do not want to miss, lots of different choices of food: cold cuts, breads, fruits, even freshly made omelets or pan fry eggs. I will definitely stay at the Movenpick Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the sights”
Reviews.Author: Lynda082
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a lovely trip to Amsterdam with a group of friends. Had a great stay at this hotel. Great views of the city and river. Rooms large and very clean. Food excellent. Would stay here again. Shame about the noise from the club next door on the Saturday evening - but we were assured that this does not happen often.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable in attractive surroundings”
Reviews.Author: emslou
Reviews.Content: Having got a deal on this hotel I was dubious about the quality however I was pleasantly surprised on arrival. Close to the central train station and shops, bars cafes etc it was the perfect base to explore Amsterdam. The hotel was modern and clean. There was a lovely gym with a sauna and relaxation area which was needed after the long days of walking around sightseeing! As an added bonus I was always the only one using the saunas. Service was polite and friendly however room service was slower than I would expect. Overall a good experience and I will be returning on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing business trip”
Reviews.Author: Chris B B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the moevenpick amsterdam in November 2011. The hotel was very clean, offered very good facilities and the staff were very accomadating. The food was good and also the atmosphere. I was luck enough to be upgraded to a suite which was absolutely splendid. Not cheap but delivered value for money.

Reviews.Title: “"dutch treat"”
Reviews.Author: anthony b
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break exploring Amsterdam. We arrived 9am & thought we would be able to leave our cases so were pleased to be able to check in that early! Our room had great views of the river & offered everything we could need. The only down point was that at night it seemed to be a little noisy ...not sure if it was the air conditioning but would be happy to suffer with it again!! The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was fabulous! We walked from the hotel into the centre which took 15 minutes max although the hotel did offer a shuttle and taxis are located outside if you needed one. We had a fabulous few days and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FINLEY_12
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth time going to Amsterdam and the third time staying at the Movenpick it get's better every time.I would recommend it. The only negative is a ten minute walk to Central station but that's if you don't like to walk to counter that there is a free shuttle compliments of the hotel and also a tram just outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: M1rjam
Reviews.Content: I had my little birthday treat trip to Amsterdam and stayed in the MÃ¶venpick for 2 nights. It was the best hotel, I've ever stayed in with THE BEST breakfast I've ever had ! The view is absolutely gorgeous and the staff super friendly. It is a bit more expencive than the average Amsterdam city center hotel, but it is worth it ! Treat yourselt !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Value. Spacious Modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: exeuropean
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in this hotel on my recent trip to Amsterdam. Both stays were just perfect. The location is very convenient, next to the Central Station and overlooking the historical Harbor and city. It is very quiet, no drunk revelers. It is about a 10 minute walk to the station or you can take the (complimentary) hotelshuttle or a taxi ( 7 euro or so) The staff is very professional and courteous. Everyone from the bartenders to bellhops to front desk and waitstaff. On the second floor is an executive lounge with complimentary drinks, snacks and internet/computers. The rooms we had were very nice and spacious. The bathroom is equipped with a bathtub and a separate shower. We had a junior suite which was on the 18th floor and overlooked the city and historical harbor. The beds are very comfortable and a "pillow menu" is provided. Parking is quite expensive, although convenient. For a whole day it is 48 euro or 4 euro an hour. The garage is underneath the hotel, but city owned. For cheaper parking ( 8 euro per day incl. tram tickets) go to p+r Zeeburg. still convenient and safe. I am very familiar with the top rated hotels in this city, but this one beats them for its location and value.

Reviews.Title: “"A great hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Valeriya Q
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed my stay very much! Excellent hotel and customer service!!! The hotel view was amazing as well!!! But the best part was breakfast!!! Of course it was quite a walk from the train station, but the public transportation is very close and easy. You can reserve a shuttle from the hotel also. I'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: freek11
Reviews.Content: We already stayed here 2 times for the weekend, and both times it was excellent. The hotel is a 15-20 min. walk from the central station but there is a tramstop in front of the hotel. (Tip: buy a OV-chipcard, 48 hours of unlimited public transportation for 11,50 euro) The hotel is a clean and the rooms have a superb view. Breakfast is a bit expensive but varied and tasteful. Rooms are quiet (except for the last day, the fusebox in our room was buzzing). Overall: Recommended if you want to be close to the center of Amsterdam without the disadvantages of being right in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: PDXDUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple here and loved this hotel. The staff were very friendly and the room was really nice. We had an amazing view. The only drawback is if you want to have breakfast at the hotel it is 23 Euro per person, which is excessive. The breakfast buffet is good, but I think it would be more reasonable if it was around 15 Euro per person. The location is a 10-15 minute walk from the train station, or you can take the free shuttle which leaves every hour. We walked most of the time and it was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashtonboy
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick is abit of a walk from the train station but it is worth it for the fab views and exellent service.There is a mini bus service twice an hour( which is free) from the hotel to the station and vice versa Our room was on the 9th floor and the view was really good. Our package included breakfast which was exellent, Reception and Restaurant staff were faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, slightly outside of city centre”
Reviews.Author: foodytravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moevenpick in February 2011 and found it to be a very good hotel. We got the train from the airport as the train station is very near the hotel. Once we got out of the station, it took between five and ten minutes to walk the short distance to the hotel (you need to cross the road outside of the station towards the bike park and take a right). Check in was speedy, pleasant and efficient. The rooms were spacious clean and had a great view - the windows are huge! We got room only here, we didn't have breakfast, nor did we eat in the Silk Road Restaurant for dinner. The room had a mini bar in it, which we used the fridge to store juice and fruit in for breakfasts as it wasn't electronically monitored. When we arrived, we went out to explore. We left the restaurant and carried on walking to the left for about 10 minutes, however there wasn't much down that way - the only thing we found of interest was Jamie Oliver's Fifteen restaurant. If you go to the right upon leaving the hotel, and carry on walking you get back to the train station. If you walk through the train station, you get into the centre of Amsterdam. There is nothing much in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, there was a gallery type shop and a segway shop, but both were hardly open while we were there. The train station has a decent convenience store inside that you can get various foods and refreshments from, and it also has various take away outlets: you can get a sandwich or pastries, pasta and pizza, noodles, etc. Most places have a few tables inside, but they are mainly take out outlets rather than restaurants. The Pizza place was very good, it was always busy and the pizza was always piping hot and fresh (you buy it in slices). Overall, the hotel was very good, it was clean, spacious and tastefully decorated. The staff are friendly, helpful and polite. It would be great for a business trip or for couples who don't mind staying out of the hustle and bustle of the city. It is in a good location, not far from the city centre and close to the train station (easy access for the airport). We would stay here again if we visited Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and views”
Reviews.Author: arana71
Reviews.Content: Can't complain at all about this hotel. The rooms are fine (a bit like an Ikea showroom) and all clean and modern. The location is slightly outside the city center, however it is very easy to walk or tram in quickly. We chose the location for the lack of noise, some hotels have stag parties happening right outside your window in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a city view”
Reviews.Author: Sarsenet
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern room with a very comfy bed, wall-mounted TV and tea/coffee facilities. I had a wonderful view of the city from my room on the 12th floor. Trams 25 and 24 (?) stop opposite the hotel and stop at the station and further into the city. There aren't really any 'local' facilities such as bars or restaurants immediately close to the hotel, but nothing is far from anywhere in Amsterdam. Don't walk up the large ramp to get to the hotel reception; you need to wallk to the ground floor entrance!

Reviews.Title: “Won on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: TZMOM
Reviews.Content: We were only in town for 3 days (2 nights) and I got pneumonia whilst there, so one full day was spent in bed. The TV's didn't work in both rooms. We moved to another room the 2nd night since TV didn't work (were upgraded to a suite) and one of the TV's in the 2nd room didn't work. Hopefully, that problem will get straightened out shortly. The staff tried their best to find solutions, but this complaint was nothing new. The hotel itself was very nice and I loved the views and being able to watch a ship dock. Ordered room service and the food was fine. I think if the weather had been nicer, it would have been a much better walk to the center - we didn't take the tram as we like to walk - in hindsight, we should have gotten tram passes. All in all, if I got this hotel again on Priceline, I would be pleased. FYI - the day I was sick was a horrible weather day - the windows/building can withstand much wind!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for streetwise travellers like me”
Reviews.Author: tobycaesar
Reviews.Content: only 1 tram stop from city centre and free shuttle from Cetraal station make this hotel a great deal and far better than the rip off city centre location so called 4 and 5* hotels. took advice from previous reviewers and ordered room service for breakfast we paid 10 euros for 1 omelette and a crossant and jam( buffet breakfast was 23 euros!! although most hotels in Amsterdam have very similar charging policies) didn't order tea or coffee at 6 euros per pot. used the in room tea/coffee maikng facilities. Paid 270 euros for 3 nights and would have cost nearly 500 euros for the park plaza hotel just 1 tramstop away!! a good saving as your money doesn't go very far in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Matt6825
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel in December 2011 and stayed there for 1 night. The hotel is fantastic. Everything seems brand new and spotlessly clean. The hotel was reasonably priced and felt like a premium hotel. The room was lovely, quite large and the bathroom was fantastic. The TV had the biggest range of channels I have seen in a hotel which included BBC1, 2, ITV and sports channels as well as channels in German, French and Italian. The staff were very polite and helpful. The location is about 10 minutes walk away central station. This makes it one of the most centrally located major chain hotel. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus during the day to and from central station. Overall, great hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, friendly staff and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Alexi_Vangerven
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night in this hotel. the view was very nice (15th floor). nice and spacious room with all comfort. free wifi works perfect. the location is also very good. 1 tram stop away from the centre. breakfast was perfect. everything you need was there. TIP: do not use the parking in front of the hotel 50 EUR/night. there is a parking 3 stops away for only 8 EUR/night.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, relatively central location”
Reviews.Author: allanbowers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in January. The condition of the hotel is excellent. The rooms are relatively large and look out over the water and the city. Whilst the hotel isn't exactly at Dam Square it is a relatively short walk to Central Station (the hotel also run a complimentary bus to and from the station). In addition to this there is a tram stop opposite the hotel should you want to use public transport. The breakfast is the usual standard fair. Plenty of different options for you. The dining room can get quite busy (they open up other sections of the room to suit). The sports facilities (including two saunas) are open 24 hours a day. This is a bonus when you get back to the hotel soaked through. A swimming pool would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: kiaat
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel often on business and I like that the service is efficient and friendly without being too involved in your stuff (if you are on business it needs to be functional). The views are great from the upper floors and both sides of the hotel are nice, but I like the city facing view. Sometimes there is a cruise ship there and it boards very early in the morning so you might hear funny music and announcements. Ask ahead as the hotel should know if this is planned. A great stay and the hotel does not feel like it is part of a chain of hotels for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with ok location”
Reviews.Author: chicagoball
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite modern and with very good service. Had a room with an excellent view of IJ Bay. The room is modern with a large bed and sofa. Internet is free (for 4 hour blocks) and decent bandwidth. Bathroom is modern and very continental. Includes a bathtub with half glass enclosure, which doesn't really contain the splash from taking a vigorous shower. However, the negative issue is the temperature of the water, it isn't consistent. Not a big issue but a little annoying, especially for a well designed, modern fitted interior. The buffet breakfast (I think was EUR 24) was excellent and a very good spread. Delicious and well thought out. You can also have a continental breakfast at the bar downstairs of coffee, croissant and orange juice for EUR 7 or so. The bar downstairs is quite nice and has a good selection of beers. The bartenders are great, helpful and ensures your glasses aren't empty. As for location, a few minutes drive from Centraal Station. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the station twice per hour. I found myself taking taxis from Leidseplein, et al as it was easier than tramming or walking back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views but not so convenient”
Reviews.Author: kiwiB
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased about the quality of the hotel, our 15th floor room was spacious, clean, tastefully decorated, had heaps of English TV channels, and the best thing was the vast view of the City. This being my 4th visit to Amsterdam I did find that compared to staying in cheap central hostels or hotels that the location was a little far out to easily walk to attractions, especially when it's cold and raining but it's much more comfortable once in the hotel! The concierge run a shuttle to the train station every 30 minutes which you need to book in advance, so this was a good option a couple of times as there are good connections to trams at the station, or there is one tram that comes more infrequently outside the hotel. We didn't drive and hence didn't need parking, but when we were checking in I heard reception explaining to another guest that there isn't any parking agreement and that it cost â‚¬22pd to park near the hotel- this sounded quite expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service, ok location”
Reviews.Author: adam2pac
Reviews.Content: The hotel inside is nice and comfortable. It's nothing spectacular in terms of looks or luxury but its very good. The check in time was 15:00 but I arrived at 12:00 and checked into my room without any problems. Also at checkout my flight was late in the evening so I asked if I could stay till 14:00 instead of checking out at the normal time of 12:00 and the staff were really accommodating and were happy to arrange this without incurring any extra charge. The location is the most controversial issue. It can be perceived as perfect or unacceptable, it all depends on your needs. Its a 15 minute walk to Centraal station and there is a free shuttle every 30 mins from the hotel until 19:30. If you want to be close to everything and in the middle of the hustle or Amsterdam, then this hotel is not for you. However, if you want to spend time in the center and then want to get away from it all at night, then the location is perfect. Personally for me, it wasn't ideal. The room service and restaurant were pretty expensive in my opinion but there is a subway down the road. One thing I really did like about the hotel was that it is part of a green scheme called Green Key. So they are actively trying to go green. One way this is done is they change bedsheets every other day and dont wash towels unless you leave them off the rails. The rooms were well lit, with a kettle, safe, fridge, tea bags etc. The one thing I did expect was complimentary water bottles but they didn't provide this. There is a nice sofa like place to sit in the room which I really liked and the tv has many english channels including BBC and ITV. The bath and shower were good as well and housekeeping overall did a good job. This hotel is a strictly non smoking hotel. The best part about the hotel are the staff, very friendly and always smiling. You cant beat Dutch hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: burroontour
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is one of our favourite cities, it has something for everyone and such a romantic place. We visit Amsterdam often and always book via Priceline Name Your Own Price as we know the city well and nowhere would be a bad location for us. This is the first time we've 'won' the Movenpick, I was hoping for the Amrath or NH Centre as they are both great hotels. I was a little dissapointed when I 'won' the Movenpick as I know the location isn't perfect. The hotel was very nice, we requested a high up room with a view which is exactly what we got, a 9th floor room with a city and river view. Typical high quality that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Very modern room, kettle, nice bathroom, the best TV and range of English channels we've had on holiday. The big drawback is the location, we hired bikes from Star bikes which is a couple of minutes from the hotel. Cycling in Amsterdam is brilliant once you get used to the foot brakes! On foot things aren't too far, central station is about 8 mins, red light district 10 mins, dam square 15/20 mins so nothing too far. However, when raining it's quite a trek and one day it rained all day. On our rainy day we ordered room service, this was poor quality and I wouldn't recommend, the restaurant looked nice though. There is a tram stop nearby so transport isn't impossible. It is quite isolated though, there is a Subway nearby but nothing else within 10 mins. Overall I wouldn't choose to stay here, there are equally as nice hotels in better locations. I personally prefer to stay nearer Leidesplein/Vondel Park. If I 'won' it again on Priceline, I wouldn't mind as the price is good and you take that risk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with good views”
Reviews.Author: Leap5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three nights stay at the Movenpick and cannot fault the hotel or service. We arrived a few hours earlier than the 3pm check in but this was no problem we checked in straight away. The front staff were very friendly. On check in we had been given an executive room on the top (20th) floor. We were in room 2002 and would ask to stay in this room again. The views over the city were stunning. We could see central station which was only a 15 minute walk away, the town and the boats on the canal tours. Probably the best view possible for all the fireworks at new year. The room was spacious and beds very comfortable. You have a choice of five pillows, I choose the anti allergy pillow as the ones on the bed had feather in them. (as soon as I went to reception to get changed they came straight to my room and offered to change all the bedding at the same time) Rooms are light, very clean and had a flat screen TV. Being in an executive room also came with extra's. We had free use of the mini bar within the room which had apple juice, water, coke and cans of heineken in it. We had fresh apples and fresh bottles of water left on the bedside tables each evening. Our curtains got closed each evening and the weather forcast for the following day was left along with two chocolates. If you are in the hotel between 5-7pm you can go down to the exective lounge on the second floor for free drinks, wine and snacks which we felt was a great extra. The food in the hotel is very good quality. It may seem a little expensive but I found amsterdam in general to be more pricey than back home. You can eat in the bar which is near the reception and where we choose to eat. I ordered a toasted chicken and bacon sandwich with egg and tomato a side of chips and a dip. My partner ordered chicken stir fry and for drinks a vodka and coke and pint of beer. The total cost was 41 euro. The other restuarant is on the 2nd floor and sells items like steak and veal. The location of the hotel is slightly out of the centre. You can see the main train station from the hotel and as mentioned above is a 15 minute walk. The station is then very close to dam square for its coffee shops and gift stores. Across the road from the hotel is a tram stop. You can catch the number 26 to central station. We caught this once and paid just 2.60 for an hour pass. The number 15 tram from central station takes you to the museums. A good hotel for all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, in an interesting alternative area of the city”
Reviews.Author: manywhere
Reviews.Content: I am just returning from a few days of vacation in Amsterdam. The Movenpick Amsterdam is a nice modern hotel, featuring all you can expect from an hotel in that category (nothing less, nothing more). This hotel should be recommanded to people who already know Amsterdam, and want to discover an alternative area of the city... but if you want an hotel viewing the charming channels of Amsterdam, you should consider another option. By the way, due to its situation, the Movenpick offers nice views over the bay (I guess that a very limited number of room might have poor view).
