Last, they offer: - a complementary shuttle from and to the Central Station (every other 30 min / on reservation); good to consider it if you carry heavy luggages... - free in-room wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit apprehensive about the location of the hotel due to some of the previous comments, however we found it to be in a perfect position overlooking the water, with lovely city views. We could walk to Dam Square in 10 mins or catch a tram outside the front door. The hotel was clean, modern, warm and the service was first class. The breakfast was superb but with so many places to eat in the city we never managed to sample their dinner menu. The luggage was stored free of charge for our late flight back to the uk from our lunch time check out. The staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. We would definately recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: difiona
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 27th Dec '11 for three nights. We got a good deal through easyjet holidays and as we have previously stayed at the Movenpick knew exactly what we were getting for our money. Despite some moans in other reviews we think the location is perfect. There is no noise (unlike if you stayed in the centre) and the hotel is certainly much newer than anything else in the centre. There is no pool but the facilities are very good. The breakfast is wholesome and an ideal way to start your day too before you go and explore the city. If you are going to do a canal trip then i'd recommend a company called Lovers. They do a nice 1h45m hop on hop off trip round the canals. Also a lovely place to eat is Restaurant Destra Del Ponte, Oude Hoogstraat 27, 1012 CD. The Airport train link to Amsterdam is quick (20mins) and regular and only costs Euro 4.20.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and great ice cream!”
Reviews.Author: nicciwoo
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick was in a great location for visiting all of the city's attractions. The views were also stunning at night! We had dinner in the restaurant, the food was excellent but the dessert was even better. We had Movenpick ice creams and were not disappointed! A great stay and we'd recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT in the City Center!!!”
Reviews.Author: mgeolina
Reviews.Content: PRICELINE WARNING: THIS HOTEL COUNTS AS IN THE CITY CENTER. While the hotel technically is at the edge of the city center, it is just that. On the absolute very edge within inches of being in the city center. After a winning bid and seeing the location, I complained to both the property and Priceline, both did nothing as expected. Bottom line, this is not even close to the main tourist, museum, park districts/areas. If its not nice walking weather out, you will have to take taxis everywhere, which are pricey in Amsterdam..better get yourself a bicycle. This is a sterile, utility-oriented, full-service facility best suited to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence all round”
Reviews.Author: rufusTetbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights mixing business with pleasure. In a good position just a few minutes walk to the Central Station. Tram stop outside, plus courtesy hopper bus available running at half hourly intervals. What makes this hotel stand out from the rest is the quality of it's service and staff. All the staff are professional and friendly, it is such a pleasure to be there. It really is service with a smile. All rooms have a good view are of a good size and have clean lines as well as being spotlessley clean. The breakfast is amazing! Absolutely everything you could wish for and more. We thought this was good value for money. Having stayed in three star hotels in the centre for the same price and being dissappointed, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous (definitely 4-star PLUS)”
Reviews.Author: Tourist709
Reviews.Content: We upgraded at check in to an executive room with benefits, giving us free minibar use, access to the executive lounge and a room on the highest (20th) floor with an amazing view over the water and the city. The food was outstanding and even the room service we ordered at 2 a.m. was fresh and simply delicious (and delivered in 10 minutes, don't understand how they do that). Unfortunately we could only stay for one night, but for sure we will be back!!! Thank you all for the warm welcome and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good enough location”
Reviews.Author: kmrau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Amsterdam Centraal station. If you prefer to use public transportation, the hotel is two stops away on the #25 tram line. Check in was efficient and uneventful. The room itself was functional but not overly luxurious. There isn't much to do or see near the hotel, but with the Centraal station close by, the rest of Amsterdam is quite accessible. I got a great deal on Priceline which made it a no-brainer for me. Even otherwise, I suspect the rates are quite reasonable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, new rooms, just a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelfamily4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and the rooms were great, we stayed on the executive floor and that was a nice perk. Cocktails and snacks were great in the evening. I would stay there again, however it is about 10 minutes to central station.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: sc43
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and always helpful. Rooms clean, well appointed, nice in every way. Comfortable beds. Good breakfast. Very modern. Located two blocks from the central train station, and in easy walking distance to most of Amsterdam's tourist spots. On the top of my list for a modern hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MÃ¶venpick Hotel Amsterdam in the end of November and I cannot complaint. There was warm welcome at reception, I had very nice and clean room, on the breakfast there was wide selection on juices, saussages, salamis, breds etc, and allover very very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxim G
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I always choose Moevenpick for my stay in Amsterdam - either business or with my wife and son. Perfect location, great breakfast, modern rooms and very responsive personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Meeting Event”
Reviews.Author: robconb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last week of Novemeber 2011 with a group of colleagues for a global conference. The Hotel team did and excelent job both in service delivery as well as the quality of F&B. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and location is just away from the Central Station. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the people who work there. Hospitality and assistance extended throughout the 3 days was really very good. Highly recommended for business or pleasure when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Real Four Star”
Reviews.Author: EchoBravo68
Reviews.Content: The quality of the Hotel, rooms, and staff are higher than the vast majority of hotels rated four star. Location is OK if you learn to use trollies and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & great service!”
Reviews.Author: Atomicfork
Reviews.Content: I'd like to thank the whole team of the hotel for the nice stay we had in July 2011. We got a room on the highest floor so the view was incredible! The sauna, the large and tasty breakfast, and the room itself (with a Nespresso machine it in) - everything was beyond our expectations, I'd give 6 stars to this hotel! The girl at the reception (too bad I didn't remember her name) was very helpful, explaining us what we can see in Amsterdam and the easiest way to get to parking/the center. We got a free update coz we booked a standard room but got an executive instead. I'd recommend it to everyone going on a business trip on a week day, or a city trip with their loved one on a weekend :-)

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2107
Reviews.Content: You walk into the Moevenpick Amsterdam and know that you have made the right choice. Right from the helpful concierge to the housekeeping and the food and beverage staff, everything was perfect. The location is the icing on the cake. One looks out of the window and the view is wonderful. One even sits in the restaurant and enjoys fantastic views of the water. It is close to the railway station, Centraal, also the tram station is just across the road, a short and pleasant walk. Great breakfast, huge choice which can satisfy the choosiest guest. Will definitely recommend this hotel to travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be misled by Outward appearances, very far and Stay if you want to have a numb back and wake up from construction noises”
Reviews.Author: Tyww
Reviews.Content: At first glance the hotel is beautiful and modern and I thought I scored some amazing deal on Hotwire. It's the 95% recommended Amsterdam east hotel. Everything was amazing until I got into the room. First of all, they gave me the lowest class of rooms available upon arrival late at night. Respectable hotels will just give you the best available room by this time, how many people are you expecting at midnight? Im by myself and they gave me two single beds, I had to change rooms in the middle of the night twice. The first time because the first bathroom smelled so rotten i wanted to throw up, and then i had to chabge rooms again to even get a room with a bathtub. I think I had to keep dragging my luggage up and down the hotel a few more times to get a room with a normal sized bed but I was too tired. The bed is incredibly hard, my entire body and my limbs were numb and i had to wake up constantly to turn my numb body so One part doesnt stay numb. After specifically asking for a quiet room I woke up from construction right next to me or above me! I eventually wake up extremely late and still extremely tired asking them to give me a room that is not next to the construction and has a normal sized bed and a tub and doesnt smell rotten. They were not accommodating and I had to check out and find somewhere else to stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: YorkGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: A group of 3 couples stayed here as part of a package from Hull with P&O Ferries. The hotel is in a good location for Centraal Station, its just 10 minutes walk or you can catch a tram (if they aren't on strike as they were for us!). It also means you can catch a tram to other parts of the city (No 25). Accommodation is excellent, lovely rooms, good size, very clean with sparkling bathroom. Didn't take any meals there but it is expensive to do so. Only gripe was at check-in when they wanted to sell us an upgrade at 65 Euros when our room would be ready straight away or wait 4 hours otherwise. The 65 Euros did include breakfast and an executive room but we didn't take them up on it. All in all a good experience and a nice quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant indeed!!”
Reviews.Author: Awordy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean, modern, friendly staff. Location isn't bad. 10 minute walk in to the centre or 5 minute tram journey. Rooms are clean, modern and have all the facilities you will need on a short stay (or long stay for that matter!). Don't get stuck behind a big group of people trying to use the lifts....they won't be able to do it because they won't read the instructions and blame everyone but themselves! Gets busy around check in time - 3pm - try and check in later to avoid a queue. Would highly recommend for weekend breaks and business trips.

Reviews.Title: “great view!”
Reviews.Author: helloenzo
Reviews.Content: arrived there late but the recepitionst upgraded our rooms as there is no two standard rooms next to each other.!!And we got the room with great river side view! The port in the morning is really beautiful and calm.Don't miss that! The location is close to the center and they offer free shuttle bus to the train station(you can also take no 25 to get there, only two stops) but there is no happening around, no restaurant, no night life.Though it is quite close to the train station, we paid 25 euros for taxi back from the center after party..

Reviews.Title: “good experienc”
Reviews.Author: anniefanny
Reviews.Content: We got lucky with this hotel in Amsterdam. We actually had no idea where it was, but we were able to find it easily from the train station. It is located opposite the Muziekgebow tram stop.We actually were able to walk to the station area . Instead of having a noisy, not so clean hotel, we were able to enjoy a very, very clean hotel, with soundproofed rooms. It is beautifully decorated in contemporary style, with very clean lines. Our room was very comfortable, with great beds. There is free WI-FI everywhere in the hotel. We were almost beside our cruiseship, which made it so easy to walk to. It was nice to be able to get away from the busy, noisy, dirty area where a lot of the other hotels seem to be situated. I would certainly stay there again and would advise our friends to pick that hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, a little out the way”
Reviews.Author: young_travellers90
Reviews.Content: 1t let me say this hotel is great, very comfy beds, excellent amenities and very good service, however it is a 15 minute brisk walk from central station, 25 if you walk at normal pace, there was a bike rental place under the hotel that for â‚¬12,50 you could hire a bike for 24 hours which in my opinion is the best way to travel around Amsterdam. one thing to point out is there is a â‚¬50 deposit that no one seems to warn you about, you do get it refunded on the last day, however be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: lws83
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely situated just outside the centre but only took 10-15 minute walk to get there or quick tram ride and lots to see on way. Had a lovely view over the dock and city, room was very clean and staff were brilliant. We ordered breakfast in our room and it was great, not too expensive either. We also ate in the Silk bar which was also good. All the staff were very friendly and helpful we were able to check in early too . The room was so quiet, no noise at all and black out blinds, slept really well. Lots to do in Amsterdam we were here four days and just enough time to get round everything we wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: gazzerooni
Reviews.Content: The Moevenpick is located along the docks down from the Central Train station. It is a modern new building with all that that entails, such as decent sized rooms and good sound insulation. My friends were the ones who booked this and I was not sure about the location at the start as I thought it was a little out of the way. However I need not have worried as it was very accessible. The tram stops outside and is only one stop from the station. The 25 tram goes down near the main street- Spuistraat- so its easy to get into the heart of the old city. There was also a taxi rank outside which we used at night- it was a tenner to get to the Supperclub and Kantjil from the hotel. Another review mentions that its an ugly industrial area but I thought it was a nice walk along the waterfront. You can walk through the red light district but this is after the station so not necessary. All the staff were very courteous and professional. I asked one of the check-in staff to confirm our restaurant booking at Kantjil -I couldn't get through on my mobile -which he promptly did. Very helpful. I had my own room- I got a good rate from booking through the hotel website. The room was very clean and the bed was really comfortable. The tvs were being changed to flatscreens on my floor- the 16th - the day I arrived. There were several English channels according to my friends- I didnt check this out though. The bathroom was very clean and the shower was good. There was shower gel and shampoo provided as well as plenty of towels. There was loads of storage space for clothes as well as a safe. The view from my room was lovely too- it helped that it was sunny outside. We had a drink in the bar when we arrived. The barman was friendly and it was busy when were there. It wasnt that cheap but it was good for a quick drink on the way out. There were eight of us staying in 5 rooms and everyone really liked the hotel. I think it is a little out of the center but you have to balance this against the building being modern and quiet. I have stayed in Amsterdam twice before and there was a lot of street noise on the weekends. I slept really well here too and never heard any noise from other rooms or the corridor. There are four lifts and they could be quite busy but I never seemed to wait more than a minute. They were very quick at getting between the lobby and the 16th floor too. We all arrived at different times but we were all checked in immediately despite all arriving before the 3pm check-in time. One of my friends arrived at 10am and still got into his room straight away. One odd thing was that I arrived with one of my friends and she was upgraded to the Executive floor with her husband. She said she didnt request this so it seemed a bit arbitrary. I think she had a Nespresso machine in her room. The check-in assistant did comment as she checked her in, saying that they didnt realise we were all together. Strange but nice for my friends. We were all able to leave our baggage in storage after check-out. We did have the option to keep the room until 6pm for an extra â‚¬50. I would stay here again if I go to Amsterdam as its clean, well-run and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Israelitourist t
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a super friendly staff. Sabine, Sarah and Bianaca (like jagger's ex wife) were all so helpful and professional. The location is great - 15 minute walk to dam square, 10 minute walk from station and very close to trams if you don't want to walk. Great breakfast and if you can afford it and want to really live it up - get an executive room - you get all kinds of goodies including free coffee and drinks all day - hot really tasty snacks from 1700-1900 and all kinds of free stuff like free high speed internet and mini bar. The location is great and so is the staff - so helpful and friendly. Breakfast was amazing. MOST IMPORTANT - call the hotel and ask for specials - I received an amazing deal that was not available via any other site like hotels.com etc. Call and ask for specials!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and good base outside the centre”
Reviews.Author: AussieLondon362
Reviews.Content: A sleek modern hotel which is geared more towards Business types and conferences. Having said that the customer service was excellent and always keen to ensure that people were not left waiting too long when queuing for the concierge service. We had a room on the 17th floor (we requested a room on a high floor and got it) which had lovely views across the river and town. The room was nice and modern with tea and coffee making facilities and free wifi. Hot water was a little temperamental with the bathroom sink either cold or hot hot hot! The main low point was the flat pillows but I would just recommend requesting a second pillow. It is a bit further out from town (which I knew in advance) and a lengthy walk away but the free shuttle bus to Central station (every 30 minutes) was a nice touch especially when we wanted to head into town for dinner and couldn't be bothered getting the tram again. Ultimately we weren't fussed about the location as trams were only a 5 minute walk across the road with the no. 25 going to the centre and the no. 26 taking you to the station. When going back to the hotel from central station I would recommend getting the 26 which leaves from the front of the station whereas the 25 stop is further to the left and only comes every 15 minutes. You can buy tram tickets from the gift shop. Overall it was a great base which was nice and quiet because it was away from the hustle and bustle of the centre town. if you get a good rate go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucy b
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband went for our yearly visit to amsterdam and stayed at this hotel for a change.It has lovely rooms with everythink you need inside,And lovely foods offered through out the day! There was a free suttel bus to and from the hotel which was ok but got full very quick so be sure too book a slot at reception. Internet was free but you had to stand up and us it,And there was a little gift shop inside.There is a smoking area out the back of the hotel which was ok for a fag!!! It was not a great location as a bit far from the town ect but staff and everythink about the hotel is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with slight drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: aob2
Reviews.Content: Arrived here for a 2 night stay but as we arrived early in the morning and were exhausted we rang the hotel to ask if they may actually have a room ready for us before the check in time and were told that it should not be a problem and to come to the hotel and they would look after it. We arrived and were told that nobody gets rooms until the check in time at 3pm but that they would ring us when the room was ready. Got no phonecall and we came back at 3.30pm to get the keys. Aside from that initial hiccup, the hotel was very good and the rooms were comfortable. Location-wise, it is a bit out of the way but there is plenty of public transport and taxi's and even bike rental outside. Also, breakfast was not included in our rate but we decided to get it one morning. Found out upon checking out that it was by far the most expensive breakfast I have ever had! Booked the hotel via hotwire.com as one of it's secret hotels so the price was very good for the overall stay and overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. A bit far”
Reviews.Author: guiafonso
Reviews.Content: During our trip we stayed at 2 different hotels in Amsterdam. Moevenpick was a lot better. Comfortable room, great shower, friendly service. The down side is that you need to take a Tram (25 or 26) to reach downtown. Got it from Priceline, so I can't complain about the price. Got a terrific deal. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not very central”
Reviews.Author: 67traveller
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the good reviews and a great deal we found online. Firstly, although not far from Centraal Station (900m to be precise), it is not close enough to pop back to drop off shopping bags or quickly change. Yes they do put on a shuttle minibus to the station, but it's just as handy to take the tram which is more or less opposite the hotel (we bought a travel pass which we used more than we thought we would). The hotel room was quiet and spacious, which was good as 3 of us were sharing. On the down side, the third bed was a sofa bed, which we knew about in advance so it wasn't a surprise, what was a surprise was how uncomfortable it was. When making the reservation we asked for a room on a high floor (we'd heard the views were particularly good) - when checking-in we repeated this wish, but we were told the room was already made up and we were on the 3rd floor. We went along with it, but it wasn't really said very nicely and it is a 4* hotel after all, and the hotel certainly wasn't full. A little effort would have gone a long way. The bar was very comfy and the service good, as was the food. Don't expect lots of restaurants and animation around the hotel though, there is Jamie Oliver's 15 restaurant a 5-minute walk away and what looked like a nice Italian restaurant, but that is basically it. I don't know if I would stay there again if I were to return to Amsterdam (which is a fabulous city by the way, so much to see and do - definitely worth getting the IAmsterdam card or Holland Pass). There was nothing really wrong with the hotel, but it is a bit far out of the central buzz of the city.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JC_and_JS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MÃ¶venpick Amsterdam one night in October 2011. It is a modern hotel close to the river at a 15 min walk from the Central Station, and a 20 minutes walk to the city center. Yes, it is a bit outside the city center, but thatâ€™s probably the only minus point we noticed, and let us be honest: 20 minutes walk to the center is not so far. The rooms were very new, so was the bathroom. We asked for a room on a floor as high as possble and got one without any problem. What we appreciated the most however, was the breakfast buffet at mornings, which mets the best far east standards we experienced yet: the choise of food was almost unlimited, the quality excellent. If you donâ€™t mind a good walk, this hotel has an excellent price/quality. And just make sure you donâ€™t miss breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Catagory
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and daughter in the Hotel. I found the booking experience very easy thanks to Bianca in the reservation department. The Hotel is a short walk from the Central Rail Station, about 10 minutes, or the tram passes the door. The Hotel is not right in the City, but can be seen from the Station. It is on the side of the river. It is a corporate style hotel. The staff are very friendly and all spoke English. It is a very clean hotel. We were on a top floor and had a superb view of the City and River. There is a Fitness Centre and Sauna. They have a shuttle bus which will take you to the Station. The beds and bedding are very comfortable. The only complaint I had about the Hotel is that breakfast was not included, although I knew that when I booked. If breakfast had been included, and at the price I paid I think it should have been, I would have awarded 5 stars. There was an option to buy breakfast, but at 22 Euros I thought it too expensive. I would stay at the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not City Center”
Reviews.Author: JenandDani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week when we were in Amsterdam for a holiday, and also for the Amsterdam Marathon. The location - TERRIBLE. The only reason you would want to stay here is if you were attending a conference at this hotel. Or if you were using the ferry port nearby. It is definitely not city center. The walk into the Amsterdam center is not far - only 10-15 minutes. To be fair the hotel also does offer a shuttle to the Central Train Station. You will definitely not be in the middle of the action, and walking back and forth gets tiresome. The rooms was very nice, obviously recently renovated. It was a bit odd as there was two single beds pushed together - we were told at the front desk that if pushed together they make the double bed. Well - it's not really a double bed if you wake up in a crack between two beds in the middle of the night. Another odd thing was the TV was very old. For such a modern facility and nice room, it didn't seem to fit. They need to invest in some new, modern TVs. It adds a lot to the atmosphere and status of a room, in my opinion. Further more the bath product was terrible. There was shampoo/body wash. Two in one. And it smelled very definitely like male bath product. Very masculine. In addition, there was no conditioner. Room service was actually quite reasonable, and we often ordered a pot of coffee (6 Euros) to start our day. Don't bother with the restaurant. It is overpriced and not that great. On one occasion the wrong meal arrived at our table. The waiter offered to give me a drink, which I said I wasn't interested in, but perhaps a dessert. We received dessert, which was on the bill. Very disappointing. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant is 23euros per person. There is no other option for breakfast. If you want something small and quick, you are much better off ordering room service to be delivered. The fitness facility is very good. There is a variety of exercise equipment. There are two separate saunas - Traditional Finnish and more humid biosauna. There is no pool of any kind. We don't really care for a pool anyway, but if you had children there they would probably not have much fun! There is literally nothing nearby, unless you fancy Subway for dinner. The concert house down the street is home to a restaurant which is open for dinner. No breakfast is available. The restaurant is very expensive and does not have much selection. Finally. We booked this hotel through a discount hotel service and paid a fraction of the advertised rate. If we had paid full price for this hotel we would have been extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location...a few minutes from the central station.”
Reviews.Author: punjabikudi
Reviews.Content: The USP of the Movenpick hotel is its location.It is situated right in the center of the city,a few minutes from the central station.(On last day of our stay me and mom walked from the central station to the hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed the walk).The first station from the central station is The Movenpick hotel. The tram stop is just across the road.The view from the hotel is lovely.As we were on the 17th floor we had a good view of the city,windmills and the Amstel river. The room service is also nice,we stayed there for 3 days and had no complaints as such.As for the food is concerned we didnâ€™t have it in the hotel .There is a Subway fast food restaurant ,we had our breakfast there and rest of the meals in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: The better half surprised me with a trip to Amsterdam for my birthday and this was the hotel that she chose. Firstly 'City Centre' is a bit of a misnomer as the hotel is at least a 1km walk to Centraal Station (and henceforth onto the real centre) and some of this being uphill as you have to cross a bridge. True, one can take the tram there as a stop is quite near but it seems a bit of a waste. Secondly entrance to the hotel for pedestrians is a little awkward as you have to walk around a 'dock' (so to speak) in front of the hotel to reach it. Obviously neither of these two things would be a problem for anyone arriving via car. We arrived from Centraal Station and made our way to the hotel, arriving at 12pm. Although check-in was a few hours away we hoped that our room would be ready so we could go and freshen up. However, this was not the case even though the preceeding couple checking in before us were given their card keys. Odd. I'm a pretty laid back guy so I saw no need to kick up a fuss, but I did find this strange. After a bit of sight seeing we returned and were able to check in. Our room was on the 18th floor and had a (not very spectacular!) view of the City. The room however, was large with a comfortable bed with space in the mini-bar for our own food and drink. The bathroom was equally spacious and had a bath (always good to have a soak after traipsing round all day! Breakfast wasn't included so I can't comment upon that. But the desk staff were polite and the concierges were effortlessly friendly and helpful. As previously reviewers have noted the WiFi in the room is a bit slow but we were only using our smart phones so it wasn't a big deal. The hotel is adjacent to the new passenger terminal so the hotel is an ideal place to stay for anyone embarking or disembarking from one of the many cruise ships which dock there. Be warned though - we were awoken on our first morning by a PA annoucement on the ship which had arrived during the night! There apparently is a shuttle bus that runs between the hotel and Centraal Station but we didn't use it because we never saw it (it only runs every hour supposedly!) Overall, not a bad hotel if you don't mind a bit of extra walking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: traveller_constant
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here for 4 nights on business. On arrival, I specifically asked for a quiet room. The first 2 nights were great, my room was very nice, much better appointed than the average business hotel and very quiet, despite overlooking a busy road, railway and tramline. Breakfast, room service etc were all very good, staff were helpful and there was free wi-fi. Colleagues in higher rooms had lovely views along the main shipping canal, although otherwise the hotel is in an industrial area with nothing around unless you travel into the city centre, 10 mins away by tram. However, on the 3rd night (a Thursday) I returned to my room at 11pm and discovered that there was a nightclub playing incredibly loud music in the building next door. It was so loud that the whole room was shaking with the bass notes. Sleep would have been absolutely impossible. On ringing reception I discovered that the building with the club was normally a passenger terminal for cruise liners (so no soundproofing, as a normal nightclub would have) but 3 or 4 times a year it hosts a series of dance events. The really bad news was the music would go on until 5am and this would continue for the next 2 nights. I was told at first that there were no free rooms, but I persisted and eventually was offered a room on the same side as the club but 12 floors higher. This was no better, and the bathroom smelt of sewage, so I complained again, asking to be moved to the other side of the hotel. Once more I was told there were no free rooms, but then one was found - smaller than my original room but I didn't care. Even on the 19th floor and the other side, the music was still audible, but was sufficiently quiet that I was able to sleep - briefly, as by now it was past 1am and I had to be up again for a meeting at 6am. Several of my colleagues, who were less pushy than I, had been told there were no rooms elswhere and had been fobbed off with earplugs. They hadn't slept at all. The staff were very apologetic and said they hadn't known about the club event. This surprised me, as there were large billboards outside the passenger terminal advertising 'Battle of 100 DJs'. I hadn't noticed them on my arrival at the hotel, but surely the manager should make it their business to notice, especially if these music events occur at intervals throughout the year? If I had been warned in advance I would have moved hotels and ensured my colleagues did likewise. At the very least, having asked for a quiet room, I should have been booked into the other side of the hotel in the first place. I was left exhausted for the remainder of the trip. On the plus side, I was offered a small bar of Movenpick chocolate as compensation!! I didn't know whether to laugh or cry, but at least my kids enjoyed eating it when I got home.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale stay”
Reviews.Author: pekka n
Reviews.Content: Free internet is painfully slow, upgrade costs 15â‚¬ / day. Other than that the hotel is nice. Good service and location.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: viewsonic321
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in july drinks and food and hotel way overpriced we had free breakfast at the hotel but had to wait for ages while there so the hotel could confirm this this was annoying breakfast i found average hotel was clean and good views from room but thats about it and i would not return dam station easy to get to by tram one stop i think and free mini bus to station by hotel was good but you have to book in advance it goes every 30mins also went to the gym what a joke stuff missing on weight stuff got to be the worse gym i have ever seen

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Charles N
Reviews.Content: The hotel's meeting rooms and restaurant are idyllic but the overall look is a dissapointment. View from the room over the canal was impressive though. My "king" bed was two double beds pushed together but the deal breaker was the continuos noise coming from an event located near the hotel. When I called the front desk at 1 AM, the attendant casually told me that the event would last until 5 AM and all she could do is to give me ear plugs. Perhaps the management at the Moevenpick could not predict how a continuous bass beat could resonate through their hotel and even up to my 19th floor, but they get an 'F' for empathy. I'm checking out tomorrow and going to the Radisson

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nbmortimer
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at the Amsterdam Movenpick, attending a business conference. Everything about my stay was ideal. My room was well-appointed, with a great view out over the Ij. The conference facilities were first rate. The buffet meals were all terrific, with a wide selection of offerings. In addition, I loved the location: right on the Ij, near Central Station, and the great concert hall next door, a short walk to the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel - couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: BigBreenger
Reviews.Content: we had an all too brief stay at the movenpick recently and really enjoyed it. it's a little bit out of the central area but they operate a free shuttle bus that will pick you up from and drop you off at central station in less than 5 minutes, so there's no great issue at all. it's also walkable to / from central station in about 15 minutes but that would depend on the weather! front desk staff very helpful and informative and the generously sized room had a great view of the city. loved the half price cocktails in the bar on friday night - sadly, the promo is only on for an hour but maybe that's just as well ! we will definitely reurn to the movenpick in the future and i recommend it to anyone reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “Good, also for conferances”
Reviews.Author: yogimo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference. Rooms are quite large and with all the usual things equipped. Bathroom is also quite well sized, but only with a bathtub. If you take a shower, the bathroom floor might get wet. TV has the usual channels with CNN and a few German channels, but it is quite small. Internet is free for speeds up to 500 kb/s, so if you have a larger file you need to buy it at around Euro 15 or so per day. It is WLAN based though out the hotel, expect for the lobby. In the room is also a LAN connector and cable. Log on is a bit annoying, as you first log on, then get a password, then you need to log on further with a new password and name. Food was OK, nothing special, but good. Breakfast was also good and plenty of choices. There was a minibar in the room, but it is empty. You need to order stuff though room service. Which is a pity, because at least I expect a water bottle in the room. There is a 15 min walk to the train station. If the weather is good, it is no problem. Taxi from the airport will cost about Euro 50 and it takes about 30 min. The train costs less than Euro 5 and takes also 30 min or less. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Good Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TwinCityTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to stay at this hotel for a few days this summer. The hotel is new, clean, and comfortable. The rooms are spacious and have great views of the IJ river. They accepted our priceline bid of $85/night (plus taxes) and this was a fantastic deal considering the amenities and the great location. The hotel is close to the Centraal Train Station and there is a free shuttle if you'd prefer not to make the 10 minute walk. From the station, it is easy to catch trams to anywhere in Amsterdam (and trains to anywhere in the Netherlands). There are two music venues (the Muziekgebouw and the Bimhuis) in the same complex as the hotel featuring classical and jazz performances.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: ort s
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a good locaion. and there is walking distence to most atractions. wether was terrible but this is the wether in amsterdam... rooms were nice we were upgrated to the executive floor and we had nice view. front desk staff were nice and helpful. rates are expencive but the hotel is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel in September in executive room. Great view and amenities. Staff very responsive to requests. Great location on water, tram just outside of hotel and within walking distance to Central Station. Would highly recommend. Very convenient hotel to location where river boat cruises depart/arrive in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaKoftoun
Reviews.Content: Im writing my review as I am still staying here, because I know that when I check-out I just will never find the time to write a post, and it would be a pitty because this hotel is really worth it. My criteria are quite strict on liking a hotel, probably because I work in a sphere of five star hotels, usually leading hotels of the world, and I am used to expecting the best service, food and accommodation, that is why my comments are based truly in comparison with a lot of other hotels, and from a hotelier perspective. The check-in was good, not extremely welcoming I could say, but very efficient, informative and pleasant. The room is absolutely fantastic: modern, comfortable beds (from which it was so difficult to get up at 6am!), nice standing shower and a beautiful view to the Amstel from my room on the 18th floor! The conference facilities are modern, but quite typical in a good way. The food - absolutely incredible; both room service and the Silk Road restaurant. Now the service, deserves a separate paragraph. Honestly - it got me to say a 'wow' at one point. At the restaurant, the girls where extremely friendly, engaged on a personal level with me, and where very efficient. The room service - not only did they greet me by name, asked how my sleep was, but also engaged in a friendly manner some questions about my stay and why I was up this early. And bravo to that! Many leading hotels have a standard of service - i.e, always use guest's name etc and ask some standard questions, but that's what I loved about this hotel is that, even not being part of them, they were completely within the frames of the standards, and they still exceeded my expectations. So my honest suggestion to you is, if your traveling - stay here. It's easy to get to the center, a beautiful hotel and fantastic service. Oh, and free Wi-Fi. My stay is quite short, checking-out on wednesday, but I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: YF212
Reviews.Content: Stayed six days on Executive floor. Room and bathroom were of good size. The decor was very new and clean. Very comfortable bed with down comforter. In-room nespresso machine and capsules. Great view from the room overlooking a concert hall next door facing the waterfront. Staff were polite and generally helpful. Hotel would help arrange shuttle to airport at very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KickinKath
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through last minute.com as a secret hotel, you basically don't know the name of the hotel until after you pay for it and due to this it is normally discounted quite a bit. Due to this I was a bit apprehensive about the hotel however, there was no need to be the hotel is great and I have no problems recommending it to anyone. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus service from central station and I had arranged this with them beforehand by emailing them, they turned up on time and took us straight to the hotel which is only about a 10 min walk from central station. When we arrived at the hotel the reception staff checked us in quickly and gave us some maps and info leaflets and told us how to catch the tram etc which was very handy. The rooms are spacious and very nice, bathroom was spotless, all in all I couldn't fault the hotel, it was a nice pleasant experience staying there and I would definitely go back again

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Coach95
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Near the water (from my room I saw a cruise ship come in to port), walk to the trams, or Central Station, close to downtown, as well as they have a complimentary shuttle and breakfast. The staff are friendly in informative. The room had everything you could ask for, up to date, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: DimplesMo
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick is a short 10 minute walk from Centraal Station, making it close to the city centre. The room was clean and spacious, although a little pricey if you are planning to spend not a lot of time there. The bar was nice, and the food in the restaurant was fantastic, especially the fishcakes and steak. The bar and restaurant are quite expensive, but probably not more so than a comparable hotel. There was also a fridge in the room if you wanted to buy your own drinks for in-room. Being slightly outside the centre also meant it was quiet, although you could hear trains in the distance but they didn't disturb our sleep. Now I know Amsterdam a bit better I would probably pick a canal street to be more central but would recommend this hotel. My only complaint would be the pillows which seemed to have no substance, however we didn't get round to mentioning this, but I expect if we had it would have been rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Best pre-cruise hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: cwuer
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel pre-cruise, look no further. You literally walk out the front door and a few steps to your left and drop off your luggage and board the ship. How convenient is that? But beyond that this hotel is amazing. We were upgraded to a corner room with gorgeous view of the harbor. Our cruise ship was docked right outside our window when we woke up the next day. The front desk was so friendly and helpful. I found the location, while not exactly right in the city, to be very good. The tram is just down the street and you are in the city in 5 minutes, and hey the tram ride is fun! I left my Kindle in the room and housekeeping turned it in. Thank you housekeeping!! We did eat in the restaurant and have drinks in the bar, and while yes it was pricey at least it was really good! Everything is expensive in Amsterdam so it was not a shocker. The bar was hopping, fun atmosphere and it was a week night at that. The rooms were large, clean, modern, and the shower ahhhhh so good. I would stay here again in a second no matter what the reason for visiting this great city, but if it were pre-cruise this is the only place I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moevenpick Hotel last week, and were quite happy with it. The room was quite large and quite roomy. It had everything that we needed, and when we asked for more pillows, they were in the room when we returned from dinner. The front desk people were terrific and so were the bell people. They gave us a fantastic place for dinner, in walking distance to the hotel. You are in walking distance to the tram and train station, to get into the center of town. This was at the end of our trip, and we are from the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with views of the city and the water.”
Reviews.Author: shaldongirl
Reviews.Content: Big rooms with great views of the city and the water. Not in the centre of Amsterdam but the tram stops a few metres away and one stop to central station. There is also a free hotel shuttle service to central station during the daytime - just ask the Concierge. Quiet location, away from the hustle and bustle of it all. Clean rooms, professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BLSKailuaHawaii
Reviews.Content: Just home from a 6 night stay at the Movenpick. Love the location at the cruise ship terminal. Easy access to the train station and downtown. Food was great--especially loved the breakfasts. (Samantha in the restaurant is the best!!!) Would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Moevenpick hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dbrh79
Reviews.Content: I booked this room as part of a package via Easyjet, alongwith flights. I was very impressed with the room, as other people who have been to Amsterdam always said the hotel rooms were tiny. It was clean and a very decent size. Ours was a twin, and I was sharing with a friend. The tariff includes breakfast, and I can honestly say its the best breakfast Ive ever had. There was nothing missing. I would recommend if youre booking to go with the room and breakfast option, because buying breakfast when its not inclusive is pricey. The only downside to the room, and I understand this is everywhere in Amsterdam, is that the bathroom door is just frosted glass, and doesnt have a latch. It's just a swing door, which can be a pain if youre not a couple. The location is pretty central, about 20mins into the centre, and a tramline right outside. But be warned its about a 7-8min walk to the tram outside the hotel, because of the way it's laid out with the river to go over, roads, tram lines and then your tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive and house keeping needs improving!!”
Reviews.Author: decosp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a triple room. Check in starts at 3pm. I arrived at 1pm and would be a bonus if the room was ready (which wasnt) but I was ofered an upgrade with breakfast and free drinks which If I had accepted Im sure they would have a room ready for me. They offered to store my luggage and later I came back and the room was "ready". On arrival at the room there were only 2sets of towells and the sofabed hasnt been made so I had to call reception and 30mins later they arrived with more towells and made the sofabed. On the second day similar problem: only 2 sets of yowells so again called reception.... The triple room wasnt huge but it was ok for the three of us. Free wi-fi Free shuttle to the station was good but u can always get the tram in front of the hotel - 1stop to the station. Im sure you can find a cheaper hotel with better service than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tripster08_8
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel after a cruise. We could walk from the ship to the hotel and to many points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a cruise jump off point”
Reviews.Author: Gee F
Reviews.Content: We came into Amsterdam a day early before boarding our cruise. I wanted a day to rest, and have somewhere close to the cruise terminal. Moevenpick was PERFECT for this. Literally next door to the terminal. We were upgraded to a Jr. suite, which was amazing, roomy, clean, modern. The beds were so comfortable, bathroom spacious and new, amenities great, climate control worked efficiently and quickly, view superb. We could see our ship coming into port. I highly recommend this hotel. They were very accommodating. Next time I would recommend coming back into port and staying at the Moevenpick for another week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not so great location”
Reviews.Author: Stugal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for a conference & was pleasantly surprised. Staff and facilities are good, just a shame of it's location. For anyone visiting Amsterdam on leisure, I'd suggest staying a bit more central, however if the rate is right and you don't mind a 15 minute walk to Damrak (central station etc) then this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Higher end 'functional'”
Reviews.Author: Pi31415
Reviews.Content: A hotel with shower gel bolted to the wall sends me a strong message. I arrived at night and thought I was in the middle of an industrial estate. I'm happy to say that with the dawn, things improved and continued to improve through my stay. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurants are fine - the elevators become frustratingly slow in the morning rush hour. The fitness facility is compact. This was not my choice of hotel but I was happier with my stay than my initial impression suggested would be the case

Reviews.Title: “Modern high stanard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lambi
Reviews.Content: An efficient, clean, modern and very well-equipped hotel. We loved it ! Stayed at, and recommend the junior-suites for that extra quailty, views and free breakfast (which was well worth it!). Only a slight reservation: The room-TV was too small.

Reviews.Title: “MÃ¶venpick with nice view”
Reviews.Author: Extech
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little expensive but good. The only issue is the age of the TV set, and the quality of the transmission. I was trying to watch the US Open (tennis) but the ball wasn't visible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very handy for city centre and train station.”
Reviews.Author: Excelsior105
Reviews.Content: Great location , clean ,modern rooms,cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Elegant but service was spotty”
Reviews.Author: PinoyWanderer66
Reviews.Content: room was sizeable and true to its Dutch location, clean, streamlined, elegant. the bed was really comfortable and the room seems bigger than other standard-sized rooms in other hotels. for its 4-star rating though, service was spotty. I was struggling with my luggage when I checked in and the door person did not even bother to help, never mind opening the door!! the hotel offers pickup from the train station but the timing is not reliable (was initially told it was walking distance from the train station, so I did, and strictly speaking, particularly if you have substantial luggage, it was not! it was about 1-1/2 miles from the station along circuitous route). I guess the minimalist service goes with the minimalist decor :( front-desk staff were also kinda "not warm"; evidently their training dictated that to be perceived as professional, smiling is not a prerequisite. I would say the value was good but only because I got a really good deal from Priceline, like 75% off rack rate. check around for the best rates

Reviews.Title: “a real 4 stars experience !”
Reviews.Author: SylvainC588
Reviews.Content: very good location, 7 minutes away from the Central station by tram, room very clean, and hotel is not very old (around 5 years), so everything is in perfect condition. Concierge Paul is wonderful and can help you a lot with the reservation for different activities. I will go there in my next trip to Amsterdam !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & breakfast, walkign distance from centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Fallenangelaj
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room through a discount site and was happy with the price I paid including breakfast. I booked this hotel based on other reviews and was not disappointed. I was a little worried as some mentioned that it was a distance from the train station, but this was no problem as you can walk or get a tram which stops outside the hotel. We were very lucky to get our roon upgraded to the Ambassidors suite which was very very nice and so much bigger than normal hotel rooms. However they didnt include the free mini bar in our upgrade, but I guess you cant have everything. On our first night we arrived late, but managed to go to to bar for a few drinks. I would definatley recomend the Amsterdam Cosmopolitain it was the best cosmo ive ever had. I think we had a coupld of beers and cocktails and the bill came to just ubder 50 Euros, which I thought was ok for a hotel of this standard. We later order a pizza from roomservice and were very plesently supprised by how nice it was and at 16.50 the price was again ok. If I stayed in Amsterdam again, I would definatley stay here again even if we dont get upgraded to a suite. I would highly recomend the breakfast, ours was included in the price and im not sure how much it would have been but i think its worth it. Theres a large selection and its served until 11, which was lovely in case you had a late night or just dont want to get up early while your on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, top quality!”
Reviews.Author: RarRarRar
Reviews.Content: Me and partner joined the Insight Vacation on our trip, while in Amsterdam we stayed in this hotel. This hotel was of very high standard, it's at a reasonably good location alongside the waterfront, and within 10 mins of tram ride to the City district. When we checked in, the hotel gave us a room with two single beds, so I called up reception and ask if we could have a double-bed instead. Within 10 mins, we are in another room further down the corridor, with a double-bed. Very tidy and clean rooms, very well equipped. Complimentary internet provided as well. Definitely great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice one”
Reviews.Author: blAjOe
Reviews.Content: Booked via opodo with good discount and special rate. No breakfast and had to pay city tax extra. Good room, all clean and tidy, nice view of the docks. Big plus is the spa with sauna. Walking distance to the city center is fair but manageable. If i get a proper deal again i would stay there for another weekend. Free internet in the room but weak reception.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie B
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with this hotel! Great location, free shuttle bus that runs frequently to central station (despite central station being a 3-5 minute walk away and a tram line that runs straight to the station being opposite the hotel!) which was fantastic. The big advantage of the hotel's location (being away from the shopping/tourist areas) is the magnificent views over the whole of Amsterdam and harbour. Worth requesting a room on the highest floor possible! The hotel concierge was very friendly and happy to assist us with storing our luggage securely for almost 10 hours!! In terms of transport to Schipol the hotel is minutes away from Central Station where there's an express train to the airport! The only limitations of the hotel were it's restaurant and bar, we both felt that these could be made more approachable. The hotel was set up for a fine dining experience but was completely dead and empty for the duration of our stay. This was disappointing as we really fancied a lovely meal in the hotel with it's stunning views over Amsterdam! Overall great value for money, lovely room, friendly staff, unique location and amazing views!!

Reviews.Title: “"We really enjoyed our stay, Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Paul Z
Reviews.Content: Everything went perfectly smooth with this Swiss Hotel..Rooms were well done, very clean and the view of the river was great. It was a short walk to pick up Tram #25 or #26 into the city. Get the all week pass for the trams, you can go anywhere in the city. The Front desk Team were warm and friendly and ask Concierge Paul, he will get you were you want to go.He made navigating the city of Amsterdam easy. It was my wife's birthday Paul reserved a nice special Restaurant for us. Thanks again Paul. Room service was on the mark, and even the room cleaners were nice. I did not have one problem with this Hotel and would stay here again and I have recommended it to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel with stunning views”
Reviews.Author: midlandmusician
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Central Station, the multi storey Movenpick rises up a short distance away on the waterfront. We were met by the hotel minibus for the five minute drive. There is a bright, open lobby which also contains a bar, gift shop and free use of internet. Bedrooms are spacious and well equipped with a choice of walk-in shower or bath/shower. All room have excellent views, either towards the city centre or the river and suburbs. The only weakness was an ancient small TV, though I gather that they are due to be replaced in the near future. We had an excellent dinner in the restaurant; the quality and choice at breakfast was also very good, though a little chaotic with seating being at long, refectory type benches. Service in all parts of the hotel is outstanding. When we booked, we were a little concerned about the apparent distance from the city centre but it is walkable or within easy reach by the frequent trams which depart from nearby. All in all , an interesting change from the traditional Amsterdam hotels.

Reviews.Title: “far away from everything”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: This is a nice new, modern hotel located at the Passenger Terminal, which is about a 15-20 minute walk from the back of Central Station or a one stop ride on the 25 or 26 Tram. If you are unfamiliar with Amsterdam and/or have lots of luggage, take the tram (or if it more than two people a taxi may be just as cheap). This hotel is brand new and very clean, but it feels sterile. The rooms are very nice and big, the bedding is very comfortable, free wifi, the toiletries are very nice with an excellent bathroom, but there is nothing compelling about this hotel. It is to far away from even a nice bar or cafe -- you basically have to go back to Central Station and start from there. In some ways, you might as well be out at Schipol. I liked it but probably wouldn't be my first choice when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a view - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Anneka B
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this hotel after seeing a deal on Expedia. I read the various reviews which seemed extremely positive and was not disappointed. The hotel was visable from Central station and only a 5 minute walk. The hotel also offered a free shuttle to Central Station, which was used when we were leaving on our final day. We arrived a half an hour after check in and were told our room wasn't quite ready. Having said this, we barely had time to sit down before being given our room key. The hotel was stylish and all the staff were very friendly. We were given a 3 bed room, which consisted of 2 single beds and a sofa bed, all of which were very comfortable. We were placed on the 3rd floor and were very impressed by the size and style of the room. We had Wi-fi and satellite television. After a night out we realised our shower wasn't working properly. The hotel staff were fantastic and moved us to a new room with no fuss. Our new room was on the 14th floor and we had an amazing view of the harbour and Central Station. During our stay we ordered room service, which we felt was of a resonable price for Amsterdam. Room service was speedy and professional. We also ate at the bar downstairs. The food was good and definitely comparable with prices in the City. As an added bonus the hotel offered a free Sauna and Gym. We used these during our stay and they were both of a very high standard. This hotel was everything we wanted from a break in Amsterdam. It was quiet and we were able to walk or take the tram to all parts of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Our prepaid room was given away!”
Reviews.Author: BillBetty1568
Reviews.Content: We bought and paid for our reservation at Movenpick in March of 2011, 5 months early, for a room prior to our Baltic cruise in August. After flying in 8 hours from the USA to London, then a 3 hour layover at Heathrow, finally arriving in Amsterdam, wrestling our luggage through the rain, we arrived at the Movenpick Hotel desk only to be told there was no room for us. There was a heated discussion, mostly on my side, and they told me that they had a room reserved for us at a superior hotel and a better room at no additional cost to us. But it was clear across town which defeated my purpose of selecting the Movenpick which was to be at the cruise boat docks. Their reason was that their â€œsystemâ€� was faulty and it overbooked the hotel. Their staff was courteous but the mistake was inexcusable especially for an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ringring222
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Expensive, but everything is pretty much always working perfectly. Clean and cozy rooms. I love it. Just too expensive for me to go often :(

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHavesh H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 10 min walk from Amsterdam central station - it's a quiet location, near the pier, great to get away from the hustle of Amsterdam town. The tram stop is conveniently located near the hotel. What was really a bonus is the bike hire place directly next to the hotel - a must for every one touring Amsterdam. Amsterdam is very bike friendly and hiring a bike makes it fun to see and easy in wearing out the legs which can get quiet tiring walking around the town. I'd recommend this hotel for it's location and modern amenities

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel with panoramic view”
Reviews.Author: ChooseyItalians
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 and we look for panoramic rooms, excellent breakfasts and reasonable prices. First the price. We took advantage of a "stay 7 nights, pay only 5". VERY convenient, in practice it gave us a 4-stars hotel for the price of a 3-stars. The Moevenpick is a 2005 20-storey building on the IJ (Amsterdam harbor) near the new music hall and the maritime passenger terminal. Not you tytpical "postcard Amsterdam", but a beautiful place, if you like modern architecture. The view from our room at the 19th floor was spectacular, ranging from the IJ harbor to the eastern part of central Amsterdam. Suffice it to say that we took dozens of pictures from our window at all times of the day. The room was modern and spacious, even for 3 persons, with several amenities: besides the customary TV and mini bar there was a free espresso/tea machine, iron and ironing board, free Internet (not tested), and a complimentary bottle of mineral water each day. For those who, like my wife, find fixed windows oppressive, one of the panels could be opened (transom/vasistas-style). The bathroom was nice and spacious, with combo bathtub/shower (no bidet, obviously). Breakfast was our next priority, alas it was not included in our offer and it was expensive (23 Euros per person), but it was HUGE, with everything you could want, including some of those Ducth foods that you usually ask for in cafes and restaurants, like cheeses, herrings and poffertjes (mini-pancakes), and obviously some Swiss touches (Moevenpick is a Swiss chain), like rosti and plenty of mueslis. We returned three times, and each time we skipped lunch and had a light dinner, in practice we saved money... The lower floors of the hotel house several services, some that we used (free Internet, screens with real-time train timetable), some that we did not use (restaurant, bar, concierge, ATM, gym), plus a free shuttle to the train station that you better book well in advance (let's say more than 24 hours before you preferred time). Outside the hotel you can always find taxis (thanks also to the passenger terminal nearby) and two trams, 25 and 26, both go to the railway station and the 25 then goes to Dam square and near the museums area. On the tram you can buy hourly tickets and daily passes. Boats of two different canal tours stop right in front of the hotel, but you can find a wider offer of canal tours from the same and other companies in front of the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best kept secret in town”
Reviews.Author: AnujVij
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week exlporing Amsterdam. The hotel is a short walk away from the city center though a tram line stop is exactly opposite the hotel. The location is combined with the new muzik theatre building and the Amsterdam Cruiseship terminal. Note, it can be really busy at the hotel as groups are coming in an out all the time. Now our summary, the hotel is well located , great stylish rooms, prompt room service and the food in the lounge is excellent too. Our initial room was on the right side of the building and did not have any great views, we requested a change given our long stay and we given a room on the higher floors , and on the left side of the building having fabulous views of the harbour (see picture). They offer a complementary pickup from the station (though only starts at 7.00 am) and drops as well. Free ice deliveries to your room are another great perk. Staff is friendly and they have a well sticked price competetitive gift shop in the lobby too. We will definately stay here again if we go to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: goldfish_kk
Reviews.Content: The receptionist at chech-in was rude and unhelpful when I asked for a room on higher floor, even though I had already indicated that on my reservation. I was just asking if my preference could be fulfilled. But was made to feel like I had no rights. But I did not let her ruin the rest of my stay, which was very good. Room was spacious. Nice view over the waters. Could see the sunrise every morning. Very clean. Two twins pushed together. Internet connection was problem-free. Bath and shower, bright and spacious. Air-con was good. Location is a bit off centered. But I had a 3-day pass, so wasn't afraid to use the tram. One stop to the central train station, where you could connect to anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Dawn M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable but nothing special. The location was a little akward and isolated. It was walking distance from the train station though. The tourist attractions were a bit further but within walking distance if you are used to walking. The concierge was helpful with ideas for things to do. The lobby was crowded at times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel with view of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MotoMoto2364
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet spot on the water just outside of the old town area of Amsterdam. Big modern 'new Westin' style rooms. Service was great...we loved it! After staying in a cramped room in Paris, this was a nice change. Paid under $100.00 us via Hotwire...great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable Hotel In An Uninspiring Location”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: After having read many very complimentary reviews on Tripadvisor I was rather disappointed with my stay at this property. I booked this hotel using a â€œsecretâ€� type web-site, so was unable to pinpoint the location prior to making my reservation. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Central Station, however, unlike other properties the walk is alongside open water with no welcome distractions such as shops, bars, etc. so it feels an awful lot longer than ten minutes and as a result becomes rather tedious each time one is returning to the hotel. They do run a shuttle service every half hour to Central Station, but one needs to reserve popular times in advance otherwise there is no guarantee of a space on it! Furthermore, due to roadworks at the station, the shuttle service stops operating at half past seven each evening. Check-in was efficient, but virtually all of the staff that I encountered, whilst being polite seemed entirely indifferent, there was no warm, friendly and genuine welcome. The room itself was a comfortable size, and had a pleasant view over the city. They are rather mean on toiletries, one receives the usual small sized bottle of shampoo, bar of soap, but there is a shower gel dispenser on the wall by the shower; this is really not the sort of thing one expects in a four star property â€“ individual toiletries should be standard. Bizarrely for a hotel that was finished less than six years ago there is an old fashioned CRT television, this dates the otherwise relatively timeless and contemporary style of the room. Another strange feature was the king size bed having two single duvets rather than one large one â€“ why!? The housekeeping was not of an high standard. On my first day, the cleaner knocked on my door (my fault as I did not have a do not disturb sign on the door) and I told him to come back in five minutes as I was just about to leave. Instead of listening to what I had just said, he knocked on the door again a minute later. I repeated my original message, and yet again he continued to knock on the door. Another day I returned to my room to find a couple of wet towels on the floor next to the bed; I had certainly not deposited them there! The hotel has a separate concierge desk, but the concierges were often not at their desk, either driving the shuttle bus, or elsewhere in the hotel. If an hotel is going to commit to a concierge desk, then at least one concierge should be visibly on duty at all times. It would be far more useful to the guest if the shuttle bus operated every quarter of an hour (it is a five minute drive) and had a dedicated driver. Also it seemed strange that such a modern purpose built property did not include a swimming pool, only a small fitness suite. This hotel is probably most suited, and most convenient for cruise ship passengers. If you end up with this property via a â€œsecretâ€� web-site for under GBP65 a night then you could do a lot worse, however, if you are considering paying published rates, you can find somewhere far better located and with more character elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Ice Cold Beer at Silk Bar, you gotta try it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yadush
Reviews.Content: The Moevenpick Hotel at Amsterdam is one of the better hotels I have been to. Again I was the Event Manager for 125 delegates who flew into Amsterdam for a Diabetes Conference. The meeting facilities at Matterhorn and Zurich halls were perfect for my event. The banqueting staff took care of my event as if it was one of their own. Our Gala Dinner at Zurich hall was Superb especially when my VIP was not so comfortable with the local cuisine that was served and the chef came up with a few Indian dishes specially made for the Boss!! Hats off Chef! But personally my best experience was the Ice Cold Beer that you get at the Silk Bar. The rooms are great and they place some delicious chocolates when house keeping do their job in the room when your away! Not to forget the Smoking Zone with that red colored powerful heating light at the back entrance. The only flaw is when i had to take my group out through the back entrance in the 40 seater Beuk Coaches the huge gate was not manned at all times and our departures for sight seeing and cruise was delayed by a good 15 minutes! A great hotel, Value for money and great service..

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fresstours
Reviews.Content: exept of location which is not exactly "city center" everything is fine. large rooms, very clean, good service, excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff, but isolated”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Marc K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Movenpick Amsterdam in June 2011 with two friends. We took advantage of their 3 nights for the price of 2 promotion so the price was very decent. Although check-in is a 3 pm, we arrived at the hotel at 10 am and got our room directly. The room was spacious, modern and clean. Throughout the stay the staff has been friendly (restaurant ideas, directions) and helpful (check-in, cleaning, room service, luggage-check, all convenient). The downside is the location. From the train station it is only a 5-10 minute trip (tram + walk) but there is nothing near the hotel (really nothing). So overall it is great value for money and pleasant place to stay. If you have a tram pass and plan to spend your day visiting the city then the isolation is not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “So quiet tho so close to Centraal Station”
Reviews.Author: ms mg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights with 2 rooms for a great summer rate, breakfast not included, so the quality was excellent for the price we paid. I was extremely pleased with location, with the climate control,the huge picture windows and the design. Note there is a frosted glass door on the non-locking bathroom door- get used to it! That's style. Staying here and watching the riverfront was fascinating, which you don;t see when staying elsewhere in the city. We saw 2 huge cruiseships and at least 4 or 5 riverboats dock. The bedding was very comfortable, in room laptop safe, nice toiletries. FREE INTERNET. Checkin and check out was efficient and we used the shuttle service to Centraal station on our departure for the train to Schipol. The restaurant Silk Road is very delicious and the bar food is just as good- excellent food for the price, which is about the same in the rest of Amsterdam- not a cheap city. Special for one night was 17 euros for weinerschnitzel. ANother night it was Satay- 8 sticks for about the same price. Kids stay free, BTW, on the sofa in each room. There is public ( expensive) parking in front of the hotel and taxis available almost all the time. There is a musical concerthall next door, see if anyone is playing while you are there. This was a refreshingly modern but safe and quiet change from the lively hubbub of downtown Amsterdam. It's a little walk to the tram stop in front of the hotel- you can see it but have to walk around part of the canal- but it is one stop to central station where you can catch a tram going anywhere in the city(be sure to buy a 24 or 48 hour pass).

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Vacation”
Reviews.Author: EagleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: It was extremely convenient to stay at the Moevenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Center the day before we sailed on our cruise. The next day we checked out of the hotel and walked next door and checked into our cruise. When we woke up the morning of our cruise our beautiful cruise ship, the Constellation was docked right outside our window. We enjoyed a wonderful chicken Caesar salad in the hotel Cafe, it was presented with a long, narrow slice of parmesan cheese bread.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Wings_of_the_Eagles
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a family weekend in Amsterdam because we had such a good experience when we stayed here two years ago. We were delighted to find that it's still just as good. Whilst not the cheapest hotel around, if you're looking for comfort and a bit of luxury, but still offering good value for money, then the Movenpick is highly recommended. The rooms are modern, stylish and very comfortable. They provide a superb panoramic view of the old harbour area, especially if you have a north facing room on the upper floors (16 in total). The hotel is very conveniently located for the city centre, being a short walk, or one tram stop, away from Central Station. Since the Station is also the main terminus for nearly all the tram routes around the city as well as canal tours and sightseeing busses, everything you need is near to hand. The hotel itself also provides a free shuttle bus upon request to the station, which provides a cheap and fast link for the airport. We stayed on a room only basis having got a good deal by booking in advance with Expedia. The breakfast, although not cheap at 23 Euros per person, is quite simply fantastic! The range of hot and cold offerings is vast and will suit every taste. Additionally, being a buffet style, you can return for more if you are feeling really hungry. The quality of the food is also excellent with the bread range and cooked foods freshly made and delicious. It will set you up for the rest of the day! We didn't eat in the hotel in the evenings as there are a good number and variety of restaurants available in the city itself and they are easily accessible by tram or on foot.
