The hotel also has a nice little bar/cafe providing alcoholic drinks, hot and cold beverages and snacks all served in comfortable surroundings by friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is sighted beside the main passenger cruise ship terminal which may put some people off as there are daily visits from cruise liners in the summer season and they tie up directly alongside the hotel on the seaward side. This means that if you are in the restaurant or lower floors on that side you may find yourself looking into the cabins on the top decks in the morning or during the day. However, we found it rather entertaining watching them arrive and depart. Our family of four adults had a really good time at the hotel and will certainly consider staying there again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “5 star views, 4 star room, 3 star service, 2 star executive lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much says it all; we stayed 5 nights in two rooms, and the rooms were very nice and contemporary, fabulous views, quiet and comfortable. Wonderful outdoor deck off the restaurant area. Service in general was spotty, but the executive lounge was a joke; a very small room with a few tables and a small 'dorm-size' fridge stocked with a handful of sodas, a few beers, and a few airline size wine bottles. The fridge was empty by about 5:30 every evening, and the staff at the restaurant told us it wasn't their responsibility to re-stock it... Though occasionally you would find a nice waitress or waiter who would take pity and get you a glass of wine from the bar. Sometimes there would be an attendant for the lounge, but even then they would take someone's order, disappear for 30 minutes, reappear with snacks for one table, take another order, disappear again, etc. Might stay again if I got a great rate but certainly wouldn't pay extra for the lounge access!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lizp007
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 night at the Moevenpick in February. We paid for an Executive room & was upgraded to a Suite. Very clean & quite a lot of space for a Eurpoean hotel, but the furnishing were a little worn. The hotel was quite, which is always a blessing and the staff friendly. Very handy for the water-bus which was a 2 minute walk, but about a 20 min walk to the main town. Our stay included breakfast which was good. Plenty of choice & all fresh. I would stay there again - especially if we had a suite!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jrebeiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The room was comfortable and the view was excellent. Staff were helpful and nice. A good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely quiet hotel in a noisy city”
Reviews.Author: upallnight06
Reviews.Content: just a quick review as its my first, we stayed at the Moevenpick Amsterdam for two nights and arrived around midday Sat 6th August as part of a mini trip around Europe {Brussels and Berlin also }as it was my wifes 40th birthday ,had read lots of reviews about how far the hotel is from Centraal st but found it to be a very pleasant walk along the waterfront which took us under 10 mins, the hotel was lovely clean and quiet and most of the staff couldnt do enough for you especially the breakfast staff who even brought us a bottle of Prosecco to our breakfast table as it was my wifes birthday on our last day what a nice touch that will make us stay here again ,i will write a little about Amsterdam,the trams are a great way to see the city and two trams stop within 100 yards of hotel, no 25 and opp hotel no 26 ,we found the walk between centraal st and dam sq the noisest part of Amsterdam but if you are after more beauty and peace then head to the Joordaan or to the musuem area and vondel pk, overall a lovely city not too expensive and if you fancy something a bit different head to the Bols musuem which culminates in having a cocktail or too

Reviews.Title: “Not city centre”
Reviews.Author: Paddy53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend of Gay Pride (unwittingly). The hotel is not city centre. It is approx 1000 meters from Centraal station, and whilst there is a shuttle bus, it has to be booked in advance, not possible when you are arriving! The number 25 tram does take you into the city centre and is about a 200 metro walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is fine, clean and modern. The breakfast choice is very good, and the hotel bar, whilst expensive, is also friendly. There were a couple of problems with room cleaning, not done until after 5.30pm on one day, and then housekeeping knocked on the door at 8.15 the following morning. How much mess we could have made in that time I don't know!

Reviews.Title: “Good cityhotel”
Reviews.Author: nathalievb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 15 min walk from the station and 15/ 20 min walk from the city centre. There is metrostop in front of the hotel, number 25/ 26. It's good to take a buscard for a day because one hours coast 2.3 euro. The hotel is located next to a cruise terminal and the river Ij. The entrance of the hotel is a little bit confusing. It's a really small entrance for such a big hotel. I went up on the bridge to the Opera, but there was no entrance. The staff is friendly, but nothing more. It was a little bit unpersonal. I ask for a room on a high floor, and i had a room on the 18th floor. The view was amazing. The room had a good size for a cityhotel. There was a sofa and a lot of space for my suitcase. The bed was quite hard, but is slept very well. There were a few things that i don't like about the room. There was something wrong with the shower, the temperature of the water was not constant. The shower is very big, but not very practical. Maybe a rainshower will be great. The hotel is very modern, but there is an old tv in the room, maybe there is room for improvement. The breakfast was good, it was very busy but there was food enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIM-MQN
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, offers good comfort in modern locals. Clean rooms, friendly staff, close to town centre, free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TreasureIslandJeffM
Reviews.Content: The MÃ¶venpick was a very nice hotel near the Centraal Train Station. Its so close in fact, that if you wanted you could walk (10 minutes), just leave thru the North exit of the station instead of the usual South side. The rooms were very spacious for a European hotel, and well decorated. We liked the fact it was away from the hustle of Amsterdam town center, allowing us to easily go to all the attractions, but we could then escape the crowds and noise when we went to bed. There is also a bike rental company in the parking garage of the hotel, which is very convenient. You can rent a bike, ride around the town, lock it up as necessary, then return it at night. This makes being off the beaten track a bit, very manageable. We didn't try the hotel restaurant, since there are many dining options in Amsterdam so I can not offer any insight on its quality. If you are looking for a nice hotel, close to everything but far enough away to relax, MÃ¶venpick is a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: guanabana2
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean and the room was light and spacious room, the bed was excellent and the best soundproofing we have come across. We were on the 11th floor and enjoyed amazing views across the water. Mostly helpful staff and a very good breakfast with a lot of choice. Easy to take the tram to and from the centre - we bought a 4 day pass for our stay and made full use of it. Also took advantage of the hotel pickup service from the station.

Reviews.Title: “We did not love it and we'll avoid it”
Reviews.Author: fgrandjean
Reviews.Content: The website of this hotel says that it is situated within walking distance from Amsterdam Central Station. This may be the case but it involves walking along a construction site on very poor roads or sidewalks. The hotel is there to accomodate passengers from the cruise boats that land on the neighboring ship terminal. The only way to get to town is to either take the hotel shuttle, that is usually booked up, or tram 26 for one stop and change tram at the train station. This makes difficult the commute between the hotel and the tourist sites in town, Further, when you arrive wheeling your suitcase, you realize that from the tram stop, you have to either make a 200 m detour around a canal or to walk up a bridge over the canal and walk down steps on the other side to reach the hotel. The access to the hotel has been very poorly planned. The lobby is unimpressive for a 4-star hotel, there is no complimentary newspaper nor even a place to buy a newspaper. The rooms are spartan. A good point, the hotel is entirely non-smoking unless someone smokes on your level and smells up the whole corridor, as we experienced. The service in the hotel leaves to be desired. A request to make up the room was not satisfied. The magnetic room keys fail often. Finally, booking on the Moevenpick web site was very difficult and was only possible with explorer on a PC. None of the other browsers on a Mac would work. After we finalized our booking, it took one telephone call and several e-mails to finalize the payment by credit card. The only reason, for which we chose the hotel, was a special offer "three nights for the price of two." Still, the room without breakfast was approximately Euro 130 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a short stroll into the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Eimes30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and the hotel is lovely, nice room and nice views. Didn't eat in the hotel as the breakfast was not included and it was quite expensive. The location is great, its not right in the centre but the walk in to town is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service for business stay, free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: DanDallas
Reviews.Content: Clean and relatively spacious room, free wi-fi, friendly staff, excellent breakfast (for 20+ euro) Quite a walk from the central station

Reviews.Title: “met our every need - definitely recommend if you want to relax for some of your stayin Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: beachbl0ndie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spend four nights here. We did a lot of sightseeing - and also relaxing. While it is out of the hustle and bustle of the city centre, it's only 10 mins walk from Central Station where you can hit the city - and there is a free shuttle bus if you don't fancy the walk. The room was spacious, extremeley clean and the toiletries were lovely - including the free shampoo/shower gel decanter on the wall of the shower. The beds were comfortable and it realy felt like we were 'coming home' when we wanted a relax before going out. All the staff were friendly, especially the concierge, and we used room service a couple of times - not badly priced really and they even brought us jugs of iced tap water when we asked. The hotel bar as good ambiance and has nightly offers on food and drinks - we didn't eat in the restaurant. The hotel is right by the passenger terminal for cruises so you will have cruises literally parked outside your window! The views are amazing and I think you see a different bit of Amsterdam by staying here I would have ranked this hotel as excellent if it hadn't been for the hidden city tax and room service extra charges which made checking out an expensive do! But a ideal place to stay in Amsterdam if you want to enjoy the busy city - and retreat to re-energise!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RolandL
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern & new hotel in Amsterdam, although a bit far to walk (about 15 minutes walk to Amsterdam central station), but there is a tram station right in front of hotel. Nice surrounding, with water at the back and side of hotel, feel nice atmosphere. The hotel lobby was also have a good decoration. Up to the room, the bed can be slide to make a double single bed or make one big King bed with no effort at all. Nice and revolutionary. Room have lots of light, big sofa and very nice and comfy bathroom. Really love this hotel. At breakfast, High Quality and delicious. The jam have movenpick brand, delicious. Definetely want back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: EricNottingham
Reviews.Content: Could not agree more with previous reviews Had a room on 18th floor with super view over river(worth requesting a room with river view) Staff excellent, rooms very well appointed appointed and clean We ate in the restaurant one evening as it has it had rained for the previous 24 hours non stio. Very good value and well prepared food, veal especially good. Free interent on ground floor for those not having a computer with them Worth remembering that when you get off the tram then go over the bridge to the Binhuis, use their lift to get down a level, then a short walk to the hotel. Much quicker than going the long way round!

Reviews.Title: “As Good As The Reviews Advised”
Reviews.Author: KevBains
Reviews.Content: Absolutely first class service from checking in to checking out. The hotel is spotless. The service attentive and professional without being in your face, Fabulous views over Amsterdam especially from the upper floors ( we were on floor 9 of 20 and had a great view over the city and the River Ij) Did not use the restaurant or the facilities personally ( too much choice in Amsterdam already) but the other guests who we spoke with were more than happy with the facilities and the breakfast on offer, The only gripe that I feel that other have with the hotel is that it is out from the cemtre of Amsterdam . THIS IS AN ABSOLUTE BENEFIT !! You can buy a 24 hr 48hr 72hr up to 6 day travel card for all GVB trams, metros and buses. In view of the fact that the tram (no 25 or 26) stops 75 yards from the hotel and it is a 2 minute ride as opposed to a 10 minute walk to the Central Station this is a bit of a no brainer for 16 euros a person for a 72hr pass ( please be aware you need to buy it at the Holland Tourist Office on arrival at the airport) Even without that the hotel has a courtesy shuttle bus to the airport until about 11pm so you have no reason at all to complain In summing up cannot fault the hotel at all from check in to check out it was excellent. Rooms were clean, spacious, warm and exceptionally quiet as a result of the heaviest room doors I have ever come across. Will definitely head straight back here next time we end up in Amsterdam..without question. Go on treat yourself .... you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Fabulous Location. A-Class Service.”
Reviews.Author: Pravin_Amudan
Reviews.Content: Before finalising our hotel in Amsterdam, we went through a number of reviews on TripAdvisor. Moevenpick had great reviews and we decided to go ahead with this hotel. The rooms are very spacious and clean with fabulous water-front views of the passenger cruise terminal (if you're on the top floors). The rooms are equipped with a kettle, coffee / tea / creamer sachets, TV, electronic safe, an iron with an ironing board, mini refrigerator (the mini bar is empty and is filled on request) and plenty of storage space. The beds are extremely comfortable. The bathroom has a tub (but no lock!). The service levels were more than what we had expected / read on TripAdvisor. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet was quite a good spread. The location is perfect. Away from the noise of the bustling city centre, yet very accessible (Tram No. 25 from the hotel's doorstep takes you to Central Station in less than 5 minutes and to other places of tourist interest such as the Dam Square {7 minutes}, Flower Market {10 minutes} and the Heineken Experience {15 minutes}). We stayed at the hotel for 3 days and 4 nights and at the end of the first day itself we were glad to have chosen Moevenpick. And then, just when we thought that the service levels were good, they went a step ahead and bettered it. Just the night before our departure, our 5-year old daughter, twisted her angle during one of our sight-seeing tours . The hotel's staff (both, at the front desk and at the security) were extremely helpful - from giving her first aid, providing a wheelchair, calling a cab and guiding us to the hospital. While we certainly didn't expect all this from them, they went beyond the call of duty and this truly moved us. We got back to the hotel room from the hospital at the stroke of midnight and found that it was too late to order from the restaurant as the chefs had left. Even then, the room service staff were more than helpful in getting us something to eat at that hour. While all hotels talk about providing good service (at least their brochures do), not many live up to the promise. Moevenpick Amsterdam was simply A-class. We had a great time and we would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome find in Amsterdam - perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticCanadian
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and got a great deal in the city. Perfect location for us since we were taking the cruiseship terminal right next door! Location is near Central Station with free shuttle service and off the beaten tourist path - NEW, central & quiet amidst the bustle of Amsterdam. I'm writing this review using the free wifi provided. Just checked in today and can't really ask for more. Large modern rooms with huge bath - especially compared to the small, central hotel in Paris at my previous stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeCee13362
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides everything required for a decent few days in Amsterdam. It is in a good location within walking distance of the central station, and a short tram ride from all the sights and attractions. There are extensive views of the river, and a tram stop outside opposite. The hotel runs a regular complementary bus to the town centre. The rooms are what you would expect from a large hotel: Clean, comfortable and spacious, but lacking character. The staff were very helpful and room service was excellent. Sadly there were very limited tea and coffee supplies in the room and no complementary biscuits. Something we have found most 4 star hotels supply! There were no dressing robes as advertised, and no face cloths in the bathroom. Biggest disappointment was there was no double bed! Two single beds were pushed together with separate bed linen and duvets and this was classed as a queen sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with short walk to centre”
Reviews.Author: Smiths23
Reviews.Content: We stayed he for a short break and to attend a concert at the Arena. THe hotel was a 10-15 minute walk to the centre but you can book the hotel shuttle bus which leaves every half hour. Upgrading to executive club rooms is to be recommended as the free snacks and drinks between 5-7 are worthwhile,and e views from these rooms are great. Soft drinks in minibar was free and good facilities in room . They could possibly upgrade the tvs to flat screen to bring the rom more up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Good Views of the Ij”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Movenpick, Amsterdam last week; had booked via lastminute.com and got a reduced rate - room only, Â£83 per night for 3 nights. We had read the various reviews on here and had also had quite a few trips to Amsterdam previously so had an idea of the location and decided that we would give it a go. We had read about the shuttle service so decided to email in advance to book 2 places on the 5.35 shuttle, also making them aware that we needed additional space for the wheelchair (incase that was not possible) there was a swift reply from the concierge to inform us that there was not a problem and the shuttle had been booked. We also emailed to ask about accessible rooms and to request a room with a view (a previous review had suggested it) and again received a swift reply telling us an accessible room was now pre-booked for us on the 3rd floor, and apologising for the fact it was not on one of the higher floors with better views. We usually pre-book wheelchair assistance for the train journey to/ from Schiphol - the train costs e3.70 pp each way - and this trip was no exception. On arrival at Centraal station (20 mins by train from schiphol) there was the porter with a ramp to help us disembark and off we went. We had arrived onto platform 15a so were near to the Noord exit, which leads to the river, and where we had instructions to meet the minibus to transport us to the hotel. The rear of the station is currently undergoing some refurbishments and due to the works, temporary ramps/walkways we were unable to locate the minibus stop, so decided that we would just walk to the hotel ourselves. The walk, which was a straight road, although up a steadily inclining 'ramped' bridge, was easy (even in the squally winds and rain that were greeting us) and took between 5 - 7 minutes, having timed it but stopping to look over the river at one point hence the between times. On arrival at check-in we told the staff we had been unable to locate the minibus so had walked, there reply 'ok' so not sure that they had understood that we were telling them so that there staff need not look for us, or even if they cared, but it was 'ok' anyway. We were checked in quickly and directed to the lifts. Our room 325 was indeed on the 3rd floor, and directly overlooking the passenger terminal dock - which was literately outside our window about 10-15m away, and the river, so we were happy with the view anyway, and spent time following all the river traffic over the coming days. The room had more than enough room for my wheelchair to go at any side of the bed and around the room freely, there was a large double bed - as requested- and as previously noted in other reviews,the bed is covered in 2 single duvets, strange but saved us fighting about who had the lions share of the duvet when we roll over! There were tea and coffee supplied, and when we ran out a quick visit to reception re-stocked our supply in a minute without any complaints; the tv, whilst not the most modern style, had several english language stations(including BBC1 & 2, BBC news & CNN) plus some dutch stations had english programmes with dutch subtitles, so we were happy with the selection; again, as mentioned in other reveiws, the minibar is just a fridge which enables you to store your own goodies in it, which was very welcome as we bought sandwiches and bottles of coke from Albert Heijn and Hema (cheaper, and nicer - imho) so we could keep them fresh for supper, there was also a free electronic safe in the room. The bathroom was large, with wheel- in shower, rails around shower, toilet and a low sink with angled mirror so the adaptations were good, there was one problem though, there was a shower seat - but it was on the floor with nothing to attach it to to make it the correct hight to actually use, if i could get onto the floor to sit on it,and get back up from it, I wouldn't have needed it, it really needs a stool or frame to attach to, but we managed with the rails and my chair covered in towels. There are amenities supplied including shampoo, shower gel, body lotion and a soap, and they are replenished daily, ideal when travelling with carry on only for a few days break. We did not have breakfast - it was not included in our rate and we did not get up to have it, as we usually have a brunch at Teddys Cafe on Warmoesstraat (9e for full english with toast and it is delicious!) so that's were we went two days, but we did notice that the room service menu offered individual items for breakfast for less that you would pay for the buffet breakfast, so next time we would get an omelette for approx 6e and make a cup of tea in our room. I think breakfast finished at 11am, just check out the options if you are on a budget. We had a meal in the hotels restaurant, Silk Road; the waiter was very nice and found us a nice table with easy access to it,with a good view over the terrace (which was closed due to the weather) and on to the Ij, which would have been beautiful had it not been for the rain bouncing off the terrace, he also asked if I wished to transfer to a dining chair or remain in my own chair, prior to moving the unneeded chair out of our way completely, again showing excellent customer service. The menu is very much a fusion, and the chicken noodle soup we both chose for starter was absolutely delicious and well worth the 7.5e cost, for main course I had braised chicken with linguine in a lobster sauce with crayfish - this was served with 3 or 4 huge cooked crayfish and the sauce was very rich, cost 20 e and I could not finish it, hubby had steak with salad and choose a beetroot and nut salad with his steak - which were also accompanied by a 'tower' of home made style chunky chips, cost approx 23e. The restaurant also had an extensive wine list, and my favourite accompaniment to my meal was the glass of black muscat dessert wine I had instead of an actual dessert - very sweet and syrupy and nicely chilled, just how I like it - and at 7e a glass I wish I had had another. The weather was not nice for the length of our stay which curtailed some of our plans, and made the walk into/from the centre a little less appealing than it would have been had it not been so windy/rainy but we again timed our walk back towards the station at just over 5 mins (my husband is a quick walker, used to pushing me, and overtakes many people usually anyway, so this would be gauged on a fit person walking well, rather than strolling and wouldn't be expected of everyone - just an idea of how quickly it can be done). The tram stop is close to the hotel (we did not use it as we have had problems in getting on at the designated wheelchair area in the past and the strees that it caused then has left us unwanting to try it again, and we wont unless we have no other alternative, but for the regular tourist I would think they would be an excellent choice, and very efficiant), and there isalso a hop on hop off boat stop just in front of the hotel- to the right - at the concert hall stop, so access to the rest of the city IS easy. There is also a taxi rank just outside the hotel - to the left - between the bar and the passanger terminal. We used the taxi's on several occasions (purely because of weather) and found them (all except 1) to be trustworthy, the one driver that tried to take us on a detour soon went back on track when we asked why we were going the way we were - luckily we had an idea where we were going. All in all we had a lovely stay at the hotel Moevenpick in Amsterdam and would recommend it to people who are not phased by a 10 minute walk to the station each day to start out for the day or who are happy to use the trams. There is a short cut into the centre from the lift near the tram stop and then heading left over a bridge with a novel bike ramp, and passing by the library - try the restaurant on the top floor for good but reasonably priced high quality fresh cooked food - and the floating chinese restaurant Sea Palace - recommend the dim sum lunch, book in advance to get a window table, well worth it - then continue passed the new mint hotel, before either continuing for the station area with numerous boat tour operators there and on Damrak or turning left to head towards the tourist areas of the rld or the many Chinese restaurants - plus the temple - on zeedijk, leading to de waag - lit by candlelight - at Nieuwnmarkt, just before De Waag on the right as you go up Zeedijk try happy hour at Sake and Co, lovely cocktails for 6e each before 9pm! If in the Dam Sqaure area, try lunch/afternoon tea at the restaurant on the 5th floor of De Bijenkorf - another quality outlet at reasonable prices, the place is a little like a greenhouse on the roof of the top department store in amsterdam, so can combine a break and some shopping. Hope the report - although long - helps and if you want more info just get in touch!

Reviews.Title: “Should be 5 Stars,,!! more than perfect”
Reviews.Author: Medoz
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 5 nights..what can i say..! the location is more than excellent, very close to the downtown and central station..within 3 minutes walk, also a free shuttle bus to the train and metro station is every half an hour. free internet, free parking, comfortable room and bed, not big size room,but enough. the breakfast was excellent, with amazing view on the cruise terminal and the canal. it's 500 meters from the center of the downtown, which makes it quite and comfortable and at the same time u r close to every thing. the staff were amazing and very helpful will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: y850tdm1
Reviews.Content: Beautifull hotel, with a great location. By public transport (or free hotel shuttle) you are in a couple of minutes in the centre. The hotel is very design and stylish. Great restaurant, excellent food and awesome view. If you book and pre-pay in advance you can get excellent deals. Great hotel to stay with family and friends or for business.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, a bit far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: bristolstu
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, rooms were clean and smart and we had a great view from our room on floor 14 overlooking the canal and the ships coming and going. It was a bit far from the town centre (about 1.5km) but there was a tram stop right outside which we used with a travel card we had purchased. Conveniently they also sell these in the lobby shop. There was a minibar fridge in the room which was left empty for our use and the hotel runs a shuttle to the central station which is probably a 10-15 min walk. Overall i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more . .”
Reviews.Author: afrocentric
Reviews.Content: Hmmm after reading all the glowing TA reviews I was expecting a little more from this hotel. Had I booked at full price this review may have been more negative but we received a heavily discounted rate via the web and for what we paid the hotel was more than sufficient. That said, the lobby is somewhat austere, the desk staff standoffish , the bed linen rough, the room TV outdated, distorted & unwatchable and 90 minutes is way too long to wait for a room service pizza, even if it comes with an apology . .

Reviews.Title: “No problem, pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Irikos
Reviews.Content: This hotel really produced an impression on us. We stayed there for 5 days and everything was fantastic. Perfect service, polite and very attentive staff, great food and awesome views of Amsterdam. We lived in the executive suite and were greatly surprised by the price (it was really low). The staff were very helpful and helped us solve any problems in no time. The food is worth mentioning as it was delicious and we enjoyed it every morning. No transport problem! There is a shuttle fromthe hotel and a tram that stops right in front of the hotel. We came to Amsterdam in winter and were ready to meet any problems connected with transport but there were none. We loved Amsterdam and Movenpick hotel has been an example of service since then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: baroncampbell2000
Reviews.Content: Booked into Movenpick via a price bid website, so arrived without knowing much about it. Very impressed at ease of booking pick up & drop off at Central Station. Check in was conducted by a very pleasant man, and on departure, the guy at the restaurant saw my heavily pregnant wife was looking a little overheated while waiting in reception, and rushed over with glass of ice water. A very nice touch. Room was large, clean, with a good view of river. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Central Station, but there are very requent trams that run right into Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “MÃ¶venpick did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: ruandrettert
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the MÃ¶venpick for 2 nights booked through the travel agency of ours. Prices were at the higher end but we booked at a time where there were holidays in Germany so everything was about to be booked out. Breakfast was included in our rate. As we came by train we did not need any parking spot but there is a garage at the hotel. However it is not free. We went by foot with our trolleys from the main train station Amsterdam Centraal to the hotel. Three things about going by foot: 1. it is not that far but 5 minutes by foot is not enough. You need around 15 minutes. 2. there currently are construction works in and around the main station. So make sure you get the way right. 3. get out at the back of the station, otherwise you will not reach the hotel easily So as you have realized, the hotel is far away from the center. It takes about 25 minutes by foot. However you have other possibilities: - rent a bike. The hotel itself rents bikes but you can rent bikes at one of the various other bike rentals there are plenty. - rent a segway. There is a rental next to the hotel. - go by tram. Near to the hotel there is a tram stop. You can go with line 25 and 24 as far as I remember. - go by taxi. There are always some taxis in front of the hotel, waiting. - go by hotel shuttle. There is a shuttle every 30 minutes. However you have to make reservations and have to wait. The location of the hotel is very nice. It is quite and offers beautiful views over the harbour of Amsterdam. There are no disturbing noises or anything which would make the location less worthy. Checkin was without problems. The checkout however - although also without problems - took a while. The problem was that we checked out at the general checkout time it seemed. As they take great care of their customers, it took some time. Still they were prepared and put up some ropes so that it was obvious where to que in line. The room was nice (see pictures), it had a safe, an iron with ironing board, a kettle with some tea and coffee, a complimentary water, a TV and AC. The rooms could be darkened out completely. The bed was big and comfortable. The bathroom was also good, however when showering we always flooded the room. The only downturn in this hotel was cleanliness. Don't get me wrong, that hotel is not dirty. However there were some minor things. The room had not been vacuumed during our stay. Normally I do not care but it was obvious as there were small snippets from whatever disintegrated in our bags. That is why I noticed it. The bathroom had a toilet brush. When I used it i noticed that the container which normally holds the brush was not in its hinges anymore, it just stood on the floor with the brush leaning to the holder. Taking out the brush the cotainer tilted with water coming out of it. As I did not want to touch it, I put the brush on top of the container, leaning it to the holder. The next day after the room service was there it still was the same. This leads me to the following conclusions: Maybe they did not see it, then the toilet has not been cleaned. If they saw it, they simply did not care that the container was laying on the floor. This really should be improved. Breakfast was nice, they had many choices: sausages, bacon, eggs, yoghurt, fruits, bread, rolls, croissants, cake, other sweet breakfast things, jam and so on. You could get your coffee and tea by yourself or order a fresh cappucino for example. They managed the breakfast area well, opening up more space before it was too crowded. Tip: After the checkout we went to the train station and locked our luggage there as we still had 6 hours before our train left. It costs â‚¬ 7.50 for 24 hours. Locks are operated by maestro (with PIN) or credit card only, no cash. Just follow the signs in the train station. The hotel also offers to keep your luggage on a closed room, however as we did not feel like walking all the way back, we used the one in the station. So I can recommend this hotel who like to be a little bit away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Movenpick which they list as being in the city center...not so much. The hotel is on an island away from the city center and you have to walk to the train station before walking into the city. It took us about 30 minutes to walk to Dam Sq from the hotel. If we had realized how far the hotel was to the sights we would probably have picked a different hotel. The plus sise to being so far out though was that the hotel was very quiet. The hotel does run a shuttle to the station but you have to make reservations and the one time we tried it was booked so we never used it. We did take the 25 tram back tot he hotel at night - we walked back the first night late and while we had no problems it was very deserted so we felt ore comfortable on the tram. The hotel itself is very nice, very new and clean. Both side of the hotel have lovely water views. The double room was 2 twins pushed together which is common is Europe but different than we are used to. Beds were comfortable but I will never get used to the half shower doors which I have still not figured out how to use without flooding the bathroom. The room was good sized for a European hotel. Slow speed wireless internet was included but you had to pay for high speed. The response was pretty good so we never paid to upgrade to high speed. The TV had several English channels. Breakfast was 23 euros a piece so we never ate there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nettup
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in Amsterdam, the location is graet. there is a tram infront of the hotel that takes you to the center. it's 5 minutes waking to the central station. The rooms are pleasant, clean, very nice, A great shower and a great view from the room. The breakfast is reach & tasty. They helped out with all our requests, and gave us a lot of helpful information.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Good service and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: MarcioL
Reviews.Content: Quality rooms, good breakfast. Good service! Good for families also! During our stay we had an incident that we left our safety locker open (with valuables and cash!) and the staff locked it without touching any of the valuables inside!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, except for the one thing that ruined it”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianIndian
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was great. The room was very spacious and clean. We had a corner room on the 3rd floor and it overlooked the canal and we saw 2 cruise ships docking next to the hotel. :) There were 2 single beds (pushed together to make a king), plus a sofa bed for our son. A mini-fridge and complimentary bottle of water, plus tea/coffee and kettle were in the room and restocked daily. The housekeeping staff and in-room dining staff were excellent. The room service food was pretty fabulous. There is a bit of a walk into the city center (Central Station) - about 1.5km, but if you take a tram (which is right outside the hotel), it's less than 5 minutes to the central station. However, there was a problem with using our traveller's checks (in Euros) to pay our final bill (at check out). The day prior, we specifically asked the front desk staff if we could use our traveller's checks (in the local Euro currency) as payment for our room bill. The staff on hand said "Yes, as long as you use it for your room total and it's in the local Euro. There is no problem or commission charged." Upon check out, a different staffer told us that we'd be charged a 5% commisson (or 50 Euros) for using our traveller's checks as payment, which was completely different than what we were told the previous day. Since we checked out at 8 AM, there was no chance of going to a bank or foreign exchange place to change our travller's checks. The staffer on duty also told us that "we were misinformed" the day before and he was highly unprofessional while helping us. We were then charged the 50 Euro extra and no other apologies were given to us for being misled the previous day. Up until this point, we were highly satisfied with Movenpick and would have recommended them. But, after dealing with the very unprofessional staff at check out, our view of this hotel was definitely spoiled and we would think twice before returning or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be more than 4 star! Fantastic rooms and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: lollymclean
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever trip t oAmsterdam and we were delighted that we stayed in the Movenpick. Upon checking in the staff were very efficient and welcoming. We had booked a standard room which was extremely spacious and it had a seating area by the window that looks over the fabulous views of Amsterdam (room 1828). The cleanliness of the room made it look brand new! It also had a fridge and a safety deposit box in the room which was a great bonus. They also offer free internet if you need to go online and print things out. The room service is also very efficient with a great choice at reasonable prices 24 hours a day. The city centre is about a 10 - 20 minute walk from the hotel but there is also a tram that departs daily & hourly from outside the Movenpick Hotel (Tram number 25). It is 2.25 Euros per person for an hours pass or you can buy a 24 hour pass for 7 euros per person whick is great value. I would reccomend this if you are going as far down as the museum district. Lastly to save money avoid taxis at all costs! dont get a taxi from outside of the Airport - we got one and it was 60 euros from the airport to the Movenpick hotel. Use the train station that is accesible from inside the airport terminal and you will get to the Central station for 4 euros per person - bargin! It only takes about 5 - 10 minutes to walk from central station to the Movenpick but if you arrive at the central station between 7am & 6pm then the Movenpick will provide you with a complimentary shuttle bus to their hotel. We will definatley be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Centraal Railway Station”
Reviews.Author: jimmyza
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick in Amsterdam is a very good hotel with great views of the river and close to the big railway hub in Amsterdam. The rooms are a little small but quite comfortable. Very small gym and no hotel pool. Staff are friendly and helpful. As a business traveler it is a good place to go stay at. Wifi is free but only at around 500kb a second. If you want faster internet you need to buy it. But I did not have trouble with internet for emails and small stuff on the web. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel overlooking Amsterdam harbour”
Reviews.Author: lwwylam
Reviews.Content: While the Movenpick is not the most convenient location from which to explore the city, the hotel does offer a free shuttle every half hour to Central Station, from which it's possible to catch trams anywhere in the city. I stayed here after bidding on Priceline, for a much better rate than I could have found elsewhere, even at hotels with far fewer amenities. The desk clerk was friendly and accommodating. When I asked for a room with a view I was put on the 17th floor with an enormous picture window overlooking the harbour. The room was light and airy with comfortable beds and furnishings, including a nice work desk and office chair, as well as a comfortable sofa. 24 hour room service with very good food, reasonably priced for the area. Huge bathroom with enormous soaker tub. The room was quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The worst bed I've slept in, nice restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: aussiedreamer2
Reviews.Content: I 'won' this hotel on a bidding website. Pleasantly surprised on arrival, on finding the carpark underneath (not part of the hotel) was incredibly expensive â‚¬48 per day, was given great directions to a public car park about 2kms away. Got the tram back which is free when you park your car there and parking was â‚¬8 per day. The room was very large, the view was great but dear god the bed was terrible. So bad we really had trouble sleeping. When I won this hotel I was pleased to read a review that said the beds were better than the marriot beds!!!! Obviously the reviewer got a better bed than us. It was exactly like sleeping on the floor, terrible. Room service was quite reasonable for a 4* hotel, which is a good thing as there's nothing much around. We also ate in their restaurant one night and had an amazing meal and one of the friendliest waiters we encountered on our trip. The free internet was very helpful. Front dest staff were nice, but the lady who checked us in was a 'trainee' and not very knowledgable re carpark etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Cargenty
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 times this hotel. First I has a nice room vert clean and with the wonderful view. (11 floor))The staff always ready to help. Good shuttle services and possibility to rent bicycle. Only problem any restaurant close. The second time the room look different (14 floor). A little dirty . The housekeeper didn't come one day but in general I loved to be in this hotel. It's relax for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: schoozie
Reviews.Content: Was not sure what to expect as we flew into Schiphol and we took the train in to Centraal Station and we were aware that the hotel was not to far from the station. But not sure how far as maps can be deceiving. Anyway it took about 15 mins to walk to the hotel and that is with our suitcase. To be fair i dont walk particularly fast either. have to watch the Cyclists!!! On entering the reception it was spacious very modern looking, clean, greeted as we entered . We approached the desk and we got checked in quickly and head straight to our room. The room itself was quite big in comparison to some of the hotels we have stayed at. there was a big window which was lovely as it looked on to the harbour where you could sit and watch the boats etc coming and going. The hotel is beside the dock where cruise liners come in so handy if you are going a cruise. Only down side to the room was that we were on floor 6 on the side that looked on to the office block. You were not high enough that you couldn't see the office workers. but ti was the weekend so it was fine. There was plenty of hanging space, there was a safe, full length mirror, tea and coffee facilities although we never had a kettle but we didn't bother asking for one, hair drier, TV desk . Unfortunately we never got the chance to go to the bar/restaurant as we were out and about most of the day/evening. Overall a very pleasant stay if you dont mind a little walk to get to main things well worth stay here.

Reviews.Title: “WOW view of Amsterdam harbour, huge rooms, slightly away from centre.”
Reviews.Author: Aeonweir
Reviews.Content: A "Wow!" view in Amsterdam of the harbour, evenings are superb. Rooms are generous - true 4* hotel size and decor. There is (limited but sufficient) free wifi in the rooms. The only downside is that it is a bit of a walk to Central Station. If the weather is nice it is a fine walk of 10-15minutes. There is a tram that stops across the street and is one stop from Central Station, it runs quite regularly but not all night. Be aware that on days when a ship is arriving/leaving you might get an earth shaking blast at 6:00am - not often, not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great View over the City”
Reviews.Author: AussieAssault
Reviews.Content: We booked through a bidding website, and got a great price (70USD per night). It is a 10 minute walk straight from Central Station. The hotel itself towers over the surrounding area and we had great views looking back over the city area on about the 16th floor. We hired bikes for the time we were there so just chained them up on the fence outside the complex, and had easy access to the town using them. Amsterdam is built for bikes so it felt un-natural not to be on one of them. There is also a shuttle that runs to and from the station every 30 mins, and a tram stop directly out the front of the hotel which takes you directly in through the main part of town (Dam Square etc). The rooms were very modern, very clean and the beds were fantastic. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone wanted to be out of the hustle and bustle, but still close enough to it that you dont spend half a day getting back and forth. Regards, Aussie Assault www.flashpackgo.com

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL WITH FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: jcfbumpkin
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in mid May at the Moevenpick. I had purchased two rooms for my family. The rooms were large nice and very clean. Although off the beaten path it was no problem. We just purchased a GVD pass and hopped on tram 25 which takes you to the city center. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were going on a cruise and the ship docked right beside the hotel. This made boarding a snap. Here are the negatives. Be careful in the bath tub . It is slick, and is very tall with about a 20" to 24" height to the floor. The bathroom floors are also slick tile. There is no exit handle from the tub other than a towel rack. We do not have mobility issues, but I can see where this could be a real problem for the elderly or those with mobility issues. So be careful here. I had heard complainants about the cleanliness of the toilets. Our toilets were slightly stained, but I believe this may have been caused by chemicals in the water. It was not bad at all and Ive seen much worse. Other than that the room was spotless. I would highly recommend this hotel especially for those going on a cruise from Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price - however far from perfect,”
Reviews.Author: taholl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good condition, the room was great -> almost 5 stars hotel. however. there are no balconies in this hotels, and the window only opens into a small crack. all the deisgn is shouting buisness hotel the hotel is situtated 10 minutes of walk from the center -> not that far if you consider the amount of walking we did - but nothing much to see around beside ships and cannals - which is a nice view out of the window but not as friendlly when you walk by. The hotel has a complete no smoking policy which some people (like me) will find problematic when you spend a vacation in Amsterdam. the policy is very strict and includes a fine of 150 euro and kicking you out of the hotel. smoking outside is also not an enjoyable thing - the hotel is quite far and there is nothing next to it. which means very cold winds (in the end of may) and it is not a great joy. it could have been nice if they had a protected place next to the hotel. the food in the morning was nice/ my rank to the hotel would be 3.5 and not 3.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, Great service, location so-so”
Reviews.Author: sankar
Reviews.Content: Large rooms for Amsterdam, with views over the waterfront behind the Amsterdam Station. The sofa-bed is comfortable for an extra adult or kid. Free shuttle ever 30 mins to and from the Amsterdam Station, which is otherwise a 10-15 min walk away along the waterfront. It was raining a bit during our stay, so we made good use of the shuttle. Breakfast is very good, but dinner was so-so, suggest you try other places to eat in Amsterdam. Service is very good, concierge and shuttle drivers very friendly and helpful. Overall a very good place, mainly chose this hotel as it had big rooms which could accomodate 3 people comfortably, but will stay in a more central and older part of town next time. Free internet also a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: loobyloo57
Reviews.Content: I read reviews that it was isolated from city centre, but you have excellent tram connections (2 mins from Hotel) Hop on canal boat was also 2 mins from hotel. The walk into centre of Amsterdam was 15 - 20 mins and that was at a leisurely pace taking in the sights and sounds of beautiful Amsterdam. All the staff at hotel were great. Breakfast was also very good. We had a meal in main restuarant and againwas excellent but a little pricey. Would return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service but let down by the food”
Reviews.Author: Sayer
Reviews.Content: The service offered to get to the hotel was excellent. Calling the concierge from the train at Schipol Airport meant that there was a hotel shuttle bus waiting at Amsterdam Centraal when the train arrived there. The transer was very quick, around five minutes. (Equally it is only a short walk from the station).This made getting to the hotel from the airport both exceptionally easy and low cost. If only other hotels offered such a useful service. At the hotel I was warmly greeted by the reception staff and offered a free upgrade to a juionr suite with a double aspect view over the harbour and towards the nautical museum. The room was bright, modern and minimalist as you would expect from a Movenpick hotel. The bathroom had a separate shower cubicle and a decent length bath. In the main room was a Nespresso machine with a good selection of coffees. The television had the novelty of being able to swing round from the main room to the bedroom on a turntable in a cupboard that opened in the bedroom. There is a menu of pillows to ensure a good night's sleep. The hotel is in an ideal location for visit to the main sites of Amsterdam with everything close by and available. It has a lot of water around it giving it the feeling of not being in the centre of a city. The downside of the hotel was the quality of the breakfast. Having stayed in Movenpick's before the breakfast is usually a highlight. In this hotel it was the biggest disappointment with the choices limited from the usual international hotel offering and the quality somewhat disappointing. Despite that I would highly recommend this hotel, not only for a business visit but also for a personal one.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel, 10 minute walk from town”
Reviews.Author: feefeeee
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for a week, and stayed in an apartment on a canal for 4 nights, then moved to the Moevenpick for 3 nights. It is a beautiful hotel, clean, modern, with fantastic views, plus if you do your research you can usually get some deals that include breakfast or free nights etc. The bathroom is really clean, and there are plenty of elevators in the hotel, so you will never have to wait for one. Being 20 years old when I stayed at this hotel, I did get a few snobby looks from fellow travelers (who are mostly over 40 as this hotel isn't exactly cheap..) however this doesn't reflect on the hotel. I did notice a couple of times the arrival of airline staff members while I was here, so it is definitely a hotel of high standards. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Centraal Station, so it is a bit out of the way, however it is very quiet, and the beds are so comfortable it is very much so worth it. There is a free shuttle bus that takes you to the station, however make sure you book this in advance when catching a train back to the airport etc. We had complimentary breakfast with out room, and it was amazing, there was even chefs in the breakfast area to cook you omelets etc to your desire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Ektanish
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Movenpick was very comfortable. To begin with the concierge was responsive and accomodative of our request for a pick up and guided us well on where we can expect him and what to look out for. The reception staff too was very helpful with supporting enquiries. The room service staff were the best, they were like the quiet and super efficient, rooms clean, all utilities made available and the best part was since we were travelling with a child we had opted for 2 twin beds however to our lovely surprise when we returned in the evening our sofa which could also be used as a bed was nicely done up with extra bedding and pillow and all. The views of the pier and the boats and ships was very serene and we had a lovely time. Would love to return back someday to enjoy the city more..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: Miri_K84
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not located right in the center of the city but everything is accessible within walking distance of 10 minutes and there is public transportation right in front of the hotel, the hotel staff was very polite, happy to help and give information. The hotel's breakfast is very luxurious and filling, just lick your fingers!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: osty6
Reviews.Content: This was a fab place and we booked this through Lastminute.com as a secret hotel. We went to see the tulips in Keukenhof garden and just loved everything. The hotel has wonderful views overlooking the water. Every evening we got to see the sunset and the city lights from the 18th floor. And it was fantastic! But just as another guest has written the toilet could do with another bit of cleaning. The rest was all fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: magnumgold
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in our first trip to Amsterdam in March. The hotel was lovely with amazing views, a huge bed, great bathroom, sofa and loads of storage space. There is a great place by the hotel to rent bikes which is great and it's also next to a tram stop which takes you stright into town but it's only a 15 minute walk anyway. The windows were really think so we slept very well and you can alter the heat in the room too. The breakfasts were brilliant with juice, tea, coffee, bacon, yogurt, cheese, cereal, croissants and much much more. We had no problems at all and the staff were always polite. I would absolutely reccommend this hotel we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, although a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: catalan_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Moevenpick Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is modern, big for Amsterdam standards, and despite the location (not in the city center as the name suggests), very convenient. It is a 15-minute walk from Central Station, and a couple of minutes with the free shuttle bus, but I would definitely suggest renting a bicycle from the parking lot right in front of the hotel. Renting a bike on the 2nd day of our stay, and not towards the end, was a very good decision!! I have two negative comments about the hotel, and both are regarding room service. On 1 occasion, the tea cup and an empty bottle left the night before were not discarded, and in the case of the tea, not replaced. On another occasion, we left dirty towels on the floor of the bathroom when we left in the morning, and found them folded again when we came back in the evening. From previous experience I understood that leaving dirty towels on the floor is a request for clean ones? It was surely my expectation, which was not met. I don't think this is acceptable for the price of this hotel. Everything else was very good (including free internet), so overall, I would recomment this hotel. I didn't have breakfast, so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Falling short of 4 star status on service and cleanliness...”
Reviews.Author: monkeykieran
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend over the Easter weekend. We arrived late on Thursday night as our flight was delayed and walked from Centraal station. This is not a great idea, whilst it is only a 15 minute walk, with bags and with several of the roads under construction and with an entrance that appears much nearer than it is (you have to walk 400 metres-ish round instead of taking a direct bridge as there is for the neighbouring concert hall). When we checked in the service was rushed and un-friendly (an older gentleman with shaved head and glasses), and actually unhelpful when asking about ways to get about. We got to our room to find it was a twin-room, not a double as specifically requested but by this time we were so shattered that we just wanted to sleep. The inside of the toilet was absolutely disgusting, brown almost all over, as if they hadn't been cleaned in weeks or months. More fitting of a scene from trainspotting than a supposed 4 star hotel?! We assumed this would be sorted out when we left the following day (I indeed left a note for the cleaners written in Dutch and English), however it was still the same when we returned. The following morning I went to reception to tell them about this problem (and that we had run out of shower gel on the inbuilt dispenser), they said they would look into it immediately. When we returned there was an additional pile of towels, and various other bathroom accessories but no shower gel and still the same dirty toilet. This time I called reception by phone, around 30 minutes later a lady arrived from housekeeping that saw the toilet and told me she couldn't clean it as it required something stronger that would leave a bad smell in the room for us, I explained that I didn't mind as we were about to leave, but she insisted it couldn't be done. It was as if she didn't feel this was a problem (also still no shower gel despite another request). By this time I had given up and admitted defeat, it was pretty disgusting to have a filthy toilet in your room but they were not going to do anything about and I didn't want to spend my whole weekend complaining, they clearly didn't care. I also did not want to clean it myself and have to fork out for cleaning equipment that I would only use once. Until this point we also received no apology or explanation. There were also chips in the woodwork in the room and some of the shower panels were a bit dirty. When we checked out for the sake of the next guests I told them about the problem again which they finally apologised for but no idea if anything was done. In the hot weather a few extra waters in the fridge might be a nice suggestion too, as well more than one (normal) tea bag supplied each day. Positive points were a nice view of the harbour, and being quiet away from any street noise and good air con and shower. The was free internet (slow unless you paid extra) and we never made it to the fitness suite as in the hot weather a pool would have been nice, not a sauna.The single beds although not what was asked for were comfortable and clean. Also you can get the 35 tram from a 5 minute walk away to a large chunk of the city. There were no near shops or bars (apart from ones in the bar) so you felt also a bit isolated. For 150 euros a night this hotel doesn't come close to other hotels in terms of comfort. It is quite convenient for centraal station which you can get about easily from but it you are looking to pay around this amount per evening I have stayed at much nicer, and much better located places, where you will be treated with respect. Another minor thing is to check the Hotels.com small print, although it says all taxes included in the main text the small print says city tax is to be paid at the hotel, which was around an extra 5 euros a day. We had a really nice weekend despite these points but I would not recommend this place to any friends or family. Being half-Dutch with my family living in Amsterdam I will be letting everyone know to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: WeybridgeScottie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights booked it through Thomas Cook paid for 3 nights and got the 4th free which was quite a good deal for a 4* hotel in Amsterdam. A child can stay for free in the room as long as they sleep on the sofa bed which my son found really comfy.We had a room on the 6th floor with a great view of the river watching the cruise ships arrive and depart. The room was very clean and it had a nice bathroom, there are tea and coffee facilities which are refilled each day. Breakfast wasn't included in our tarrif but 23 euros is alot for breakfast but you can get some cheaper breakfast options in the bar or just eat breakfast in town.If you have teenagers there are two free playstations outside the restaurant if they want that sort of entertainment. Don't bother with the expensive transfer bus from the airport that goes around all the hotels just get the train from the airport to central station and exit on the river side, ring the hotel and the free shuttle bus arrives twice and hour and will take you to the hotel it's very easy and much cheaper. You have to book the shuttle bus so if you are using it for your flight back book it in advance as it only carries about 6 to 8 pax on each journey.The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the centre of town but it's a nice walk if you want to be in the centre of Amsterdam you need to stay elsewhere or use the trams No 25 and 26 stop next to the hotel. Tram 25 goes to Dam square in two or 3 stops, you can buy the tram passes from the gift shop in the hotel 7 euros for 24 hours.Remember you have to pay a 5% hotel tax on check out. We really enjoyed staying at this hotel and it was quite nice to return to the peace and quiet at night and watch the boats on the river and then be refreshed to see the sights of Amsterdam the next day. You can rent bikes from near the hotel but we used Mikes bikes and went on a great countryside tour which lasted 4 hours and cost 22 euros, well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_Araujo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. It's new, everything works, the staff is very courteous. It is about 5-10 minutes walk from Centraal Station. The route is pretty safe during the day and night. We rent bicycles and it was perfect. It's worth paying a little more and staying in executive rooms. The view from the room is incredible (we were on the 21st floor!). And between 17:00 and 19:00 were snacks and drinks free. They were very good. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location is Okay”
Reviews.Author: Rurban88
Reviews.Content: The Moevenpick is a beautiful hotel with great amenities. The rooms are spacious and very nice with beautiful bathrooms. The hotel is very clean and modern with very helpful staff. The one issue I had with the Movenpick was the location. While it was beautiful being on the water and having great views from our 11th floor room, the hotel is a bit out of the way. It is about a 10 minute walk to the central train station, but it takes around 30 minutes to walk to any major sights other than the red light district. I would probably stay here again since the hotel is so comfortable and beautiful, but the location was definitely a bit of a downside for me since I enjoy being in the center of things.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located with a few gliches”
Reviews.Author: bren53Cork
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week-end got it as a mystery hotel with easy-to-book at a special rate. Had a room on the 9th floor which gives you a spectacular view of amsterdam. The draw back is mainly in getting by foot to central station and city centre is rather like going thro' a building site. I enquired at book in how much was the breakfast and was quoted a very step â‚¬23 now i discovered the following morning that the bar was serving breakfast for far less this was never pointed out to me, The other concern i would have is that there were signs of mildew in the shower cubical which would indicate that the hotel is lacking in cleanliness that one would expect from a hotel of this standard.Also the kettle in room was faulty and showed no indication of when it was serviced.

Reviews.Title: “I recomend”
Reviews.Author: Hakeri123
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good shape.Great view from upper floors. Stuff at the reception could be better, concierge desk very good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great room, great food, great location.”
Reviews.Author: TheScream77
Reviews.Content: Paid the 60 euros (for 2 people) a night extra to upgrade to an executive suite with high speed internet, breakfast buffet and executive lounge access. Totally worth it. Very close to Amsterdam Centraal station (10 min walk) and all the main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but poor location”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav17
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and the view from my room was superb. I was upgraded to a Junior Suite, which was very nice and certainly much beyond the needs of one person travelling with a few items of clothing. Be warned, however, that the hotel is a brisk 20-minute walk from the Central Train Station and as you walk from the CS to the hotel, you are walking in the direction of a suburb. So, unless your destination is the Music Hall, you have no reason to walk in that direction. A 10% "city tax" on top of an already steep rate was a nasty surprise at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek business hotel - but quite expensive and quite a walk into town”
Reviews.Author: MJH1
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest, I have hurt my leg skiing and so walking long distances is a bit of a hassle at the moment, that being said the Moevenpick is still quite a hike from the port area into the heart of amsterdam The port is a bit grubby and the views from my 15th floor room are a lot more grim than I thought they would be - could only see building site and back of centraal station Room is large, clean and modern, bar is great, buffet breakfast is good but pricey, staff all nice In summary hotel is fine for business, wouldn't stop here on social trip due to lack of charm / intimacy, don't mind the walking at all - just not with a bad leg!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms for an Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ville J
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located near the Central Station. Very big and modern rooms for an Amsterdam hotel. Nice scenic views in to the river (/sea). Modern place, very clean and comes with an international atmosphere. Room was located on a 15th floor. Breakfast was extensive and the restaurant was nicely decorated. Basic speed internet was free of charge (WLAN). Very good experience all-in-all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: mowaller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within easy walking distance from the city centre. The staff were polite and very helpful and helped to make our stay an enjoyable one. I would recommend this hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt amazed!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne83
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Central Station and was advised the hotel was nearby ... after a 15 minute walk with a wheelie case we finally arrived! Needless to say, we didnt walk into the centre again and bought an OV chipkaart. It was more than okay to walk, however this hotel was not in the middle of Amsterdam. The reception area was very modern, as were the rooms - although they looked like they had jumped out of Ikea brochure) The bathroom was very modern. The bed was comfy, Prior to arriving, we had read reviews about hotel staff being a little on the snobby side. We didnt find this, we found the staff to be very helpful. I would not say we had an unpleasent stay at all, however we wouldnt pick to stay here again, due to its location and lack of charm.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: ektor019
Reviews.Content: Very good location for this modern hotel,a new quarter of Amsterdam,quiet and fascinating. The gymnasium is free! The bedroom was large and comfortable. The restaurant was not at the same level,even if the waiters were very polite. The hall of the hotel was wide and comfortable,with a nice shop and a full equipped bar area,where You can have a light breakfast if You don't want a continental one.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel just a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: julieandpaul2009
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just a little more out of the way than i realised. If we had gone when the weather was a little warmer the walk into town would have been a little more pleasest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SomnioAmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple of friends to enjoy the city of Amsterdam. While it's a very nice hotel, I would say it's perfectly suited for business travelers...not so much for the leisure traveler. The hotel is modern and clean with nice, large rooms and great bathrooms. The free wifi is wonderful and the views from the windows aren't bad either. You can usually find a really good deal online for this hotel. The downsides...it's a bit of a walk to get to anywhere. When housekeeping was supposed to bring us something, it took quite a while. Housekeeping was also quite loud in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good - not great”
Reviews.Author: pgbDublin
Reviews.Content: Modern business hotel. Spotlessly clean rooms & bathroom. Good city view, the even-numbered rooms look out on the city. Close to tram stop (No. 25 & 26, one stop from Central Station). Away from the city, so it's quiet. There is a Canal Bus stop close to the hotel. We took the boat into the city one morning, on our 24 hour ticket. We did the all-routes canal tour. Once you've seen one canal, you've seen them all - maybe 2 tours is plenty. Good pub : De Bekeerde Suster at Kloveniersburgwal 6-8. Three own-brew beers plus a menu of Dutch & Belgian ones. Good food, good atmosphere, friendly service. Good breakfast: Aran Irish Pub, Max Euweplein, near the Hard Rock cafe, near the Rijksmuseum. Amsterdam Museum not worth the entrance fee. Van Gogh Museum definitely is.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way but an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: K1m83rl3y
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Movenpick Amsterdam and found it to be a wonderful place to stay, the staff are so helpful, kind and polite, the rooms are lovely. We stayed on 18th floor and the view was amazing. We stayed with breakfast included which was beautiful buffet style food with lovely service. The only downside was it was slightly out of the way of the busy area and we found ourselves staying out all day and night (which isn't a problem as there is so much to do anyway). Room service is also lovely. We are impressed with everything the hotel had to offer. If we went back to Amsterdam we would more than likely stay somewhere right in the city centre, however we would not deter anybody from staying here as it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good location and service”
Reviews.Author: jakemassey0303
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Moevenpick with a friend for a long weekend on my first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel itself has a great location, with views over the river. The only problem being that it can sometimes get noisy with all the boats, etc. but never anything too bad. It's a 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station and 15 minutes from the town centre. Check in was quick and easy, the staff are all very polite and helpful. They also did their best to honour a request for a high room that my friend had asked for. Breakfast was equally well done and catered for a lot of international tastes, as well as my grastronomical British-fare. My top tip: don't get a taxi from the airport - it's expensive and it turns out to be quicker to actually get a train to Grand Central and do the walk (or even tram). To put into context: 50 euros for a cab, less than 5 for the train! Anyway - great city and hotel, I'm sure you'll love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Leonmjohnson
Reviews.Content: Nice room nice staff good bed not far to walk in to town or just jump on the tram they run from just out side â‚¬7 24 hour pass tajes u all over the dam Big thanks to all the team @ the Movenpick - keep up the good work As I will be coming back All the best mr & mrs Johnson room 606

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: beligerent_ghoul
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our anniversary through last minute as one of their secret hotels. The hotel is a 10 min walk from central station, it is set on a complex of buildings and is very very quiet. We had a room on the 11th floor with a beautiful view towards the city and of the water, the hotel offer a shuttle service every half hour straight to the central station, which is a great place to start exploring. Infront of the hotel is a bike hire shop, which we used, a great way to see the city. The hotel offered free wifi, a service i wish all hotels would offer. the hotel bar was nice and the hotel in general was very good, very nice room with good style. The hotel also had leisure facilities, but we never used them. All in all a great hotel in a great, just out of the hustle and bustle, location. worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for people who like peace and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Quig09
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, quiet and spotlessly clean hotel. The people who complain about walking into town really should get a life, it's only 15 minutes for goodness sake! However ,on arrival I had to fight long and hard to get the free breakfast that I was entitled to (and that was after a very long and fraught journey). Also one of the people on the concierge desk really needs to go for a personality transplant - I asked him one (wet) day if the courtesy bus was going into town, he said "two people?" and when I said yes he said "NO". That was his one word answer to a reasonable and polite enquiry about the bus that the hotel advertise as going on request. UNBELIEVABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with easy commute.”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Philips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. Once we figured out the trams was easy to get around. Lovely hotel with great buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel in great city!”
Reviews.Author: Michael-TCS
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and a good choice for anyone who wants to stay in Amsterdam. From the first when you see the hotel from outside looks very elegant and yes it is. We stay here for two days in a double, breakfast included room. The staff was very polite and always happy to help as for any question we have and especially the employ at the concierge. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the main train station but if you want you can walk there it is just a 10 minutes by the sea walk. The room was great with a breath taking view to the sea. The bed as I have already said it is a double one not two twins together like some other hotels do. The breakfast was very nice and has everything we ask for. Also the free Wifi is a plus and have very good speed. I must write something about the parking and help travellers by car like me. The hotel hasnâ€™t any parking itself but there is an underground municipal parking in front of the hotel but it cost 48 Euros per day. I believe that there is a lot of money so I can give you another much cheaper option. At the Amsterdam there are the P+R parking that cost 8 euro per day and also they give you, for how many you are, tram tickets to and from the city centre. The nearest P+R parking is the Zeeburg and by tram No 26 it is only 3 stops to Moevenpick. Just do not forget to validate your tickets at the tram because if you donâ€™t you lose the discount. A nice to see Amsterdam is the 7 euro daily tram ticket; if you buy one you will remember my words.
