The Moevenpick Amsterdam is a great hotel with great employs and, this is my opinion, isnâ€™t very far from city centre and i believe that in the summer staying at this hotel will be the best choise for a stay at the beautiful town of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSW1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for the weekend and had a really great stay. 15 mins away from station but nice walk along the river, impressive hotel nice and clean with friendly staff, the room was modern and a great view over city. The beds were so comfortable, free drinks and snacks between 5-7 in the executive lounge was different and restaurant well worth a visit. Breakfast excellent, mini bar package was okay but considering paying for it having only 2 beers and no spirits wines etc was not great. Turn down service on a night with swiss chocolates was a nice touch, would stay again even with the walk to the town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LGCPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Moevenpick hotel over a weekend in January 2011. Excellent hotel, service and accomodation, We stayed at a junior suite on the top floor and really appreciated the view from the room and the special touches, such as the complimentary mini-bar and bottled water. The room included a buffet breakfast though access to the executive room. This was one of the better breakfast buffet's that I have enjoyed over the years. In summary this was my first experience with this Swiss chain of hotels and I was very impressed. Had a small initial concern given the location, which was somewhat isolated, but this turned out to be no issue at all, as the hotel was within a fifteen minute walk from the Central Train Station which felt absolutely safe and secure even when accomplished late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Virus
Reviews.Content: I booked the Movenpick on lastminute.ie as a "top secret hotel" (wasn't too hard to figure out which hotel it was though) at a great rate. The reasons I chose it were the overall good TA reviews, modern design, spacious rooms and great views. I was very happy with my choice. Pros: * polished and efficient reception staff, * spacious, clean and comfortable room with sitting area, sufficient storage and good and plentiful lighting, * great views from the room (ask for a higher floor), * comfortable bed with good linen, * flat-screen TV with a good selection of channels, * very nice and clean bathroom (although the toiletries provided are limited), * no noise issues, * free shuttle to/from the central train station (needs to be pre-booked). Cons: * location wise, it is not in the thick of things; thus a little bit of a hassle getting into the historical centre (via shuttle, tram or long-ish walk) and there is a lack of restaurants nearby. Having said that, a walk from the hotel to the train station on the promenade in a nice weather is great and takes only about 15 min. Overall, a great place and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, a little far from everything though”
Reviews.Author: spud_jones87
Reviews.Content: Hi, just a quick review, we stayed here for one night in November 2010. We read a few reviews that said it was only a couple of minutes away from centraal station, and so decided to walk. First point is take the back (riverside) exit, as it leads you out onto the main road, and then if you look right you can see the movenpick. I would stay that with a suitcase, I would definitely consider a cab, as it is more like a 5 to 10 minute walk over cobbled streets and felt a little far. The room itself was fine, I liked the hello Mr and Mrs Jones message on the TV, considering I was there with my girlfriend. The room was modern, and the bathroom, safe etc... was what you'd expect from a 4* hotel, and for the price was fine. There was a subway less than five minutes away, and we got room service which was nice, and the price was reasonable. Overall, was a good price, and very nice hotel, only issue was the location, as it wasn't perfect for visiting the 'dam, however i think is actually a hotel for cruise liner visitors, as it was actually above where you would board the ship. Thanks for the pleasant one nights stay!

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: fizzleIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online to stay for three nights with my two friends.when we first arrived the man at the receptionist desk was very rude and didt want to give us the price which was given to us online and also wanted to charge us a hundred euro deposit per night even do there was nothing about this on their website.he then agreed to charge 50euros per night.every thing was off a high standerd after that untill I left my personal identification card in the room when I rang up they wanted my credit card to charge me to send it back in the post to Ireland they also tryed to say that it was illegal to send it back.he then said he would send it to my local police station if i filled out a form and it got charged to my credit card.i was a paying customer whats the price of a stamp ?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, marvelous view”
Reviews.Author: MikeJameson
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, clean and modern with large rooms - some of which have spectacular views of the Amsterdam skyline and river traffic. Nice bar and restaurant on the main floor. A Subway sandwich shop is right next door if you get the urge. Public transport is right outside the front door, but many interesting locations are within walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The Hotel is very expensive, but the location and amenities make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: DesiJat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and of a 4star standard although it surprisingly does not have a swimming pool or a steam room, instead it has 2 sauna's. Room was spacious enough and had free wi-fi, which was essential. It is located a little out of Amsterdam Centre and although the hotel says it's only a 10 min walk, it's actually about 20 mins if you're in good shape. The reception service is also not great. Our room was not ready when we arrived to check in and there is no queing system at reception, so there was usually a bit of a wait with people queue jumping, which the reception staff did not seem to care about. I would advise staying there only if you get a very good deal on price and there is nothing comparable available closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: alexandrasousa
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in this hotel and all went just fine! The room is spacious, staff extremely friendly and professional, bathroom very good and modern, all very clean. I asked room service, which was quick and the food is well presented and tasty. There is just a small issue that should be solved: the minibar is empty, however room service is 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a walk into the main centre, but clean and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: browngate
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly staff, great rooms, well furnished. Only downside is the walk into Amsterdam - probably about 15 minutes which normally is fine but at dark it's a little quiet and wouldn't do it alone. Also, quite expensive and not including breakfast in the price however we suspect this is characteristic of Amsterdam rather than this hotel specifically.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, can't recommend it highly enough”
Reviews.Author: BeckyColley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Amsterdam for NYE and booked this hotel based on other recommendations we'd read on this site. We were not at all disappointed. The hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk from Centraal Station or one stop on the tram (line 25 or 26). Being slightly out of the centre meant a really peaceful nights sleep but everything is very easily accessible. An unlimited 24 hour travelcard costs 7 euro and can be used on trams and buses (I think water buses too but we only used the tram). Upon check-in we found the staff the be incredibly helpful and friendly. We were initially told that the king bed we'd booked wasn't available however we could wait to see if this changed: we decided to wait and have a drink in the bar and within 10 minutes a king room had been found. If you do visit the bar I recommend the chocomel with whipped cream! Our room was on the 14th floor with amazing views over the river and city (I just wish we'd been lucky enough to experience clearer skies). Our room and bathroom were spotlessly clean throughout our stay. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms spacious. I used the free wi-fi several times and found the connection to be fast and reliable. We had breakfast both mornings and it was delicious with lots of choice, ranging from fruit and yoghurt to cold meats and cheese to bacon and eggs. We also had room service and ordered four cheese pizza and a chicken sandwich (from the night menu), both of which were delicious. Check-out was smooth and fast, and when we came back in the evening to collect our bags they were brought out to us very quickly. The only downside I can think of is a very minor complaint - the shower was quite weak, possible due to us being on such a high floor, and one of the main things I usually love about hotels is the power shower. But as I said, a minor issue! All in all this is a really fantastic hotel, I couldn't recommend it highly enough. I would certainly be happy to stay here again if I ever return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: morgan88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel under their special, "stay 3 nights and pay for 2". Unfortunately, due to the winter storms in Europe, we arrived a day late. The rate of our rooms would have been much higher since we were only staying 2 nights, however, they completely honored the initial rate, which we were very pleased with. Breakfast was included in our room rate and it was excellent. Plenty of options to choose from and the service in the restaurant was excellent. We ordered room service for our daughters one evening and the food arrived promptly and hot. Our only complaint was a very leaky bathroom faucet that unfortunately soaked a pair of our shoes which we didn't realize were placed directly in line of that leak. The location is ideal if you're looking for peace & quiet. Beautiful views from the room and the hotel is on the tram line, however...a bit of a challenge walking from the tram in 3" of snow. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: ronmish
Reviews.Content: very good location 10 minets wallk from sentrel station. very good Breakfast .beautiful view from the rooms.big and clean rooms.comfortable bed.shuttle to sentrel station every 30 minutes No Charge. free WIFI in the room. the hotel staff polite and pleasant,

Reviews.Title: “Best in class service”
Reviews.Author: MarjerBi
Reviews.Content: Service is among the best I have encountered in Europe. All staff is very qualified and helpful. Overall the hotel is very good ( gym, room with nice view on the river, nice bed) the restaurant is really good. Again, consistent with the rest of the hotel. Only caveat: location is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic staff and quality service”
Reviews.Author: CKOReilly
Reviews.Content: My brother and I just spent 4 nights at the Moevenpick Hotel and had a wonderful time. The hotel is slightly out of the centre, but is only a 10min walk from Central Station, and thus a 20min walk from Dam Square. Frankly, this did not bother us as we enjoyed the short walk, had no noise of the city to deal with, and loved the great views from our room on the 10th floor. The staff at the check-in desk and the concierges desk (where they will happily book you tickets for museums, book transport and give info) were very friendly, and the Business Centre has free use of computers and printing so we could sort boarding passes etc whenever needed. The bar was quiet when we were there but had a nice atmosphere, and the restaurant for breakfast was busy but kept efficiently clean all morning. The breakfast itself is huge with cold meat selections, cooked breakfast section with eggs to order, a healthy bit with yoghurts etc. and a patisserie/bakery section. I eat like a horse so got my money's worth! The room was always spotless and we had free bottles of water left for us every day. We had some trouble getting the heating to a reasonable level, but when it's -13C outside and you're hot thats not so bad! Room service was always prompt (within 20 mins) but we didn't use other facilities like the gym/spa. All in all, a very pleasurable stay, and we'll return here with every visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “More then we expected”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Amsterdam with my sister and her 1.5 years old baby. Chose this hotel because it was new and modern, free internet, and a pretty good deal. The rooms were big and clean, the staff were incredibly helpful and kind, the breakfast was very good. The location is not that good, but the hotel offer a free shuttle to the central station, and trams are available just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: YossiM
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel close to the central station. we chose this hotel for a city break of 4 days. we got a deal of 2 nights + 1 night free which was superb. in addition the hotel offered free breakfast and free Internet so we could not hope for more. The hotel offers a free shuttle service every 30 minutes to the central station which we found very usefull. it also served by Trams 25 and 26, so you can go directly to the Dam square and other areas. the room was modern and nice, the view of the Canal is great and the service was excellent. we would highly recommend this hotel if you find a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Deliver on Internet Promises”
Reviews.Author: GoldCountryKid
Reviews.Content: I took a last minute internet special via TripAdvisor and felt that the hotel did not deliver the commitments made on their web page and booking agents. I took their "Executive Suite" option and was promised an "Executive Breakfast" which turned out to be my choice of coffee or orange juice. Additional 23E for the real breakfast. I was also promised a complimentary stocked mini-bar - the fridge was empty... It is a tram ride to anywhere open at night. The "Free Wi-Fi Internet" turned out to be throttled. Basic email OK, but Hulu and YouTube was a non-starter. I will keep looking for my Amsterdam home away, this was not it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: bluejava2
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Moevenpick is a nice hotel, business class style. Our room on the 14th floor faced West, which was a breathtaking view. We booked a twin room. Was pleased to get a sofa like bench for sitting on and putting our personal items. The beds were just ok. We felt they could have been more comfortable. The bathroom was nice and bright. Only issue was the temperature, where the water would feel hot, then cold, the hot, etc. The breakfast buffet, at 23 euros I believe, was wonderful. Lots of variety, including an omelette station and various kinds of hot breakfast meats. When we arrived, only the main seating area was opened, so we had a bit of a wait in finding a place to sit for two. We did not have a car so we took the tram to/from Centraal. Walking to the station in the winter was not our ideal situation, but we can definitely see this being a good option during better weather. Being our 3rd visit to Amsterdam, we would prefer to be near the city center, Dam Square, as there are restaurants and shops right at the doorsteps. Amsterdam is such a fun and beautiful city that we would rather be close to the action and the quaint canals. We would definitely consider staying again at this hotel, but clearly it would not be among our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “BREAKFAST FREE FOR ALL”
Reviews.Author: kerrieluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a large group at the Hotel and when we went down to breakfast it was extremely difficult to find a place to sit because staff had not cleared away from previous diners and this was very frustrating. People were milling around the food and there did not seem to be sufficient staff to ask directions of what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly, helpful staff, in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: mlusky
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. Its only a block or 2 from the main train station and most of the things to do in Amsterdam. Convenient location. Friendly staff, free shuttle to the train station, beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “If you know the layout of the city - stay here”
Reviews.Author: gst1
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re happy with knowing your way round town and using the public transport system then I would say the Movenpick is an excellent choice of hotel in Amsterdam. The No. 25/26 tram stop is 3 minute walk from hotel entrance. You can be at Centraal Station in less than 10 minutes if you time it right. If youâ€™re visiting as a tourist arriving into Schipol then pop into the tourist information shop near terminal 2 arrivals and purchase your return train and also your tram/bus electronic chip ticket in 1 go. Once arrived off the train into Amsterdam Centraal you can then hop straight onto a number 25/26 tram out of the main entrance (not the Noord side). Swipe your ticket past the scanners on entry and exit of the tram â€“ very 21st century! We found the hotel to be very clean and functional, the bedroom was a good size compared with city centre Amsterdam hotels. Bathroom was large and clean. Good use of space for safe/fridge/storage areas. TV is an old style CRT, but worked fine. Excellent views over the city north towards the station. We found the location very quiet for a restful sleep. Breakfast was offered but not taken as it cost more than we paid for the room each night! We snagged a Hotwire deal at $84 (Â£52) a night mid November, Sunday-Wednesday â€“ a great price for this 4 star hotel. Location is right next to the Ship Passenger Terminal and also the music centre. On warmer days/nights itâ€™s a nice walk into town from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big Harbour View!”
Reviews.Author: krp329
Reviews.Content: When I started planning our short 3-night stay in Amsterdam (a stop-over en route to Spain), my initial preference was for a small hotel with character in the centrum or the canal belt; however, by coincidence, we were planning to be there the weekend of the Amsterdam Marathon, as well during Dutch school holidays, and everything was very booked up. The few places that had vacancies were not terribly well-reviewed, and were more expensive than a centrally located, 4-star hotel that was available through hotwire.com. So we took a chance booking â€œblindâ€� and were pleased when our prepaid, non-refundable booking resulted in the Moevenpick, which lived up to its good reviews here on TripAdvisor. We arrived at Schiphol early in the afternoon; it was an easy train ride to Central Station, and then a short, 10-minute walk from there to the hotel, rolling our suitcases. We could have called for the free shuttle to come pick us up at the station, but we had been traveling for almost twenty-four hours; it was a pleasant, sunny day and the fresh air and the walk felt great. Check-in was quick and efficient, and when we arrived at our room, we were amazed with the panoramic view over the harbour, towards the train station. The room was a bit smaller than many North American hotel rooms, but was well laid-out, with good closet space and a safe. A small fridge, and a kettle for making coffee and tea were also provided. During our stay, we enjoyed having our morning coffee while watching the barges and ferries moving up and down the river, and the city lights were very pretty at night. Not having travelled much in Europe, and being jet-lagged and definitely not not â€œfiring on all cylindersâ€�, we had a few puzzled moments trying to figure out how to get the lights working in the room. None of the electrical switches in the room worked until the electronic room key card was firmly inserted into a gizmo just inside the entry. This makes it impossible to leave the lights on while you are out of the room. Through the remainder of our month-long holiday, we realized that these systems are widespread in hotels in Europe, which seems to be â€œlight-yearsâ€� ahead of North America in energy conservation. The beds were very comfortable, with good quality linens and comfortable pillows. The duvets seemed quite lightweight, but were warm and cozy. Because we werenâ€™t in the middle of the city on a busy street, we were able to open our window a bit at night for fresh air, without any noise problems. The bathroom was a good size, with a great shower, and a speaker so you could listen to the television or radio from the room. The bathroomâ€™s frosted glass door seemed a little odd at first, but although it let some light through, it gave as much visual privacy as a regular, solid door. Both the room and the bathroom, in fact, all areas of the hotel that we saw, were very clean. The hotels wireless internet worked well - it had a good strong signal and a fast connection. It was raining on the day we checked out, so we took the shuttle to the train station instead of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DJWH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October and really loved this hotel. We were given an excellent room with a river view. Room was of a good standard, clean and modern and the free bottled water was a nice touch. We also had free wi-fi and an empty fridge in the room to use as you please. The room service was reasonably priced and there was no tray charge (other hotels take note!). The room was very quiet which made for great night's sleep. However my favourite feature of the room was the underfloor heating in the bathroom - very cosy! In terms of the overall hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful, there was a nice bar and restaurant and a nice reception area with seats and newspapers. The sauna facilities were also great. Finally, its worth noting that friends were staying in the hlton at the same time and our room was bigger, more modern and generally better value than theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: fiddlesky
Reviews.Content: As a tourist that comes to foreign country, we expected to get help from the concierge we arrived at the Hotel and we couldnt get a bellman to help us with our luggage,at the end we had to carry our own luggage, we stayed there for 3 nights and in the morning of our departure we explain to them that we were 3 people with 5 pieces of luggage and we needed a big taxi when we were ready to go a smal taxi was there and couldnt fit the luggage, we told the concierge that the taxi coudnt fit luggage then the concierge said take two taxis we asked them to that we needed a bigger vehicle and he refused telling us call your own taxi, we did take our own taxi, the didnt want to help their guests by the way we almost missed our flight. POOR SERVICE FOR A HOTEL THAT IS IN THE SERVICE BUSINESS. THE CLERK AND FRONT OFFICE WERE RUDE AND UNHELPULL.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yanick55
Reviews.Content: The reviews are accurate as far as it is not in the city center or close to the red light district but it is not far either. We walked to and from both days we were there without any issues and it took maybe 20 minutes, so don't let the distance scare you off this hotel is great. It looks quite new, the rooms are very clean, as was everything else about this hotel, from the lobby, to the restaurant, the elevators are quite big for European standards to the amazing views of the harbor. I thought staying in the red light district might be too loud and after reading other reviews on this hotel I was not disappointed with my decision. The central station is about a 10 minute walk, although you can take another train or as we did we simply took a cab it was easier with all our luggage and the cab was under 10 Euro. The staff was very friendly, they have a shuttle that can take you to Schipol if you need for 15 Euro which I thought to be a bargain considering a cab there would be about 45 to 55 Euro. This is where I will be staying next time I go to Europe's sin city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place wish we stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: paulio
Reviews.Content: Spent just the night here due to not being able to get into our preferred hotel in the centre (Swissotel) on a saturday night. The Hotel is 10 mins walk from Central Station, make sure you go out of the North exit (where the boats are) otherwise its a longer walk. The Tram - No25 passes by the hotel and stops at central station, then heads down to Dam Square, its about 2.60 Euro one way or get a 24/48/72 hr pass from the gift shop in the hotel for 7 Euros. we walked the first evening and its a good 30 mins till your in Dam Square, but if the weather is fine the walk is quite pleasant. We were escorted to our rooms by a member of staff, very courteous and helpfull, we had a room on the 17th floor overlooking the river and station, excellent views. We were given an amenity in the room of Chocolates & Jam, rooms very spacious and clean. We made use of the 2 sauna's that the hotel has, there is also a relaxation area and a shower room with different jets to stand under, including a bucket of cold water that you can pull a rope and it empties over you, also an ice machine, good after the hot Sauna, the areas were always kepts spotless, although was a bit shocked to see naked people in the Sauna's, but i guess in Europe its the thing to do! :-) If you've got flaunt it. Breakfast was included and there was an extensive selection on offer, you will not go hungry. The hotel is next the the cruise terminal so would be handy if you were joining a cruise the next day or fancied a few nights before or after. The only negative thing is that its not central to the bars and restaurant but you can't have everything. Def stay here again, if only to have a Sauna and eat the Breaksfast!

Reviews.Title: “So glamerous with spectacular high rise views, nice low prices + super shuttle makes it a superb choice!”
Reviews.Author: BonneVoyager
Reviews.Content: We had a really lovely romantic celebration stay at the Movenpick Amsterdam where we enjoyed great service, a breathtaking view over the water and the wonderful hotel shuttle that ferries guests to and from the central station. We booked this hotel with late rooms as a top secret hotel room only, 2 night 170 euros, otherwise I don't think I would have actually picked it to stay - but it actually was a fabulous choice. I always prefer to have breakfast included in the room rate, but as there are ample tea and coffee making facilities in the room - plus a large mini-fridge it too worked out perfectly! We were picked up at the central station by the very welcoming shuttle driver and then checked in with another warm welcome by Joyce who was so efficient and friendly and told us that we had been given a room with a fabulous view on the 15th floor. Joyce then rang us to check that we liked our room - such a nice and thoughtful touch, we felt very welcome! Our room was super romantic with amazing views, chic minamalist decor, lovely bathroom with shower/bath and good in-house movie selection. Most of all our room was nice and spacious which I know can be rare commodity in Amsterdam - so that was wonderful! The Movenpick was also spotlessly clean, neat, with everything looking brand spanking new, flawless and glossy. The thing that put me off before we visted were the reviews saying the hotel is too far out. Not true! It is a only 10 minute walk to the central station which is right in the thick of things. Plus with the 30 minutely shuttles you fly in to the centre in moments. Also the dockland area which is enjoying rejuvination is so very scenic and much quieter than most areas really is the best of both worlds. So ideal and scenic location, glamorous ultra modern hotel with fitness & sauna facilities, great staff , free broadband and super shuttle makes it the perfect choice! A big thank you to Joyce and Sylvia and the shuttle bus drivers who make our stay so memorable and thoroughly enjoyable! - Our only complaint was that we found the beds rather hard and the pillow rather unsubstantial and also there were two single duvets instead of one king sized one and the bathroom lighting was scarily bright and very unflattering!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located away from the hustle & bustle”
Reviews.Author: SunnyGlossop
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at The Moevenpick, (2 couples in there late 40s) Getting There Tip 1 - Get the train from the airport to Central Station it cost 4.20 Euros per person each way as opposed to 55/60 Euros in a taxi. The Hotel is only a 10 / 15 mins walk from Central Station or a couple of stops on the tram (No. 26) we decided to walk as it was such a nice day (leaving the station at the main entrance, turning left, following the road around a bend and then turning right, the hotel can then be seen dead ahead) Tip 1 - Watch out for bicycles! They are everywhere, and not to keen on slowing for pedestrians!! Keep out of the cycle lanes!! The hotel is large, modern, & comfortable, we found (in no particular order) - Free wi-fi in the rooms - 2 free Internet access points in the lobby - Excellent views of the Amstel River - Carpeted corridors (nice and quite) - Excellent breakfast choice - Shower over bath had good pressure - Iron & board - Hairdryer - Fridge (not stocked so ideal for filling with your own beers and choccies!!) - + all the usual complimentary toiletries - TV had BBC1, Sky News, CNN, Bloomberg + other foreign channels - Sauna & Gym (although not used by us) Tip 2 - A must for getting about is a Tram / Bus pass, get your ticket at the shop in the hotel, it cost 11.5 Euros for a 48 hr pass, the tram stop is over the road from the hotel. Pass becomes active from your 1st journey (note - every time you get on AND off the tram you must place you pass in front of the scanner located at exits on the trams) There is a free bus ran by the hotel into the centre but we used the trams as we often went further afield. Tip 3 - We found the 8 Euro canal boat tour (forgot the name but were brown Teak wooden boats) to be very good value for money, they are located close to the train station next to the Thomson Canal boat tours which were 2 and 3 times the price Staff - All very helpful throughout our stay, very attentive. If you want a hotel where you walk straight out onto the canals then this is not for you, if you are looking for a hotel that is away from the hustle & bustle, yet still within easy reach of all that Amsterdam offers then you wont go far wrong with The Moevenpick. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: ArtsnSciences
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located a little north of centre (I think I would have preferred something more in town to be closer to shops & restaurants), but has a free shuttle to/from the central train station. Concierge service is excellent, so be sure to ask about tours and such. Restaurant is expensive, but the bar serves food all day until midnight, with large portions so it's good value. I swear the martinis were doubles. Rooms are small but nice, with cool step-in showers that have no doors because a wall of glass shields the shower area from the rest of the bathroom. No tubs, though. Lots of shelf space in the bathrooms for toilettries, etc. Internet available in-room, with several options ranging from "free limited" to the works. We used the free limited, which was completely adequate for what we wanted to do (email, surf, online games). If you want to do a lot of downloading of things, though (such as lots of email attachments, online videos, or things involving a lot of graphics), you'll want to use a paid option ("limited" referred to bandwidth, 512kb/sec).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a treat”
Reviews.Author: paulamac
Reviews.Content: Not too bad of a walk from the train station, we did it a few times. There is a bit of a sketchy part where the construction is close to the train station, but the route is fairly well travelled so not really a problem. They do have a shuttle and you may be able to call the hotel and have them pick you up, they also drive to the station every 1/2 hour or so. Ask at the desk. Staff friendly, but the big hotels lack the friendly personal feeling that you get from the smaller ones. I got a good deal on the hotel by bidding the room through priceline at betterbidding.com. This is definitely an option when you are traveling and you can use it as a treat, which this hotel certainly was. Nice clean, large rooms with a great view. It seemed to be cheaper to just order room service for breakfast. I think it was 23 euro per person for the breakfast buffet, but you could get breakfast for 2 delivered to your room for 25 euro. The restaurant only offered buffet for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Swedish Style and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bourneuk09
Reviews.Content: Location: If you stick with Tram 25 you can get around Amsterdam and back to your hotel without any problem. Or its about a 10 min walk to Dam Street. Its location is great to explorte the many wonders of Amsterdam and then come back to the quiet relaxed area of the hotel. Service: Great service and consistant - Even when the hotel was full, we never founf the service compromised,. The breakfasts are great, plenty of food and the tables are set out like Wagamama's and exceptionally clean. If this is your first time to Amsterdam and like me you have now looked at hundreds of hotels and reviews, pick the Movenpick, it is perfect but you do have to hunt for a good price but if you get that too you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay away from city center”
Reviews.Author: gypsydog08
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was a 15 minute walk to central station, we could easily take the tram that was located close to the hotel. We enjoyed the accommodations which had a great view of the city and water way. The rooms were very clean, quiet and comfortable. Also enjoyed burger and beer night at the hotel bar. Staff was always helpful and gave good recommendations when requested.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing food, super clean, very modern and friendly; plus great location!”
Reviews.Author: Milzak
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our honeymoon, and felt luxurious with the heated floors in the bathroom! The room we had was small, but very clean and modern, so you really didn't mind - plus we had an amazing view of the harbor! Not a room you intend to spend a lot of time is as the tv was small and limited for English speakers. Perfect for sightseeing, the hotel is down the street from the Centraal Station and if you are flexible you can get a free shuttle to and from the station - not 24 hours of course. We walked it at night no problem. THE FOOD WAS AMAZING. The breakfasts that were included in our stay were delicious. The chef put out an amazing buffet with the freshest fruits, baked goods, these little pancakes and omelets to order. We ate like kings and queens at breakfast, so we really only ate vlaamse frites while exploring the city. Saved us a lot of money at the VERY high priced restaurants. Room service was dinner a few nights as well! I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but at the price it was definitely a splurge for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for starting river cruise”
Reviews.Author: gbpet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adjacent to the cruise line terminal AND the river cruises dock. Hotel may provide shuttle to nearby cruise dock. Room service pizza is very good. Tram stop is one block from the hotel. Hotel is near train station.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: caalie
Reviews.Content: Stylish and modern but not very comfortable. Strange narrow twin beds, tiny quilts and no top sheets. Warm but not hot water, maybe to prevent burns since taps are confusing. There are many other hotels with a better location so even with a very good price, would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Hooligan-59
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights here, and enjoyed the whole experience. I booked via the hotel website, and got a great deal - even better when we were upgraded to a junior suite - which included breakfast , free mini-bar, and use of the executive lounge with it's free evening 'nibbles' and alcohol, for abt Â£147 per night! Our room was clean and comfortable with great views. The beds were comfortable, and the room very well soundproofed. We found all the staff very friendly, and when we had a problem it was addressed very quickly. The food at breakfast was very good, and plenty of it. A previous reviewer complained the breakfast room was crowded - only a problem when we chose to have a late breakfast! All the staff were helpful, and happy to assist. The restaurant was quite pricey, and had limited choices, but was very good. The bar food was excellent, as was room service, which surprisingly only cost 50c more than the bar prices - quite unusual for a hotel of this quality. Our only issues were the pretty useless coffee machine, the reluctance of the housekeeping staff to replenish the tea and coffee items, their strange habit of leaving clean towels on the side, while the used ones were on the rail - rather defeating the 'Please leave your towels on the rail if you are happy to re-use them' message! There was also a reluctance to change bed-linen. we commented on this when we left, and the management took the time to e-mail us with their apologies. This hotel more than lived up to its 4 stars. Other reviewers have commented on the distance from the centre - I wonder if they do their research before booking a hotel? I usually find out exactly where the hotel is before I book! Being out of the centre was not a problem. The tram system in Amsterdam is very good , and we used it all the time. I think some people are afraid to use public transport. We loved this hotel, and would happily return. Thank you Moevenpick for making our holiday very relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, idea location and cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: voyager51
Reviews.Content: Went to Movenpick in September to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. Right on the quayside of the Rivery ij. Cruise ships dock outside, interesting to watch. Room on 18th floor with lovely panoramic views of amsterdam. Central station 10 minute walk away or 2 trams stop right outside every 5 minutes - 25 and 26. Standard room but could not fault a thing. Very clean and comfortable. Free Wi-Fi after entering room number for 4 hour time period. Enough for us for the whole 5 days. Breakfast mix of continental and a little 'hot' english bits and pieces, ample to start you off for a full day. Ate in the Silk bar 2 evenings and that was excellent, excellent, excellent. Never got time to try main restaurant - ate in Amsterdam instead. Modern high rise building near enought to center but far enough away to be peaceful. Any questions - Please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Krakdeschevalier
Reviews.Content: 7 minute walk from the rear of Central Station and with a tram stop beside the hotel it is easy to get to the rest of the town. And if you love your classical music, the new concert hall is next door. Like the concert hall, its a new building and the rooms are still fresh - no accumulation of scatches, dents and smudges to mar the decoration. Compared to the Radisson near the university, this hotel's room are much better with more spacious bathrooms. However, the immediate neighbourhood is sterile so you will be taking advantage of the tram to explore the city. But a good base for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Surprised - A real gem”
Reviews.Author: kjm31
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, absolutely gorgeous views. Location is a bit weird (it's sort of on its own mini-manmade-peninsula-thing?) but convenient to main train station. They run a shuttle bus every half hour or so to the rail station, so if you don't feel like the odd 500m walk along a construction-laden waterfront you do have that option. Rooms are big, lovely amenities, extremely friendly staff, very accommodating. Was extremely pleasantly surprised by this little gem given the price I paid (under $100) and the location right in the city center. Good for disabled access too. Easily up to the 4 star standard. Lacks any "charm" as is completely modern, but definitely a wonderful value. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - will come back!”
Reviews.Author: tplus
Reviews.Content: You know already that this hotel is not exactly in the city center of Amsterdam which is a good thing unless you are out for a stag/hen party. Town center is still in walking distance (30 min. to the DAM square) but the tram stop (7 Euro for 24 hours) is just a few steps from the hotel and takes you anywhere. P+R Zeeburg is also just 2 tram-stops away and much cheaper (â‚¬ 6/24 hours) than the overpriced parking in the rest of the city. The hotel is modern and clean, the room was quiet and the bath was spacious and well equipped. Everything worked fine. The spectacular view over river and city is worth a special mention. The service was fast and friendly. Small drawbacks: The mini bar was empty (but at least you have a fridge to fill up yourself) and the free internet connection is throttled to 512 kbit/s. More bandwith can be ordered against a charge. I cannot comment on meals and breakfast as I prefer to dine out. I can highly recommend this hotel for business and leisure in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good location but Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: StuartMorley
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good view. We could see the water and city from our room (1515). Very well decorated with lovely bathroom. Internet access was free although you could pay for faster service if you wanted. Breakfast was quoted at 32 euros each! - Now I have had some nice breakfasts but 32 euros each! - as a result we had breakfast out each day and didn't eat in the hotel. We were not on a budget but I am not paying 64 euros for some cereal and a bit of toast! The location is not right in the city centre but only a 10 minute walk or 2 minute tram ride. The tram stops 100m from the hotel and runs every 15 mins, every 20-30 mins on sundays! - 7 euros for an all day pass but much cheaper if you buy a 2 or 3 day pass. The location wouldn't put me off staying there again and actually it is a benefit! If you can't get up early for the day trips then there is one that leaves at about noon which visits a clog maker, cheese factory, fishing village, windmills and a boat ride which is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel - not in the city centre (as their name suggests), but location is definitely not a hindrance!”
Reviews.Author: Surjo1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moevenpick Amsterdam City Center Hotel in August 2010 for 3 nights, after a holiday in Switzerland. First things first, the name is misleading - this hotel is definitely not located at the city center, in fact quite the contrary. However, this is actually not a problem at all - in fact, quite the reverse. Read on to find out why I am saying so.... Location: The hotel is located about ten minutes walk from Amsterdam's Central Station (which is where you will be arriving if you take the train into town from Schiphol airport). It's located just on the canal's edge, and large cruise-ships dock right in front of the hotel! The location is by no means central - however, in a city like Amsterdam with its boisterous nightlife, this can actually be a blessing in disguise. After a long day of walking around and seeing the sights, being kept awake by rowdy partying till the wee hours of the morning, is not my idea of a great location :) - which is why we chose not to stay at the Swissotel Amsterdam (located at Dam Square, right in the heart of the nightlife area). Transportation: The hotel runs a complimentary shuttle service to and from the Central Station every half-hour. Upon arriving at Central station, we called the reception and were given precise instructions on where to exit and wait for the van to pick us up, and right on the dot at 5 minutes past the hour, there it was to take us to the hotel! Very efficient. I think it runs right till 10pm. We used the shuttle service a few times to get to the Central Station. It is always better to call the reception in advance and let them know that you intend to use the shuttle, though, as they will not run in case there aren't any people wanting to go to-and-fro. There is also a tram-stop right next to the hotel, and the number 26 (?) takes you conveniently into town. From Central Station - Dam Rak, the Olde Kerk, Madame Tussauds, and the famed red-light district is a short walk away. While coming back to the hotel on the tram, do remember to alight at the Piet Heinkade stop, rather than at the one-stop-earlier MusikGebouw stop - while the latter stop looks (deceptively so) like right in front of the hotel, because of the layout of the overbridge you actually end up walking more, to get to the entrance. I spent quite a bit of time and text on transportation. This is because we had read the reviews here on Tripadvisor while planning our trip, and were a bit concerned with the frequent mentions about location and the fact that it was away from the city centre. But after staying there, I can safely opine that location will not be a hindrance to any of our touring plans. The hotel even helped book us an airport-transfer at an unearthly 430am at a very nominal price. Check-in: we were greeted at the reception with a warm smile and the check-in process was very efficient. We had booked a package directly with the hotel wherein if you stayed over a weekend, you get to stay for 3nights while paying for only 2. It also included an option of either a free breakfast or an upgrade to the executive room - we chose the latter and were given one of their executive rooms on the 20th floor. Throughout our stay, we found all the members of the staff to be not only efficient, but friendly - which is not something you would always find in similarly large hotels (the Moevenpick has 400+ rooms.) Room: the room was very spacious - not only could we lay out both our large suitcases, there was enough room to walk around them! The bed was huge. And so was the bathroom. After the rather-cramped room in Lucerne (our previous stop), the generous proportions of the Moevenpick room was very welcome! But I have saved the best for last :) - and that is, the view! Our room gave us an expansive view of the Amsterdam skyline and the main canal. See one of the pictures and judge for yourself. My wife and I loved to come back to the room and sit by the window admiring the view. Other amenities: the rooms come with free wi-fi access. We used this a couple of times and found the access speed to be decent enough. We ordered from their room-service menu a few times, and the quality of most of the items was definitely above average. Service was prompt and efficient. Their prices are not too high - which is good, because I must caution you that there are no other eateries nearby other than a Subway sandwich outlet, so if you choose not to dine at the hotel you will need to find your way back to town. We did not use any of the other amenities, as we were out much of the time. Overall, we had a most enjoyable and comfortable stay at the Moevenpick Amsterdam. Try and book directly with the hotel website, as they often have value-for-money deals/packages advertised on their site. I would most definitely recommend this hotel without the slightest hesitation to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Dan1113
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year. The location is quite good, only a short walk from the city centre and the train station. The room was spacious and the view was quite nice, too! Given that it was the New Year, the prices were quite reasonable, as well. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “More like MoevenPUKE rather than Moevenpick”
Reviews.Author: saramissa
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the "apparanet" cleanliness of the hotel. Unless you are older or a business traveler, you will be treated like a second class citizen at this hotel. Before I get into the details of how horrible this hotel was, I must warn you, if you are in Amsterdam to have fun and perhaps enjoy the freedoms not likely enjoyed in other cities, then don't bother staying at this hotel because IT IS WAY TOO FAR from the city centre!! You will end up having to pay a ridiculous amount for a taxi or walking home and wishing you picked a placer closer to the city. First, there was no trash can in our bathroom, then we had to call down for the robes. But I could forgive that if it wasn't for the fact that we had a tv in our room from the 80's and even worse the picture was scrambled on the tv. The first night we asked the concierge to fix it and we were promised that it would be done by the next day. Unfortunately, the next day the tv was the same. Despite 2 more requests, the tv from the 80's was still not fixed. Everytime we complained about the tv, the staff seemed so concerned but each time we went back to tell them the tv was not fixed, they looked at us llike there was something wrong with us. Moving onto to other far worse details about this hotel, there was HAIR IN OUR BEDS!! Our coffee mugs were not replaced (i.e. old coffee mugs left in the room) and our coffee maker broke spilling coffee all over the counter. I will never return and will not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless of course you are a business traveler and don't care about enjoying Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skydiver1921
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was included and ample, and the staff were very kind and courteous. Great views from the room, not far from central at all or the city center, and definitely a notch above all the other old and small hotels. No problems whatsoever, very glad I stayed here for a 3 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good variant of the average level”
Reviews.Author: chuprasov
Reviews.Content: In Amsterdam nobody accommodates in the historical center â€“ because of the noise, the prostitutes, the teenagers under hashish. All good hotels are outside of the center. Movenpick is not an exception. Big, modern, non-smoking hotel, with spacious rooms and good bar. View from windows is industrial, however it is possible to see Nemo - the huge ship growing from the earth. The thing I want to share staying in many Movenpicks worldwide is about club floor. It simply does not worth it to pay extra money. Poor wine selection, only house wines, white and red without variants, tea or coffee and some snacks. It is better to save 50-70 euros and to drink in a bar. The stuff is also not so friendly. Woman from housekeeping asked us to leave the room for cleaning. When I tried to exchange 500 euros to pay for a taxi I was sent to the bank that was in 15 minutes of driving from hotel. And I got no apology at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: justagirl12345
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite for 2 nights in this hotel because of Sail 2010. We had a wonderful suite on the 6th floor with side view to "het IJ" where all the tall ships were. Comfortable beds, drinks in fridge inclusive, free wireless internet. Large batheroom with separate shower cubicle. Coffe and tea making facilities. Safe in the room, but not suitable for laptop. If you book the junior suite you can go to the executive lounge all day (for a drink, coffee, tea). Between 5 and 7 pm they serve food and drinks (beer and wine). Nice roof terrace on the 2nd floor. Breakfast was great; everything you could wish for was there. Only 10 minutes walk from the station. Also a tram in front of the hotel (line 25 and 26). We only used the spa on the last day to freshen up before we had to leave, but fitness and spa looked good. Staff very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Sail Festival”
Reviews.Author: paulfair
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Movenpick during the recent Sail Festival. Hotel was the ideal location for this event. Hotel is only about a 15 min walk from Centraal Station. Alternatively, there is a tram stop just across the road from the hotel and the hotel also offers a free shuttle bus service to Centraal Station every half an hour. Was upgraded on arrival to a junior suite, which was a nice surprise. Room was good and staff were both friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Charming modern hotel - great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on the 16th floor. Pros: Gorgeous rooms are congruent with the elegant lobby. Met with welcoming letter from hotel GM, a very nice touch. Comfortable beds, modern furniture, stylish artwork and a (small) plasma TV highlight the room, which is also a good size for Amsterdam. Great views of the harbor from almost any floor. Breakfast buffet was superb, with an impressive variety of hot and cold items. Away from the main road, there is no exterior noise to contend with. Oversized, well-lit bathroom with a large mirror, good shower pressure with immediate hot water. Top-quality toiletries, as one would expect here. Two fast internet PCs in the lobby with free internet and printing services was definitely appreciated. Nice card insert concept upon room room entry to activate lights; this energy preservation initiative should be adopted in North America. For a fast meal, there's a Subway restaurant about 200m east of the hotel. Cons: Key card given upon arrival to room did not work. After 36 hours up and a long flight, this was annoying. Office chair and sinking sofa in the room were not terribly comfortable. Quality of staff is hit and miss, though the front line staff are evidently well-trained. Most working the breakfast were cold and indifferent. Upon check-in, they will try to sell you upgraded rooms; I felt the Glengarry Glen Ross 'ABC' mentality was pervasive here, and somewhat deceptive. For example, rooms with a "fully stocked bar" actually receive two cans of coke and two Heinekens for the entire duration of your stay, which is worth about $5 U.S., so be warned. For non-Europeans, you will find stepping in/out of the elevated shower rather awkward, but get used to it in Europe. Unsure: Hard to assess the effectiveness of the soundproofing as I never saw anyone on my floor. Overall, a pleasant experience with a couple areas for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “high level services , unfriendly hotel policy”
Reviews.Author: Kyriaki
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and three adult children) and my friends family ( 9 people in total )stayed in this certainly 4 stars hotel.. Most of the tripadvisor members have pointed out the spacious rooms , breathtaking view , sumptuous breakfast and of all them are right !!We enjoyed all these services in a bargain price , since we have made our four rooms resrvation two months in advance and we had a '' stay 3 nights and pay 2 '' breakfast included!! The problem is the hotel policy related to staff unfriendly attitude !! Every member of the staff was in her / his position to help you , but the majority of them were so stiff and cold !! Another problem was the issue with the card : they blocked in our Mastercard an amount 50% higher than the payment , in advance , for security reasons !!! That means , in our case , two thousand euros !! this was outrageous!! As far as parking , I appreciate info in Movenpick site about the parking area close to the hotel , beacause the hotel parking is very expensive. The breakfast area is too small for such a big hotel , always crowded .The staff were trying their best to keep it clean and fill empty plates . The distance from Central station is 10 minutes walng and Dam square 20 minutes walking .

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DDMMM
Reviews.Content: We chose the Movenpick after looking through dozens of hotel and vacation rental choices. Don't know how some of the others would have turned out, but we were very happy with this choice. This was somewhat of a compromise in that we were thinking about staying in one of the canal front hotels in the center of town, but decided ultimately to go for a more modern room with the accompanying amenities. It's only one tram stop away from the Central Station, and the trams run quite frequently. We never waited more than a few minutes. While you can't just walk out of the hotel and be on a busy pedestrian street, you also don't have to put up with the accompanying noise and congestion. We paid about $150 per night for a pretty good sized room, one king and one sleeper sofa. Free wifi was a plus, but our deal didn't come with breakfast, which would have been nice. There's a hotel shuttle service to the train station, which we took advantage of when we left, as we had some bulky luggage. Room was nicely furnished with modern touches throughout. A pleasant place to rest your head after a long day out in the city.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: oovavoo
Reviews.Content: great hotel by the port terminal15min walk from central station. they offer mini bus pick up and drop off to and from central station..geat breakfasts.good bar. located in a quiet area. rooms are good, clean and comfy. staff are very friendly. amsterdam is amazing. would visit again and stay here amsterbikes are located below the hotel and are great for guided bike tours and hiring

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: daphnebath
Reviews.Content: Very modern .. good bathroom, spacious, .The best thing about this Hotel are the views. We stayed on the 16th floor and had fantastic views of the Port, cruise ships sailed past the window and one docked below us. At first you think the hotel is too far out but it is only 1 stop on the tram takeNo 26 just outside central station direction UBORG. Trams run late... Staff polite. free internet in the reception. It was nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of the City and enjoy this hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend break”
Reviews.Author: milesandme
Reviews.Content: stayed for a weekend at this modern and stylish four star hotel with an almost perfect location (not in old town and a little bit away from the main sights) - only one tram stop away from the Amsrerdam Centraal train station (or 10 mins walk). The hotel is located right at the ferry terminal for cruise ships and from high floors offers a panoramic view of the city and at the docking cruise ships. The modern medium sized room had a king sized bed and a sofa was elegantly decorated and contained coffee making facilities. Immaculately clean, high quality toiletries inlcuded two good sized packs of bath salt. Nothing to complain about, attentive service ate the reception, you also receive LH miles for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location and a nice room with excellent views!”
Reviews.Author: PandaJess
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to venture to Amsterdam for a long weekend break. We chose to stay in the Movenpick not really as a choice, but it was selected as a top secret hotel on Lastminute.com. After checking reviews on the hotel I was happy that it was going to be nice and we got a good deal. When we arrived in Amterdam we had to wait around the town with our bags as the check-in isn't until 3pm and we arrived at 7:30am. Although we soon realised that there was a left luggage in Central Station which is only one tram stop(25/26 1st stop) away from the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel the staff were friendly and ready to help. They did however ask for a credit card to charge the 'city tax' on to, which isn't included in the price. (this is something we wern't aware of) but was told it was only about 5% of the price. So it wasn't a major issue. The room was very nice and spacious. With a large comfy bed, sofa and desk and a very nice shower. The views were beautiful out of the large windows. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as it was a bit too pricey and we just waited until we got in to the centre. (There is a Subway a couple of doors away though, if you want something quick and cheap). We did treat ourselves and order pizza one night, it was brought up to our room in 30mins and it was16euros but very tasty and worth it. There is a lovely terrace on the restaurant level where you can smoke. We didn't use the relaxation area but I beleive they have free excercise equiptment you can use. Coming back to the hotel late at night isn't a problem you just need to use your key to get in. I would highly recommend this hotel. Although it is about 10-15min walk out of the centre, it is only one tram stop away from the Central Station and is located with lovely views all around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, made our holiday”
Reviews.Author: eek53
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything for a relaxing and trouble free stay in Amsterdam. The staff are very helpful and rooms are excellent with everything you would expect from a prestigous hotel chain like Moevenpick. The breakfast certainly sets you up for the day with every type of taste catered for. We had two rooms both of which overlooked the river and it was most entertaining watching the different types of water transport. Transport is easy with tram stop opposite the Hotel and only one stop into Central Station area where you can catch a bus or tram to anywhere in the city, or train if feeling more adventurous. The canal boats stop nearby too, although it is only a 10 min walk to the station anyway. Haarlem is well worth a visit and only costs 7 euros return, we went on a Saturday when there was an excellent street market. Both bikes and Segways can be hired from closeby the hotel, although the latter is quite expensive and we did not see anyone on them in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “15 mins walk from Amsterdam Station, but a smart, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Badgeman
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, it is modern, very well decorated and all the staff were very well mannered. I would recommend anyone to stay here, however it is a little bit of a walk into Amsterdam itself, about 15 mins walk to the main Amsterdam station and tram stops. However this is maybe a plus point if you want to be away from all the bars and coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite in the city's center...”
Reviews.Author: yobethany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, modern, clean, etc... We got it through bidding for a hotel in Amsterdam's city center on Priceline. It is actually about a 15 minute walk from the city center, which wouldn't be a big deal but it gets old if you are staying there for an extended period and want to go back and forth. Overall, I loved it but would recommend for someone staying only one night in Amsterdam. If you are spending a few days, get a fun canal house or a hotel that is in the middle of everything -- it is worth a little bit of extra money. But we loved the room, and found it very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: karenlesley
Reviews.Content: a lovely spacious hotel. we were asked if we would like an upgrade to a superior room or breakfast. we chose breakfast but on day two of our three day stay we were told that we were excluded from breakfast. the restaurant staff were very reluctant to sort out the problem for us..after two phonecalls and much embarrassment to us it was finally sorted. we were 3 females sharing a room but on arrival the room was only set up for two..we rung reception straight away and it it took 2 hours for the towels,cups, glasses etc to arrive and 6 hours for a kettle. the room was spotless..buffet very nice...but best get your own coffee!...a great stay..just a shame about the hiccup

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukuva
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend away with the wife through Last Minute and got a great deal as one of their "secret deals" which doesn't usually tell you which hotel you're staying at until you've paid, however this did. I know the Movenpick from previous visits to Amsterdam so knew it would be a good choice. I wasn't disappointed. We walked to the hotel from the train station, go out of the bottom exit towards the river, not the top entrance towards the Damrak. If you go out of the bottom entrance it's about a ten minute walk, go out of the top exit and its about a 25 minute walk. Once you get there it's obvious this is not your typical Amsterdam hotel, it's more American. Excellent staff at check in and throughout the stay. Rooms are excellent, large, with air con , iron and board, hair-dryer, toiletries etc etc all the things you would expect. It's also very quiet. Didn't try the leisure activities, it was world cup weekend!!! so can't comment what they are like. Didn't eat in the place so can't comment on the quality price etc. Did have a drink in the bar which was reasonably priced (for Amsterdam!!!). There is a tram stop opposite the hotel, one every few minutes to the station, the hotel also do a minibus run to the station every 30 minutes free of charge. It goes on the hour and half past. Best to book it with the concierge if the hotel is busy. They also offer a taxi service to the airport at a cost of e9.50 per person which has to be booked at least 2 hours before, I missed this as I didn't see the sign but it's a bargain at that price. If you want to ask any questions about this hotel please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Streamline- LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: lafamilleaventureuse
Reviews.Content: Although it's a bit far from the bustling center of Amsterdam, the location is nice. Within walking distance from the train station and you can take the tram into town. Would definitely stay here again! Rooms are clean-lined, new and well kept. Stayed on one of the higher floors and had a great view of the water. The walk to the tram or into town provided good exercise.

Reviews.Title: “sleep tight!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_Bergen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, comfortable and super clean. Not the most beautiful, but is a great stay. The service is friendly, and very helpful. The room is spacious, we were in the 20th floor and the view was amazing from the huge window. The bed is big and comfortable, good pillows, soft new bed sheets. The bathroom spick and span, with thick nice towels and good toileteries. Breakfast was the best I had in a long time. Great variety and products. Chefs actually cooking on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the center but perfect in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Pete04129
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in the Moevenpick Hotel and truly enjoyed our stay. The rooms have a decent size, are very clan and from the upper floors provide a very nice view over the city and canals. Something to complain about is the breakfast buffet, for 23 Europe, per person, one would expect to have a nice selection of cheese and cold cuts. The very basic selection of two different cheeses tasted like plastic and the cold cuts, particularly the salami, was unacceptable. So we went into the city to have breakfast, cheaper and much better! Even though the hotel is not in the center of Amsterdam it is quite easy to get there by tram (line 25 or 26) which only takes a few minutes. Alternatively, rent a bicycle, the best way to get around in the city! There is an independent bicycle rental firm located in the basement of the Moevenpick, which we can highly recommend. We would go back to the Moevenpick next time we visit Amsterdam, for its location and price value relation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adelivanis
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have been traveling around Europe for a couple months, and this was one of the best stays we had. The rooms were extremely comfortable and because the hotel is on the water the view from our room was stunning! The free breakfast was probably the best part of the hotel. There were hot and cold items, fruit, a whole bread bar, and an omlette station. The only downside of this hotel is it is a little bit of a walk from the city center (about 15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Moevenpick after a trip to Prague. As previosuly mentioned, the Moevenpick is sitiated about 10 mins walk from Centraal Station. However, the hotel has a half hourly shuttle bus which takes just a few minutes to bring you back to the hotel or drop you off at the station. There is also a tram stop opposite the hotel which is also very quick. The tram will cost you around Euro 2.60 for a one way trip. Checking in was very straightforward and teh receptionist was very pleasant indeed. He listened to my preferences and booked me into a room on the 19th floor with a fantastic view. I was very happy indeed. The room itself was modern in style and spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom/shower. I heard no noise whasoever from outside or through the wall/corridor etc. I was very happy! The hotel has a restaurant and room service, but i did not take advantage of either. In the immediate vincinity, there are not many shops, but i did see a gift shop and a subway sandwich place just next door. I got a great deal through Priceline so i was very happy indeed with my stay. Although in a different location to what i am used to for Amsterdam, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best european hotel experience i've had”
Reviews.Author: Entrecote99
Reviews.Content: absolutely great. ended up here because my original hotel mistakenly overbooked, so they put me up in Movenpick for my first night in Amsterdam. i liked it so much i opted to keep my spot in Movenpick for the rest of the trip. location - stunning view of the harbor, you get the peace and trendiness of the waterfront and you are one tram stop from centraal station - i think the location is actually preferable to the unpleasantness of the touristy areas in city center hence the 5 stars in that category - by the way the trams are convenient and fun! Movenpick staff was helpful at every turn, phenomenal room service quality/pricing, room was HUGE and great value, building is brand new so none of the minor nightmares that can often come with european hotels. what can i say - i loved it. next time i'm in amsterdam i'll be looking forward to going back to this hotel. for background, i was traveling solo to do some long anticipated sight seeing and stayed for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jazykoved2
Reviews.Content: This is a high-rise hotel in a business development by the harbor, on the "wrong side" of Central Station. But it is clean, elegant, well-run and offers an excellent night's sleep. Transportation to the heart of Amsterdam is straightforward: a tram a few steps from the hotel door that runs every 5-10 minutes during the day. Excellent, lavish breakfast is available, though it is not cheap. I get the feeling that this hotel overbuilt, and that it is a bit desperate for clients. Consequently, it is a perennial offering on Priceline (where I made my reservation) for those bidding around the $100 mark. I certainly wasn't the only one at breakfast, but still I don't think the hotel was anywhere near full. So here is an opportunity to have a nice room with all the amenities, near (if not in) the heart of Amsterdam, for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: RascalKing
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, has all the amenities. Clean crisp style. Bar area was decent enough, good food but pricey. Location is right on the water, so good views of the port from the room. 15 minute wall to center of town (ie Centraal station), but you can catch a tram for 2.5 EUR thats takes you two stops in or catch a taxi for no more than 10 EUR. Rooms were nice, up to date with a safe and fridge. I recomend it. Overall cost for two weekend nights in June 2010 was 337 EUR including taxes - booked via hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! so... pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: birtual
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights with my husband. The hotel is absolutely perfect. Good service, friendly and atentive staff, INCREDIBLE breakfast, comfortable bed, good drapes that keep out the daylight, spacious bathroom, spick and span clean... what else can I say? everything was excellent! I have to say, that is what I expected... since it is expensive. It is not the most beautiful hotel, but it is probably the best in terms of cleaniless, attention, comfort, etc... Very close to the station and downtown... in a not so fun neighbourhood. For us location was the best, since we went there to attend some concerts next door (Bimhuis - by the way, best venue I have ever been to!) [---]

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: blulightning747
Reviews.Content: First off, the reviews stating that the hotel is not "centrally located" are correct. If they are basing central Amsterdam to be Dam Sq. However, the trams are frequent and always on time. One stop gets you to Centraal Station and the second gets you to Dam Sq. If you have any worries about being in the sticks then fear not. We stayed for 5 days and got an unlimited tram/bus/metro pass for â‚¬23. Unless you are too cheap to pay for a pass then location isn't a problem. The trams that stop outside the hotel are 25/26. 25 goes as far as the Rijksmuseum so you can do most things without changing at Centraal. The hotel itself is outstanding. Free WiFi (albeit on a limited connection but you likely won't need to download 1GB of data), extremely modern and most importantly it's spotless. I can't comment on the restaurant as we didn't eat there. As usual for hotels it's overpriced. Go outside and enjoy a local restaurant. We had room 1402 which was 2 single beds with an absolutely stunning view overlooking the water and Centraal Station. The hotel is quite near the train tracks but we did not hear a thing - the windows are fabulous. The only slight criticism I have was that the beds were a little firm for my taste. This is minor of course and the king beds may be different. The staff were very helpful and always pleased to help. 5/5 easy.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: kingfarm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only one tram stop from the train station but it is in an isolated area outside the central city. The room was really nice, funky design and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was great. two computers available for free in the lobby. Odd that they had such funky design and old-style cathode ray television that was small in the room. Overall, if you can get a good rate here, I would recommend it as long as you don't mind having to ride the tram (the stop is right in front of the hotel) to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Especially for Pre/Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Tennis60
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its location adjacent to the cruise ship terminal. They had a special pay for 2 nights and get the 3 nite free and choice of room upgrade or breakfast. Chose breakfast which is a very nice buffet. I couldnt have been more pleased with the hotel. While it is not located in the center of the city ( 10 minute walk to central station) you can use their shuttle for free on the 1/2 hour to the central train station. From there you can reach anywhere in the city easily either by walking or taking the trams. We purchased the I am Amsterdam card for two days and it paid off as we visited 4 museums and two days of the tram travel plus a canal ride. It is a modern hotel with great service. Free wifi in the room. For large downloads you have the choice to pay for an upgrade. Recommend it for before the cruise or after. They let us check in at noon. Also you can leave your luggage in their baggage check before check in which is great for after the cruise, as you can leave the ship in no hurry, go next door, do a baggage check, take their shuttle for free and visit the city avoiding taxi ques and fares or take a 15 minute ride on the train plus 10-15 minute walk to visit the windmills at Zaanse Schans, a good side trip and come back later to check in. Or reverse, check out take, do a baggage check, go to Zaanse Schans for a visit which you can do in 3-4 hours depending on how long you want to stay and then go back and check in for the cruise. I cannot recommend it enough for cruise people. However if you are into bed and breakfast, older hotels, or if you want to walk out your door an be in the center of the city itis not for you. Make sure you ask for a room with tub some only have showers. Lastly you can take the train from the airport to Central Station for 5--$6 per person 15-20 minutes. You do have to lug your luggage, hopefully yours is on wheels, then go to the water side of the terminal and wait for their shuttle or call them (take their number with you, although I could not find a pay phone) and they will pick you up for free. I was told the taxi from the airport was 80-$100 US.

Reviews.Title: “impossible to fault. Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: yoooreds
Reviews.Content: We are just coming to the end of our three night stay at the Movenpick Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is located just down the road from Grand Central station which is truly the centre of old town Amsterdam. The hotel is very modern and is built by the main river/canal with excellent views from the higher floors. There is a tram stop about 100m away which, catching the 25 or 26 tram takes you to the central station and on to Dam Square. The rooms are very clean and modern and the hotel food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL SECOND TO NONE, NOTHING WAS TO MUCH TROUBLE.”
Reviews.Author: casperWigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money. We managed to book this city break through, last minute .com. You picked which city break, you didnt know what hotel untill you had completed your booking. Nothing was every to much trouble for the staff. They really go that extra little bit. Rooms very roomy, bathroom very well fitted out, best double shower. The hotel run a shuttle service always at half past the hour, it seems as though not everybody knew about this service. This saves you 8.50euros every time you want to go into the city. Last mini bus back 10.30. Buses from city No 26, this stopped nearly right outside the hotel. Canal boats stop right outside hotel, couldnt have wished for any better. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Specially if you are going out on a cruise from Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: 2006ricky
