Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed there and after surfing the web looking to avoid any Old, small, smelling european like rooms. We found this hotel. First location although is not the best (is not bad either, just 10 minute walk to Centraal Station and Bus and Tram lines just outside the hotel) it came very handy as it is next door to the Passenger terminal for cruise ships of the major lines. Yes just a 50yds walk and you are on the ship. The Room was large enough almost US standars and we had with us two large suitcases and had all the space we needed for hanging those gala outfits for the cruise. Flat sceen tv, modern decor and a good size like new bathroom as well as new bedding and towels make us feel great as it was our major fear in europe. The views were great, from the room you could almost see the whole city. Price wise we were charged around 200 usd per nigth so it was not a bargain but we were ok with what we got for, Free Wifi in the room is a nice amenity and you can print what you need in the lobby free of charge. All those friends recommendations. Food and drink service might feel a little expensive but the standars of service and quality you get is worth the price. The staff was great and friendly fluent in english and spanish gave us tips and maps for our visit. City tips, tram or bus is the best way to move around buy day tickets according to your stay, is cheaper this way if you have doubts do no worry the Tram drivers sell tickets directly and they may be the friendliest people in amsterdam. My wife and I got the first trip for free as they realized we just arrived and were clueless. Don't miss anything everything is worth trying.. From museums, public parks, boat ride, local food-beers, there are so many thing to see and enjoy in amsterdam you can even avoid going into the red zone if you are in a family trip... We didn't jajaj...but just saying you could!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jerusalemtravel
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, free wifi, great health club, convenient shuttle to central train station, rooms spacious

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: erica12
Reviews.Content: Webooked 2 rooms on a bed only basis for three nights. There was an offer that gave us the third night free. When we booked in we were asked if we would like a free upgrade or free breakfasts.We opted for the breakfasts which saved us nearly 10 euros each a day.The accommodation cost Â£50 per night with bed and breakfast.An extremely good deal for Amsterdam. The Hotel is almost astride the river and the rooms had a fantastic view up the river. The Staff were kind and helpful and looked after our suitcases on the last day without charge and I cannot find anything more that this hotel could have done for us.I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will seek out others in this chain for our next city break

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great views, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: babadi
Reviews.Content: Our stay was terrific except we could not get cold air out of the air conditioner. Maintenance came in the first day and said that was as cold as it could get - also he turned off the bathroom floor heater, so I would not advise going in the summer. The room was stifling. Otherwise a great hotel with spectacular views. Helpful staff. Quiet location. Stop N Go Bus just outside took us everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: hurtzu32
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Movempick. After a late arrival into Amsterdam, the staff was efficient and check-in was smooth. Room service was excellent, fast and delicious. Hotel was exceptionally clean and modern, with very large and contemporary rooms. Views of the harbour are lovely. Tram stops right outside which makes for very efficient transportation. Only a 10 minute walk from Centraal station. Great hotel, would highly recommend. Free in-room wifi, a very nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Lolpoppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March with two of my girl friends. The hotel was lovely and very well maintained! The staff were very helpful informing you of places to go and restaurants to visit etc. It was about about a ten minute walk into town but there is the free shuttle bus, which needs to be booked in advance. I didnt mind the walk into town but it might not be suitable for all. The views from hotel were also great and the breakfast was delicious! They even let you take it back to your bedroom (great for when your hungover and want to take your time eating!).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel outside UK and US”
Reviews.Author: DavidJonsson
Reviews.Content: Great High Top Hotel from every aspect. Great staff and help from Peter the Supervisor of the hotel, all the time with good help and assistance. The Top level Service in Business Lounge both Breakfast and Afternoon, this is a top 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Away from City Center”
Reviews.Author: zoe17
Reviews.Content: The hotel room, breakfast and free internet were very nice, though the room was small by US standards. The main drawback was that it was at least 6 blocks to the center of town. Trams did stop close to the hotel. The other drawback is that neither the maintenance man nor I could get the HVAC to maintain a cool temperature. I finally clipped the drapes together so the maid wouldn't open them and let the hot sun beat in all day. I also learned how to turn off the heat from the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ry0_Saeba
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect in this hotel. Maybe the location is the only weak point, because it is a little bit outside from the main centre of amsterdam (15mn by walk)

Reviews.Title: “Excelent option”
Reviews.Author: susana1602
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really amazing: excelent service, free sauna and relax area, excelent food (the breakfast is outstanding) and the restaurant offers a great menu, excelent service and the cost is very good considering the quality. The hotel is modern, the rooms have a lot of space. The staff is friendly and very helpfull in any thing you need. This is not a hotel for people who want to be in the middle of the city center. But is really two stations of train tho the central station. The concierge has a lot of information an options to help you to have the most pleasent visit to Amsterdam. There is free internet connection in the rooms and a couple of computers in the lobby. Amsterdam is amazing and the Movenpick is whithout doubt a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with uninterrupted views of the city”
Reviews.Author: dpfee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a five minute walk from centraal station and is a tram stop. What can i say other then you wont get a better view of the city then the one you get from the higher floors of the hotel we were on the 14th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business type hotel but not exactly in city center”
Reviews.Author: sbbeachbunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Moevenpick when we visited for 5 days. We booked on priceline and got a good price. The hotel itself was really nice with beautiful views. Our room was nice and spacious. It had heated floors in the bathroom, free wifi, free water bottles. The downside to the room was that our king size bed was really two separate twin beds with separate bedding pushed together so my husband and I weren't really sleeping together :( Also, they don't have a top sheet in the beds just a comforter which was unusual for us. The hotel was a little outside the city center, more so than other hotels, but was easily bikeable. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel was comfortable and quiet and was a respite from the busy city centre. Would recommend unless you like to be in the center of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with complimentary Shuttle Bus to the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: First: write down the phonenumber of the hotel. You need it to call to make sure the shuttle bus comes. If there is nobody wanting to leave in the hotel for it and nobody called... it will stay at the hotel. So reserve it! The shuttle bus arrives at the back of the train station and it turned out to be very handy for us. We stayed with a 8 month old baby. They have free babybeds. The room is of a good size, it's new and looks good. The bathroom (no bath, but a shower) is of a good size and clean and modern. It is not a very charming or personal hotel. But it is a clean and good 4 star hotel. You can do much worse in an old hotel in Amsterdam that has no care. The breakfast was okay. Nothing great though. Our weekend getaway turned out to be a popular weekend: the hotel seemed full. The hotel had a big challenge at breakfast. It was just a bit too buzy. The breakfast area had several baby seats (from Stokke), which was a big plus for us. (Not all hotels have them, this was a nice touch!) The service is rather anonymous and I can not comment too much about it. All in all. A good modern hotel next to the Cruise Terminal. Very expensive parking (we came with the train, a much better option with the good shuttle bus). I would consider going again when I had to sleep in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & flawless”
Reviews.Author: mocha88
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel & great management. I stayed here for four nights and was delighted with the service we received & room quality. Movenpick is located roughly 5-10 minute walk from Central Amsterdam station/City Centre and the hotel offers a shuttle every half an hour until 10:30pm from the hotel to the station/station to the hotel. Our room was large compared to other hotels we have stayed in EU and we had spectacular views overlooking the river. Super fast speed internet access and excellent buffet breakfast is also on offer at this hotel. Only flaw was our tv remote had no batteries and we had to wait for over a day for someone to fix this. Other than that a great hotel and one i would highly recommend to all who wants to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service From MovenPick Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ozab0ut
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam by train and phoned the hotel asking how we get from the station to the hotel - without hesitation they said that they would be there in 5 minutes to pick us up. We have found this to be a re-occuring theme whenever we asked the staff to assist us in any way. The rooms are modern and spotless. Whilst the location is not exactly in the centre of the city we did not find this to be an issue as the hotel has a frequent shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: kopelia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moevenpick hotel for 4 nights during the Easter holidays. We were given a complimentary upgrade on arrival , and we could choose between free breakfast or upgrade our room from standard to executive. We decided to take the room. The room was fantastic much more impressive than shown on the pictures. Very big and plenty of room to move around. Large window on one side with great view (we were at the 19th floor), very clean and very nicely decorated. The room also offered espresso maker, Kettle, bathrobes and sleepers, complimentary water every day and even relaxing bath salts. The bathroom was lovely and provided heating floor which was very much appreciated!! The location was not in the city center but the half hourly shuttles were very convenient and we never had any problem booking one at the time that we wanted. It was a 5 minute drive to the central station by shuttle and then every destination would take 5-10 minutes by tram, athough you could walk from the central station around the city center very easily. Staff was very friendly at the reception or when having room service except one person at the reception who was quite rude and we tried to avoid!! We used the room service daily for breakfast and ordered dinner on a couple of occassions. Breakfast was very good and quite cheap. The portions were satisfying. Dinner, mainly sandwitches, that we ordered was very tasty and very well served. One thing that we did find disappointing was that the room service was inconsistent. We did happen to order the same thing more than once and expected to receive the same thing but this was never the same. For example when ordered chocolate croissants in the morning these were of 3 different kinds in 3 different occassions. When ordered a sandwitch it was served with white or brown bread on different occassions. Another thing that we found annoying is that some things were not replaced in our room every day. Cleaners replaced our espresso capsules but on a couple of occassions they just left decaffeine capsules which was annyoning as we did want realy coffee. They did not replace our breakfast ordering forms (which we left out of our door every night in order to receive breakfast in the morning). Other than the above, this was a very pleasant stay and would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BigMikeyP
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to head back to Amsterdam for a weekend break as we did the year before. We hunted around for a good offer for a hotel that was reasonably close to the center of Amsterdam. Because price also had a factor in where we stayed, we found ourselves looking on lastminute.com and came across their 'Secret Hotel' offerings. We decided to book this as it was a good price, and had a vague description of the location which seemed a reasonable distance. We we're thrilled that we did this once we received our confirmation email and came on Trip Advisor to see what the Movenpick was like! It looked fantastic online, and all I can say is that it's even better once you get there! The area surrounding the hotel is very nice with the water surrounding it. There is a main road going past it, but do not let that put you off as you cannot hear it and is easy to cross. There is also a tram stop nearby should you wish to commute at all. Some people have complained about the possible distance between the hotel and the city center; yes it is a bit of a walk (approx 20-30 mins) but why not take the time on that walk to enjoy the area in which you are? Have a look around! A BIG ADVANTAGE HERE - The Movenpick Hotel runs a free shuttle bus service both to and from the hotel every half-hour. You can pre-book yourself on to this by asking a member of staff, and then they will drop you off at Central Station; where you can also arrange for them to collect you on the return journey at a later time in the day/evening. The Movenpick Hotel is absolutely stunning inside with modern fittings and furniture, all well maintained and extremely clean. The staff are some of the best I have ever had the pleasure of meeting, are always happy to talk and help you should you need assistance in finding your way around the city or any general room enquiries you may have. You enter the hotel into a large open reception / seating area (which also has computers with internet access - the hotel also has free WiFi throughout the rooms), and also a concierge service. The rooms are extremely well laid out and the room I stayed in had a lovely king size bed (the bedding itself was heavenly!). The room consisted of the bed, sofa bed, table and chairs, lights eight side of the bed, a telephone, television (with British channels too e.g. Sky News), electronic safe (extremely useful and included in the price) and plenty of storage for clothes. The bathroom again was superb, with a large shower area including a glass screen and tiled throughout. The bathroom was also equipped with a speaker, which was located under the basin, which carried the audio from the television into the bathroom...very nice touch. We also ordered room service on a number of occasions, including breakfast and dinner. For breakfast we ordered a range of items such as cereal, toast and sausages. Each day you can fill out a breakfast order slip, specifying what you would like and a time at which you want it, and leave this on your door handle for them to collect. Each time our order arrived EXACTLY on time and always gave a couple of knocks on the door to make sure you were awake. I loved the experience of room service here as they were so polite and punctual with your ordering process. Prices can be viewed on the more pricey side, but room service generally is a bit more. I would definitely recommend you try it at least once just to experience it. There is also a health and spa facility including a gym and sauna; but I did not use any of these facilities. Although I did go up there and look around and it all looked very clean and high quality throughout. To sum up my experience of The Movenpick Hotel, it was by far the nicest place I have stayed and would most definately stay there again - I HIGHLY recommend you stay here. Thank you to all the staff who made our experience a fantastic one.

Reviews.Title: “Short Holiday”
Reviews.Author: FabianY
Reviews.Content: I had a great time and lot of relax the swimming pool the restarurant the brekfast everything was amaizing great place for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: educator_bhoy
Reviews.Content: Did a solo trip to Amsterdam from March 14 to 19 staying at the Movenpick after finding it for a very good deal on Priceline. Well what I thought was good deal, the hotel itself is clean and the staff very professional, but to be honest I wouldnt stay here again. The idea that its in the city centre is a bit misleading, it is one stop by tram from Central Station but literally in the middle of nowhere. There is the harbour and pretty much nothing else, no restaurants or cafes to walk to. Which leads me to the breakfast option, 23 euros per day for a breakfast buffet seems excessive to me. Also their idea of a double bed is 2 single beds pushed together, but I am told that many hotels across Europe are guilty of this. Overall an average hotel, and the using of the tram constantly does get tiresome and not really recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: susch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights and couldn't have been more pleased. The accomodations are beautiful, the rooms are very quiet, the staff is excellent, and the view is spectacular. The crowning touch for me was the plush bathrobes available upon request! It is a little walk, about 15 minutes to Centraal Station, but from there you can go anywhere easily. Or there is a canal boat stop right in front of the hotel as well as a tram stop or the hotel shuttle. We would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Zaphel
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend trip to Amsterdam and decided to stay at the Moevenpick Hotel, as we wanted a City break. The hotel service was very good and the staff were all extremely polite and helpful. The food was not very good here, but they provided all the usual drinks. The rooms were good and comfortable, nothing luxurious as the furnishing is minimalistic. Great views from the windows, as we were on one of the higher floors. The rooms were also pretty quiet and you don't hear much noise from the rooms either side of you. We wanted to enjoy the sites of Amsterdam City, so we were disappointed at first because this hotel is on the outskirts of the city and we had to walk all the way around the front to the tram stop opposite. However, on our last day, we realised that one of the canal boat routes stops right outside the hotel foyer! The canal boats are very good value for money and you get to see around the city in comfort. Highly recommended. When we went, the Euro vs GBP was not favourable and everything seemed very expensive. For example: One bar called "The Euro Bar" in the Centre, charged us the equivalent of Â£20.00 for one Vodka & Coke (single) and one beer. We would recommend this hotel, but we feel that we must make it clear that it is not really walking distance to the main centre. However, the trams stop right outside the hotel (across the road) very regularly and they are very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay & Service!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelerBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 3 nights following a Baltic cruise (cruise terminal is literally next door). What an awesome stay! The service from the entire staff, and most especially concierge Remko, was about the best we have ever had (and we've travelled a lot). The hotel itself was great - comfortable bed, plenty of room, powerful shower, free internet, good location, very good restaurant (we had dinner there our last night). The day of our cruise (and 11 days before our hotel stay was to begin), we arrived early so went to the hotel lobby to wait. Remko was very helpful right out of the gate when we arrived for our cruise later that day, even though we were only waiting in the lobby - and he did not yet know we were staying there post-cruise. He took our baggage, and (after we told him we would be staying afterwards) gave us plenty of advice about our upcoming stay after our cruise. When we returned post-cruise, the very helpful receptionist at the front desk cheerfully checked us in early before 11am, allowing my tired wife to take a nap. We've had many difficulties on other trips getting early check-in, so this was a welcome change. I wish I had noted her name! We also had trouble with a broken wheelchair wheel. We got back to the hotel late on that night, and one of the staff at the front desk saw the broken wheel and immediately did some web searches to find a wheelchair supply facility. I did some additional web research that night, and then in the morning Remko once again stepped in and made many calls for us, ultimately recommending the place (and providing directions there) that in fact was able to fix our chair. Remko also gave us lots of good advice about restaurants, travel and do's/don'ts. Remko's colleague was also quite helpful. The Movenpick has an outstanding set of people at the Movenpick Amsterdam, with Remko simply the best concierge we have ever encountered. Tip: Use the train to/from the airport. A 10-minute walk to hotel, or the use the free hotel shuttle van. 8 euro train (for 2), vs 60-70 euro taxi! The hotel & cruise terminal is about a 10 minute walk to the main downtown area, just outside the train station. Amsterdam is a great city to visit - walk around, take a canal tour, visit the windmill farms outside of town, see the museums. Everyone speaks English (more or less), and is very friendly. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: WirralApplebob
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my partners birthday which also fell on Valentine's weekend and we could not have been happier with our choice. The hotel room was spacious on on a higher floor with a fantastic view - if you you enjoy a glass of white wine I can recommend the house white that was chilling in our room for our arrival. We didn't find this hotel too far out, it is a 15 minute walk maximum but if you don't fancy the stroll the hotel also runs a free courtesy bus to Central station and the tram runs from outside the door and that would take you 5 minutes, but honestly the walk is fine. The staff were very helpful and answered all enquiries promptly when I emailed any through. The breakfast buffet was great everything you could want from fruit and cereal to made to order omlettes and all was good - I tried to sample everything - for review purposes obviously!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody and would use it again if we were planning another visit

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with excellent staff anf facilities”
Reviews.Author: tedLondonEngland
Reviews.Content: +very helpful staff and we were made very welcome, a complete oasis to relax in after a bust day in Amsterdam, not far from the central station, tram, walk or cab if lazy. would reccommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Movenpick Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: reggob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and a group of friends from the 7th to 10th January. We had executive rooms which allowed us use of the exec. lounge & separate breakfast area. The breakfast was very good with much choice. The bar and bar food was worthwhile and well worth a visit. The general service and attentiveness from the staff was in a class of its own, we encountered a taxi difficulty as we were ripped off by the charge, the concierge took our problem on board and has since obtained a full refund from the taxi company on our behalf. My wife and I will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2010 New Years Celebration-Good spot to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chilledwik
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of staying at this Hotel based in 3 rooms on the same floor, we stayed from 30/12/09-1/1/10 for New Years celebrations. It was my 3rd time in Amsterdam & for 3 of my friends 1st time so this Hotel was so idea for all of us. It took us about 20 mins walk from the Central Station (bearing in mine there was ice/snow on the ground so it seem forever) but when we got there I was impress. Check-in was quick & easy & when we got to our rooms I was soooo happy very nice, spacious room with tastful decor. There is a free transport provided by the Hotel to & from Central Station, but you do need to book which I did do before we arrived in Amsterdam but due to lateness we walked! Anyway I feel that this Hotel wasn't to far from the city centre it's just a quick ride on the # 25 tram-the stop is just outside on the left. I would stay here again it's vaule for money!!! and the staff were helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Herasunday
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just fine. few stops from central station by tram. The hotel is very modern and clean and spacious. It has an amazing view over the canal and the city. I would recommend everyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel with top service”
Reviews.Author: Supermercado
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a junior suite on executive floor (20th) for an entire week and truly enjoyed it. Location of the hotel is a 15 minutes walk from the north exit of Central Station which is convenient if you plan day trips on train. There is a tram stop (line 25) right opposite the hotel that takes you through the city and the hotel runs a free shuttle to and from the station every 30 minutes. Views from the rooms are breathtaking (see pic attached), whatever room or side of the hotel you stay in, but try to book an upper floor. Service is outstanding and all the staff is constantly trying to make you feel comfortable (efficient without being intrusive). Breakfast buffet was great â€“ as always in good properties in the Netherlands -, diverisifed, with a comprehensive selection of good quality products and items always refilled promptly. Eggs on demand are a real plus. Pastries were to die for. The executive lounge is a nice place for wine and appetizers in the early evening but unfortunately it did not offer great views as it was located on the 2nd floor. Our bathroom had a large tub and separate shower with top notch Bulgari amenities. Heated floor was a nice feature when we experienced temparetures up to -10Â° at night outside. Bed is king size but a bit to soft to my taste. It comes with 2 single duvets instead of a large one. Kind of odd but you got used to it. The room also had a Nespresso machine, free wi fi and a music system. Sound proof is good although we could hear the noisy lift's engine at night so be aware if you are a light sleeper. I would imagine this was due to being on the top floor. Moevenpick is definitely a great option for Amsterdam. Location close to the recently renovated islands is a bit out of town, so I would not recommend this hotel for first time visitors or if you are in town for parties and long nights out. For all other travellers, this without a doubt is a top choice.

Reviews.Title: “spot on for service”
Reviews.Author: smarky
Reviews.Content: took my 15 year old daughter for trip week before Xmas. The weather was terrible - heavy snow, but the hotel couldn't have been more helpful, allowing us use of the lounge and a late check-out (2pm). They also helped us get the aiport when the trains stopped running. Nice room, with terrific staff who did everyhting we could want with a smile. Location not ideal, but only a short walk to the station, and the views outwieghed the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a perfect citytrip”
Reviews.Author: Onderlegger
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel with great views. It's a 10 minute walk to the city center. Spacious, modern rooms with a couch, refrigerator, safe, good beds and a very nice bathroom. The breakfast is excellent and we always used the shuttle bus to Amsterdam Centraal.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Barfota
Reviews.Content: First I thought the hotel was situated awkwardly, but it wasn't that far to walk and the hotel had a shuttle. Best of all was to rent a bike â€“ we will do that again. Besides, it was very quiet, we didn't hear a sound from outdoors or from the neighbouring rooms. Having a room on the 15th floor, the view was marvellous. The staff was excellent, attentive but not trying to get too close. The room was good, but being three it felt a bit crowded. The kids loved the bathroom (with a speaker connected to the tv), and I found the beds very comfortable. The breakfast was perfect with everything you could ask for. Especially the gentle man making eggs and omelettes was appreciated. With a breakfast like that you didn't need to eat for many hours. We also tried dinner at the hotel. The food was good, but the selection is not overwhelming if you are a vegetarian. On the other hand is the selection of wines very good, even if you just want a glass. We also had a late lunch in the bar which was all right. Room service also worked fine. All in all, this is a hotel I would like to go back to just to pamper myself. And maybe to try one of the restaurants on the island in the neighbourhood. We had a tour there our last night (after dinner!) and several of the restaurants looked very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkJodie
Reviews.Content: Had a really lovely experience here. Room on 15th floor with an amazing view. All very comfy. Made use of the gym and sauna, tried the hotel restaurant which was excellent (and pricey). 15min walk to the central station - best accessed via the BACK of the station - bit confusing if you come out the front entrance! Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great views, nice sauna.”
Reviews.Author: benarent
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as a mystory hotel on LastMin.com. It was below cost, so we were very happy with the hotel. On the first night we ate in the restraunt which was very good and a resonable price. We were at a conference, so coming back and having a sauna was amazing. It is a little out of town, but you can very easily get a tram into town. I would recommend buying a travel card, we didn't but its a lot cheaper if you are staying here for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel Great For Couples, Fantastic Views and Free Shuttle was Ace!”
Reviews.Author: CityBreakCouple_9
Reviews.Content: Get a lastminute deal on this hotel and you will feel like youve got very good value for money. The hotel was very clean, nice bar area, excellent looking menu on the restaurant (though we didnt eat there) and fabulous views of the city! Its about a 10-15 minute walk from central station but the hotel runs a free shuttle service every half an hour back and forth which was ideal......IMPORTANT TIP ON PARKING....DO NOT PARK UNDER THE HOTEL! they wanted to charge us 48 euros for 24 hours! we found a place called P and R parking just minutes drive from the hotel, it cost like 15 euros or roundabout for the 2 nights BARGAIN! ask at the reception and they will give you directions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo870
Reviews.Content: Here's the acid test: I stayed for 4 nights at the Moevenpick in Sept. 2009, and when I return to Amsterdam in February 2010 plan to stay there again. This is a beautiful and nearly new hotel. The desk staff were friendly and spoke perfect English. The views from my 20th floor room (an upgraded floor due to a hotel promotion) were simply gorgeous, and it was fun to look down on an immense cruise ship docked next to the hotel as well as watch all the boat and ship traffic on the Ij. I didn't eat or drink at the hotel (probably my loss), so I can't comment on the room service, the restaurants, or the bar. The main issue that might concern some people is location, but I didn't find that to be an issue. First of all, the No. 25 and 26 trams both run to and from Centaal Station, and both stop right near the hotel. The one trick one has to learn to ride the trans to or from the Musiekgebouw stop is how to get to the hotel from that stop. After one figures it out, it's a simple matter of crossing an interesting footbridge and using the stairs at the west end of the Musiekgebouw, but that route could be difficult to find if one didn't already know where to look. An alternative to the Musiekgebouw stop is the Passenger Terminal Amsterdam (PTA) stop on tram No, 25 -- the stop after Musiekgebouw on the route from Centraal Station. The PTA stop is impossible to miss, because it is the teminus of Line 25. From the PTA stop, it is a short easy walk to the hotel (circa one city block, if that), and the hotel dominates the landscape and therefore is easy to find.. My recommendation: If you are traveling from Centraal Station to the hotel for the first time, take the No, 25 tram to the PTA stop, and walk from there. One thing that is nice about the No. 25 line is that it runs through much of Amsterdam, roughly from north to south. If you hop on this tram at the PTA or Musiekgebouw stop, you can grab a seat before the tram loads up with passengers at Centraal Station. (The No. 26 tram, going west, runs only to Centaal Station. However, heading east it runs all the way out to Ijburg.) The hotel shuttle proved convenient as a way to get to Centraal Station. (I didn't try it as a way to get from the station to the hotel, but probably would have called the hotel for a ride had I not been such a mass transportation addict.) It's true that one needs to make a "reservation" for the shuttle, but that is not a major hassle. Basically, the shuttle runs at any given time only if there are people who want to ride in it, and making a "reservation" means only that one needs to tell the concierge that one would like a ride. I showed up in the lobby at just a few minutes before the hour one day, and simply asked for a ride in the shuttle -- and there was no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “too far away from mostly everything you want to see”
Reviews.Author: TinaNYC
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, functional hotel. Comfortable bed, great view, and the best instant coffee I have ever had. The shower was one of those funky, no door, hand held shower head type numbers that always seems to get the floor wet, but that could just be me. If you are sharing a double room with someone, you should know that the bathroom doors are frosted glass and may not offer the privacy you require. The front desk was friendly if not overly helpful. I had drinks and snacks in the bar one night. The drinks were good, but the snacks, some guacamole and chips, were average, and the service was a bit slow. Hereâ€™s the major problem and I know it has been mentioned before, but you really, really need to consider it before you stay here: you are a good ten minute walk from anything in the parts of Amsterdam you want to see. At least ten minutes along a path on the water. See the photo I attached. There was no stopping by your hotel room mid-day, resting your feet, using the lavatory or dropping off packages. Once you left for day, you didnâ€™t want to go back and once you were in, you just donâ€™t feel like going back out again. There are no restaurants, clubs, stores, anything nearby except Muziekgebouw aan â€™t IJ, the new concert hall. (Tip, if you are staying at the Movenpick, you can walk up the footbridge to the concert hall and then walk down a few flights of steps to get to the entrance of the hotel. Otherwise, you actually have to walk by the hotel to get to the front and that just exacerbates your annoyance.). My other tip is to stock up on snacks and drinks at either the AH or HEMA outposts in Central Station before your trek. If you are in Amsterdam for work at Phillips, or are on a cruise ship, stay at the Movenpick, otherwise, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Conorq
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel for 2 nights for my birthday break. The location is not that far from the main area. A 10min walk from centraal station. Trams 25 & 26 stop by the hotel. Got a great rate through hotwire but emailed hotel in advance to ask about an upgrade to exec room. The cost was â‚¬70 per night with room on top floor , breakfast and lounge access. We arrived to checkin but no exec kings rooms were available. I advised we requested one in advance so they upgraded us to a junior suite which was great but was on the 12th floor with only ok views. We were told that prior to our arrival that the had assigned us a nice room on the 20th floor with great views, so while we were appreciated with the upgrade of room the views were not as great as promised. The room was nice very comfortable bed, nice shower however a bit disappointed the TV was not lcd or plasma. Everything is clean and new so old tv felt out of place in the room. We decided to have a drink in the exec lounge on the 2nd floor. As other reviews mentioned nobody was in the exec lounge when we arrived or any time we went their. Staff were walking around the empty restaurant which is beside the lounge but none came to the exec lounge to ask to serve us drinks e.t.c no service at all. We had to rummage around to try to find a drink e.t.c. Many of the staff seemed disinterested in any sort of service. This was the same for breakfast which you could have in the lounge or restaurant around the corner. The breakfast was a self service breakfast. The only thing they asked us did we want tea or coffee at breakfast. We only drink tea and so were told that we could get that from the restaurant . Very strange they will service you some coffee but not tea a bit typical of the non existant service. This is not the service you would expect from such a hotel. overall nice clean modern hotel but lacking the service you would expect. Would I stay there again probably not as I like a hotel that know how to provide some level of service to its guests. You want it to succeed but it sadly fails in this department.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PassportandVisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night while passing through Amsterdam. I previously lived just outside of Amsterdam and was not too familiar with hotels (having been a resident) I am glad I chose the Moevenpick. The hotel is very new and stylish, the bar downstairs serves a large menu of cocktails and drinks. The room had a great view of the city and had a couch which was nice to sit and read. The decor of the hotel is very modern and all common areas are kept spotlessly clean. My one gripe- the lobby is quite small and it can seem like the concierge and desk staff are staring you down as you walk though- a bit overbearing for my tastes. The hotel also has underground parking which is very convenient (and rare to find in central Amsterdam). I would highly recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Big Room and Top Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Mons11
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, spacious room, beautiful breakfast. Close to everything. A bit of a walk around the canal but they offer free transfers during day

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louisalexander
Reviews.Content: Just visited the Movenpick Hotel for a two night stay as a birthday treat and it was brilliant. After a harrowing start, nearly missing our flight i was so pleased that on arrival early at the hotel the receptionist checked us into our room and we could start to relax. All the staff were extremely friendly and professional and very helpful. The room was clean and stylish with a fabulous view. The barman was hilarious although i dont think he ment to be but it was a pleasure after a long walk around Amsterdam. The tram conveniently stopped opposite the hotel so access to Centraal Station was really good. Chocolates and biscuits with a birthday card in our room was a lovely touch. Overall a very good standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenverDenny
Reviews.Content: A great newer hotel with an easy walk to downtown. The tram station is only one block away and the walk to town is only ten minutes. Modern large rooms with great views of the city. Large bathroom. Refrigerator in room.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: LeanneEvans
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. A fantastic room on the 18th floor therefore we had an amazing view. After booking we telephoned the hotel and asked if it was possible to have a waterside view- they were very accommodating. The hotel is a 10 min walk from the city centre but it runs a free shuttle service as so as long as you're booked on there's not extra walking involved. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was luxury with bath robes and underfloor heating. Cleanliness was exceptional and we didn't hear another person the whole time we were there. It's apparent that it's a business hotel but there are plenty of tourists there. We did treat ourselves to breakfast one morning although I would say this is the only negative-it's very expensive at 23 euros each! However, it was very tasty and a lovely restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel,but we couldnt afford breakfast”
Reviews.Author: keithwhiteley
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here while competing in the amsterdam marathon,and it really made our weekend.the hotel was fabulous,the room was superb,clean and modern,in fact it was that good,we even stayed in and watched strictly come dancing instead of going out.the hotel is situated a bit off the beaten track,but the trams run from outside the hotel every ten minutes,if you can figure out how to open the tram door when it stops.the only gripe we had was the price of breafast,at Â£46 for the two of us,we opted for the tram down to the local lidl.the bar was relaxing and the service was excellent.the bar staff are also very observant,as we found to our cost when we accidentally left without paying! if you book the free shuttle into town,make sure you are on time,and not 3 minutes late as we were,as they dont hang around.all in all its a fabulous hotel,and we would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Marvoulous view on the 20th floor”
Reviews.Author: smallmadtv
Reviews.Content: Marvoulous view on the 20th floor but no free parking (one that is not cheep...104â‚¬ for 2 days)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: LangleyVagabond
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to boarding a river cruise. It was a fantastic hotel. The staff were awesome, each taking the time to make their service personal. The hotel is not right in the old town, but they do provide a free shuttle, which takes 5 minutes to get there. We walked most of the time...it is just 10 minutes by foot. The hotel is immediately next door to the new cruise terminal, and also has easy access to public transport. Their breakfast buffet is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: LApawpaw
Reviews.Content: We took a round trip Scandinavian cruise from Amsterdam and stayed at the Movenpick in Amsterdam for four days before the cruise. The hotel is located next to the cruise ship terminal so were able to sleep late and walk just a few steps to the terminal the morning we embarked the ship. We had a great view of the city from our room. The room was clean and comfortable and we opted for the free breakfast instead of the room upgrade because we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The breakfast was very good although the milk was terrible. Sometimes we walked to Central Station and other times we caught the train from in front of the Movenpick. Amsterdam has an excellent mass transit system. I would highly recommend the Movenpick.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magpie0444
Reviews.Content: Hotel not in city center but a great location easy walk to the center of things. I takes about 10 minutes to get to the center of things. You are on the river and there isn't anything right there to eat but a subway and the resturant in the Hotel . So you might be wise to eat before you go back to hotel. The rooms are very nice, clean, and the people who work for hotel are great--very helpful. Great location if you are taking a cruise from Amsterdam. My group took a cruise from amsterdam and it was so eay to get on cruise ship from the Hotel--right next door. If you look at their website you can catch some really good deals that include breakfast everymorning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing posh hotel at wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: keviv_g2
Reviews.Content: So my cousin and I (20-something guys) decided to join a group of 8 friends on a bachelor party trip to Amsterdam. My friends toook one of those cheap all 8-in-0one room hostel rooms. Needing to stay in a bit more luxorious place, I decided to look aroud Trip Advisor and found this gem of a place! We found a great buy 2 nights - get 1 night free rate, and since we split the room we each payed only like $10 more than our buddies who were slumming it. And boy, what a wonderful hotel. ON the waterfront, with a WONDERFUL view of the water and the incomin cruiseships - very serene especially when you're relaxing after a full day of debauchery. There was a tram stop right arcross the hotel, but even at 3am when I walked back alone from Centraal (a 5-10min walk) there was no danger at all - very nice walk on brightly lit main roads. There is also a free shuttle every half hour to centraal. The room itself was very spacious, and very modern in design which I loved. The funky unclosable glass door was a bit weird at first but hell, you're in AMsterdam so lose your inhibitions! There is also a nice sofa in the room. We opted to go in for the free breakfast over being upgraded to the next level of room - and what a good choice that way. The breakfast buffet was EXPANSIVe to say the leave, with tons of fresh bread, salads, meats, yogurts and a fresh omelette station. All 3 days we ended up eating so much at the breakfast (it closes at 11, but we woke up at 10:45 and rushed there, and they let us stay till we finished, no rush) that we never had to eat again till the evening! Seeing the cramped quarters my friends ended up, i was glad we chose this hotel! it may not be a very 'happening' place like the other hostels in the center of town, but believe me - you'll do fine drinking and partying there but having a nice quiet, posh place to come back to (especially if you have company ;)). There is a great gym that we didnt take advatange of, and there are free computers you can use near the lobby. Oh, and dont forget to order the swiss icecream from room service - best butterscotch and caramel sauce ever. Movenpick was the best decision we made in Amsterdam, and that's saying a lot :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: oknufsaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Moevenpick Amsterdam City Center for seven days in August 2009. The hotel facilities were excellent. The view from the 20th floor was great. Hotel staff was caring and helpful. Breakfast was always inviting! We enjoyed our stay and look forward to returining someday in future.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want to be OUT of the way, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: JUdyrem
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was fine. Yet the location was horrible IMO. No way is that a center city hotel! There is NOTHING around it, not a store or restaurant. This was our first and perhaps our last trip to Amsterdam. The location of the hotel just ruined my whole experience there. We bought a tram pass, but for 2 nights the trams were not running there, and we had to walk the 3/4 mile walk. What a nuisance, especially if you have some packages. We are in our 60's and after a full day of site seeing, it become a true trek back.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, comfortable, great service, easy access . . . recommended”
Reviews.Author: SM44147
Reviews.Content: Modern high-rise hotel next to cruise ship terminal, easy access from train station. We purchased a metro/tram/bus pass and used it to get around town. Hotel is just one stop from the station, the 25 and 26 trams both stop adjacent to hotel, eliminating the 10-15 minute walk. Very comfortable room, well appointed, with great view of the shipping activity and ferries. Quiet location away from the bustle of central Amsterdam, yet easy access. Getting a great rate on priceline certainly helps, so this was a great value for our stay. Highly recommend this hotel with no hesitation - you will enjoy your stay and visit.

Reviews.Title: “A little off the beaten path, but that's a good thing!”
Reviews.Author: DJSON80
Reviews.Content: If you have ever been to Amsterdam you know that the Hotel you stay at is just for crashing... but the Movenpick was quite nice and made crashing even easier. It's new, clean, and safe. The walk from Centraal takes about 10-15 minutes and it always seemed safe as there wasn't much going on between the city and the hotel. Plus you can see the hotel from Centraal which makes it easy to find when you are "confused" and lost... All in all a great place to stay. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days because of a great rate on Hotwire.com. I was a little skittish about the location because this was my first trip to Amsterdam and wasn't so sure about being out of the City Center. So I split my 10 day visit between here and another hotel inside the city center and I have to say this was a far better choice. Service from check in to check out is excellent, there was ALWAYS someone in the lobby to greet me and they had a very efficient and friendly concierge service. The room is FANTASTIC! Big, modern and incredible views of the city and the port. I would say the rooms are comparable to the "W" chain in the US. Free wifi and all sorts of great details, a nice little fridge, gorgeous huge bathroom (with speakers wired to the TV! hidden under the sink, nice touch.) The only slight negative is the European fetish for pushing two twin beds together and declaring it one bed. The room was also decorated with very light colors, so it was a very relaxing feel. Room Service! The prices for room service were actually reasonable! And the food was really good! I ordered breakfast through room service every morning, an omelette and sasuage and toast was around 11 Euros, very well prepared and always delivered in about 10 minutes. I also had a sandwich one afternoon and it was pretty good as well. I did try the bar and the food in the bar and it was fine, actually pretty good, service is slow down there though. They also have a free gym, though it's a small fitness room, and not much equipment for such a large hotel. It will take about 15 lonely minutes to get to Central Station walking. They have a shuttle that goes there every 30 minutes, but you have to sign up for it, even if it's just a few minutes before it leaves. There are two tram stops as well in the vicinity. After a night of "activity" in the city, I usually took a cab back at about 3 or 4am and it cost me 10Euro from Dam Square, although some cab drivers told me 15 so I walked away until they said 10. I also decided I would take the challenge and did manage to get back to the hotel at 4 am pretty snockered with no trouble whatsoever. I cannot imagine doing this during an Amsterdam winter. I found that coming back to the hotel after a day of chaos in the city was actually the perfect relaxation. They provide a very calming and prefessional environment. It was the best antidote to the craziness that goes on when you're in the city. Also there is absolutely NOTHING around the hotel except for a lonely little gift shop next door and a rather sad Subway Sandwich shop next to the cruise terminal, so be prepared and use the fridge if you need some snacks. Anyhow totally recommend this place and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern High-Rise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwissT88
Reviews.Content: Next door to Celebrity Cruise Dock, 15 min walk to Central Station. 2 Tram +1 sightseeing Boat dock within two blocks. Free Hotel Shuttle to Central Station with reservation every 30 min. Busy hotel,but all the extras. Only drawback was it was a bit set away from conviences--so you need to plan ahead before returning to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...as long as you don't mind walking!”
Reviews.Author: karameli
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for an incredible price on Priceline -- from research, I pretty much knew this was the hotel I would win. I wasn't disappointed -- it was excellent! A spacious, clean room, a BIG bathroom with a full shower (a rarity in A'dam), and delicious, surprisingly cheap room service! We got a full breakfast delivered to our room every morning for under $20 USD. There were several computers in the lobby for internet service, and the concierge recommended an incredible Indian restaurant and a tasty bakery. The only downside is the walk -- it's on the water, next to the concert hall, about a 10-minute walk from the train station, so about 15-20 minutes' walk from downtown. We enjoyed the scenic walk (and felt extremely safe in Amsterdam) but if you have mobility issues -- or if you expect to be stumbling rather than walking home -- it would probably be easier to stay in in the heart of downtown. But I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “It was brilliant and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nazli_D
Reviews.Content: Moevenpick was an excellent hotel in Amsterdam. it was very close to central train station and city centre. Our room was on 11th floor, and the views were just amazing. We could walk to the city centre every day which is just 10-15 minutes walk. There are boat and tram station nearby the hotel. The service was perfect and the staffs were friendly. You will get free access to high speed internet and also access to gym and sauna as you could expect in a high standard hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a relaxed stay out of crowd. However, the hotel is quite modern, so if you are looking for some local features in the building or people who run the place you can not find any. This is a modern international hotel with a relaxed atmosphere , good service and excellent views. And by the way, if you are interested in culture/art or museums, Nemo musem (by Renzo piano) is just 10 minutes away; Music Building is the building next to the hotel, and there are many good modern architectures around such as Amsterdam library

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel - Away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: DubaiSameer
Reviews.Content: The name is a misnomer as the hotel is not really in the city centre. The location however is an advantage as you are away from the crowds in the city centre but can get there in just about 10 minutes when you want. The rooms are quite clean and spacious and even though we were travelling with our 12-year old, we didn't feel any space constraints. The staff is very helpful and the concierge is more than willing to guide you on the tours you should take and arrange them as well if you need. All in all, an excellent family hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lush”
Reviews.Author: Ludabud
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was absolutely amazing - staff, cleanliness, rooms, food, drink, scenery from hotel windows, service - everything. My only gripe would be that it is a little too far away from the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam. Although only a 15min walk it was just a distance too far for the weekend trip we wanted. Add to that, the rooms at this hotel are so comfortable, you just don't want to walk those 15mins back to town again!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Jas3009
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a friday nearly 3 hours early for check in hoping we could leave our bags in the luggage room and were told we could check in to both of our rooms straight away which was great after such an early start. Our rooms were standard twins on a 3rd night free promotion. They had the all expected ammenities of a 4* hotel and were clean, comfortable and spacious with great views but there is only a frosted glass door without lock to the bathroom, which could be a problem for some. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. They also offer 24hr room service which we used once. The hotel has free internet connection, gym, sauna, bar, resturant etc but we didn't use any of these facilities except the internet as we were out most of the time. The Hotel is only about a 10 minute walk from Centraal Station (maybe more after a night out) but there are also canal bus and tram stops right outside otherwise. We checked out on the monday and the city tax was less than 10 euros per room for the whole weekend. We enjoyed staying here and will definately stay again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel...”
Reviews.Author: WILL0W06
Reviews.Content: Have just returned yesterday with my sister from Amsterdam. The hotel seems a walk from Centraal Station but once you are there and worked out the trams just opposite etc, it was nice to be where we were. The package I booked was 3 nights for the price of 2 and also included either a free room upgrade or free breakfast. We had the free breakfast. I had emailed before arrival to check if they had soya milk for breakfast; which they did; and this was referred to when we checked in, so no problems at breakfast time. We arrived before 11 and were able to check in and checked out just before 12 on our departure day (didn't know at the time our flight was delayed by +2 hours!) but took advantage of the free (pre-book) shuttle bus to Centraal Station - seats 8 people. The hotel was very clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful. If ever returning to Amsterdam (and I hope I do someday) I would definitely return to the Movenpick.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Cruise Passengers”
Reviews.Author: writingwanderer
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Amsterdam before leaving on our cruise to Norway and the Baltic. The Movenpick was a perfect spot for us right next to the cruise terminal. It is only a ten minute walk to Central Station (fifteen in the evening when you're tired). But there is a tram that stops right at the corner and goes into Central Station where you can catch any mode of transportation you need. We found it quite easy to use. One stamp on your ticket allows you to ride for an hour--more than enough time to get anywhere in the city. We found the accommodations quite comfortable. Arriving early from the airport, we were allowed to check our luggage and go off to explore until our room was ready. Many of the rooms face the water and ours had a spectacular view down the river with wonderful sunsets each night. Everything was clean, neat, comfortable, and orderly. We did not use the restaurant for breakfast because of the buffet and the price but the menu looked enticing for other meals. On the day of embarkation for our cruise, we spent the morning at the Rembrandt house and then checked out, rolled our bags next door and checked in for our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “beware the â‚¬150 charge on check in !!!”
Reviews.Author: dannymidd
Reviews.Content: we arrived on a Friday afternoon having booked a 3 night city break through Thomas cook , having paid this in full , we would have thought that the spending money we took with us , would be to explore , eat , and buy gifts , HOW WRONG WE WERE !!! upon arrival at the hotel , we were not greeted in the usual standard expected from Movenpick staff, in fact it was more like down right hostility , the trip had been booked for 3 people and paid for 3 people so when we arrived , it was a bit concerning that they thought there was only 2 of us . The next problem was when the receptionist demanded a â‚¬150 deposit I have never been asked for this when checking into a hotel booked on a pre paid trip, of course this could have lead to some embarrassment, if one had been on a budget.. oh also donâ€™t try to pay by bank card they want a credit card .. or will pay your money back in cash I donâ€™t think any one ate in the restaurant apart of breakfast ( included in our price) as it was a bit of a rip off and you can get a sub way sandwich 5 mins along from the hotel , or jump on either a 25 or 26 tram which will take you into town would I recommend this hotel ..quite frankly no I am no longer passionately Swiss ( Movenpicks catch phrase)

Reviews.Title: “Quality 'finds' in this beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: wobblesLancashire
Reviews.Content: Having taken previous trips to Amsterdam and done all the usual touristy things, my friends and I hoped to get a different feel for this wonderful city. The 3 of us (All female in our mid 30's) spent the weekend at the clean, comfortable and stylish Movenpick Hotel which is just one tram stop along the harbour from Centraal Station. The hotel was excellent value for money and the staff extremely courteous. We agree that we would definitely stay there again. Eating out in the city can be very expensive. We wanted to find somewhere that provided fresh, tasty local produce at reasonable prices. We most definitely found this in La Place. Just visiting is an experience in itself. There are stands offering fresh uncooked foods which you choose from and the staff cook in front of you to your liking. We especially liked the stir fry stand where we each filled a bowl with veg of our choice, picked a meat (Or prawns) and this was stir fried for us with option of sauces. I had mine with noodles and took a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. This came to a little over 10euros. Food can be eaten up or downstairs in the airy eating areas. Having tried various coffee shops on previous visits, we were very impressed by Barney's. On one side of the road there is Barney's coffe shop where people can smoke and drink soft /hot drinks and on the other is Barney's licensed cafe bar serving delicious snacks. We went on Sat evening and enjoyed cocktails and DJ playing RnB. People brought their own smoke and it was a really atmospheric and chilled evening...well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Despite the Location”
Reviews.Author: robs4219
Reviews.Content: Out of 6 hotels we stayed in during our trip, the Moevenpick was the highlight. Since we were only staying one night, we were upgraded to the executive floor, so Iâ€™m not sure if all the rooms in the hotel are similar to ours. The room was excellent; very stylishly and tastefully decorated, comfortable, and clean. The room was air-conditioned and had complimentary wifi. The view over the harbour looking at central Amsterdam was absolutely amazing. Definitely a room worthy of the hotelâ€™s 5-star claim. We booked through Priceline, so the room was excellent value considering the price. From desk staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel offers a free shuttle to Amsterdam Centraal Station every half-hour. This was very convenient, although Amsterdam Centraal is a quick 12-15 minute walk if you decide to skip the shuttle. The only downside to this hotel is the location; while still centrally located, there is not much of anything near the hotel in terms of restaurants and shops. If you donâ€™t want to eat at the hotel restaurant or the cafÃ© in the concert hall next door, youâ€™ll have to walk or take the tram or shuttle to nearer Amsterdam Centraal to find anything. This isnâ€™t a huge issue if the weather is decent, but in the cold or rain it could be an issue since much of that walk is quite exposed to the elements.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel, when we come back to Amsterdam this is the hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: MefoandMeho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning. The rooms are very spacious, and offer you views to die for. The food was also excellent. You are only 5 min from central station and the hotel has a free shuttle service to the central station and the tram is also right in front of the hotel. This hotel was quite, peaceful, in excellent condition since it was just built 5-6 years ago. The restaurant serves excellent food and customer service is top of the line. The only issue I had was that the blow dryer provided in the room was broken and the hotel did not have extra ones to replace the broken one with. So, for the four days we stayed there I could not do my hair. That would be my only recommendation for management and is to make sure you they have extra blow-dryers. I would still give this hotel a rating of excellent, even with the small blow-dryer issue.

Reviews.Title: “You need to read this due to hotel LOCATION...”
Reviews.Author: Isle 'n Sun
Reviews.Content: This hotel includes itself with other hotels claiming to be part of the 'city center.' Technically it may be. However, this particular hotel is a bit remote (on the fringe of the City Center). It is reasonalbe close to the main train station. A 15 minute walk. Mostly unprotected from weather. There is a hotel shuttle that runs every 30 minutes from/to train station. Also a city tram/train. Walking is quickest. But it is a 15+ walk to reach most all areas of Amsterdam. That is why you may have read complaints from others about hotel not being in the City Center. Again, I would say it is on the fringe. What a wonderful hotel. I avoid giving Excellent scores. To me Excellent means I received services far greater than expected. Rare!!! We had an11th floor corner room over looking water/train station/amsterdam. Closing, I recommended this hotel to some friends. The best price they could get was no where close to what I paid. Hence, the perfect 5 for Value. My only complaint is that the bathroom door is frosted glass. When someone is in the bathroom the bathroom light brightens the rest of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clinical Swiss Cleanliness and Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was as expected a neat and a clean hotel with everything functioning punctually. Moevenpick is a Swiss-owned chain - even though this one is in Netherlands. The rooms were very clean, concierge (especially Daniel) was very helpful. The only nitpick is that the service at the restaurant was very slow - the food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Friendly Service.”
Reviews.Author: scoobasteve
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day stay at the Moevenpick Amsterdam during a trip across western Europe. The hotel was the best hotel we stayed at and the best price (Through Priceline) Service was friendly, the room was cleaned daily. Shuttle Service was convenient. There is a tram stop across the street that will take you to central station. Otherwise its a 10-15 minute walk. The room service was always available, Decently priced compared to other hotels and we were never disappointed with the quality of food. We also had free wireless internet, a service we paid up to 20 euros for at other hotels The hotel bar was very nice, It was open 24 hours during the weekend of our stay. Front desk staff were also great. One even gave us his pack of cigarettes when we were out and all local stores were closed. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views over the Ij, but be aware that its best if you like walking”
Reviews.Author: ballyglass
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to be said for efficiency and this was efficient. The views were fantastic. I recommend that you ask for a room facing back towards the city as its more interesting. It's good that you can open the window even though it's airconditioned . The crucial thing is that it is some way to walk from the main commercial centre around Centraal Station and this walk could seem rather desolate in winter. It is right next door to the new concert hall and quite close to the fantastic public library. Breakfast is expensive but there is a Subway in the same block serving the nearby office buildings. Also in the same block is the passenger ship terminal. The concierges run a shuttle service to the station and the tram also stops outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection with a smile”
Reviews.Author: bensonopoulo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days and a friend of mine stayed for another 6. We both had the same room with a great view of the harbor!! I thought that the walk would be tiring but it was quite pleasant. The staff accommodated all my requests and I'll make this my hotel of choice next time in A'dam!! The Room service and house keeping was A-1. I've stayed in 5 star hotels in all of Europe this one is up there with them.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view - Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle_Babyshop
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one day but I felt very comfortable in this hotel. Nice, friendly and helpfull staff. Room had a great view, and was clean and comfortable. Nice gym. In the small Spa there were spacious Sauna `s but i prefer turkish baths so I did not use the spa. Altough it is not in the middle of Amsterdam it is just 2 Tram minutes away from Amsterdam Central station (tram 25 - 26). A good place to stay if you have to visit Amsterdam for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient & Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller05
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam several times and was thoroughly impressed by the Movenpick. I bid through Priceline as well and got a fantastic deal. Like many others, I was initially worried that the location of the hotel would mean that most of Amsterdam's sights would be outof convenient reach, but not at all. Convenient walk, one tram stop from Central Stn on Tram Line 25 or 26. Tram Line 25 also takes you right down Damrak to Muntplein, from which you can get to Rembrant Sq. The Rooms are very clean and well mantained. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, so were the Room Service staff. The only "moan" I'd have is the whole idea of having two twin beds together to form a king bed, but still keeping two twin duvets. Not sure I get the thinking behind that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent And Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: rule62
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam, and I am glad we were slightly removed from the city center. Getting into the historic old part of town is very easy. It is one tram stop, a 15 minute walk, a bike, or the hotel's shuttle service. Prior to the trip, we looked at several hotels in the city center. We had an opportunity to see these hotels after our arrival, and we were happy we were not there. Amsterdam is what I expected, and I am glad we were not in the middle of it all the time. It was nice to get away a bit. As already noted, the hotel is located on the pier where all the cruise ships dock - that was kind of cool. It was interesting to watch them come in and offload thousands of people! I thought the guest service was excellent, I actually used the concierge service a lot (usually don't) because they were so good and informed, and I liked the new clean rooms. I must comment on the room safe - maybe this type is common now, but it was so easy to use with a digital coding system. Also, the cleaning crew was so kind, they actually tucked in my daughters teddy bears for us. She loved it when we would return to the room after they had been there. At one point, I called down to the front desk for extra towels and they were there in less than three minutes. I was surprised. Also, our last morning we ordered breakfast into the room and it was excellent. I've been living in Europe for four years now, and I don't need the quaint 16th century inn anymore for the ambiance. I've been doing those for the last four years. Give me a modern, new contemporary hotel with plumbing that works.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Botak
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean modern hotel in Amsterdam this one certainly fits the bill. Nice spacious room, good bathroom and a relaxing sauna make for a comfortable spa. The location is a brisk 10 minutes walk from Central station, so a bit out of town which may or may not be a good thing. There is a shuttle bus if you don't fancy the walk. Fantastic view over the city and harbour. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the shower!”
Reviews.Author: june000
Reviews.Content: very clean and modern hotel. Location somewhat inconvenient if you want to be out day and night being a tourist as you are dependent on the shuttle to take you to Central Station. You could walk but it is deserted after dark. The showers are tricky, I had to ring room service in the end to show me how to turn it off. And as previous noted by others there is some problem with ? water pressure, the water constantly oscillates between being too hot and too cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, not for a romantic get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: afree
Reviews.Content: First, I would say the is a very good hotel, definitely not 5 star, but a good 4 star hotel. It is very modern, very North American style new hotel, almost hip (but not quite) - if you like that, you'll be happy. But it is away from the charm of Amsterdam, not even close to being a romantic spot, you have to walk thru 15mins of vacant dockland to get to it. So, if you are looking for charm, romance and the Amsterdam experience, this is not your hotel. If you are looking for a great busines hotel, this is perfect. The service at the hotel is excellent, rooms are excellent, free wi-fi, business center - everything you need for business. Oh, and one other thing - make sure you don't get a room next to the elevators - you won't sleep - they are very noisy. I was given one these rooms, in 5 mins I called the front desk and put me in another room - and they were very good about it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filippo75
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel for a conference. Really excellent: clean, nice and spacious rooms, with great view on the harbor. Breakfast, service and catering are top-class as well. The only downside is the position, a bit outside the turistic area.

Reviews.Title: “second time to stay there!! would defo go back!!”
Reviews.Author: anita1harris
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to visit Amsterdam and to stay at this hotel. We had booked into Hotel Atlanta at first with some family members and had to leave after one day as it was so bad, should have booked movenpick from the start. Great value, everything was fabulous, extremely clean and staff very friendly. Tram line and boats right outside hotel and come frequently. Taxi only â‚¬8.00 to Dam Square. Would defo come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cicero123456
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels i have stayed. Big, clean and good location. You can take tram lines 25 or 26 to the central train station and city center easily. I have also stayed in its sister hotel in Sa'na, Yemen. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & Awesome Views”
Reviews.Author: just-for-the-ride
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to Europe. The Moevenpick was a perfect choice for me as it was close to Central Station and the city. They have a shuttle that goes to Centraal station every 1/2 hr or you can walk, rent a bike or scooter. Also right next to the hotel there is on going entertainment. When I was there were many jazz concerts happening. What an awesome place. No matter what room your in there will be a view. Room service was good if thats your thing. Staff was friendly. This was my fifth trip to Amsterdam. I used to always stay at the Sheraton at the airport. Not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, pragmatic, great views!”
Reviews.Author: Tulsaguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in early March 2009. The hotel has spectacular views of the IJ (I ws on the 17th floor). It sits over the water and the rooms face either north or south overlooking the river. It is very clean. Wifi in the room is free and in my room it was strong. The room layouts vary. I had a king bed, a desk and "couch" (more on that later). I noticed in two hotels in Amsterdam that they had a split duvet on the bed. It is two twin size duvets, which I found annoying. I am used to one large covering for the entire bed. If my wife was there, I would have hated it, but I did get used to it (sort of) after a couple of nights. The inordinately firm "couch" is the hardest couch I ever sat on. Not particularly comfortable for lounging. The bathroom is a nice size. but has this not-so-ingenious glass partition with a hinged end (I have no idea why). After every shower I had to mop the floor. Same thing at another Amsterdam hotel. I guess if you keep the water at a trickle, the floor might stay dry. Also, the tub has a very high side - be careful getting in and out. I had breakfast every day (it was included with our corporate plan) in the restaurant, which has an unusual layout. You can sit at high tables with tall chairs or low tables with awkward benches. The food was good and there was a decent selection. I did like that they left a pot of coffee on the table (most days). The room service menu seemed to be pretty limited. I only ordered in one time and it was delivered promptly. If you cannot get out, you are pretty restricted there. For the budget conscious, there is a Subway in the same building past the passenger terminal entrance. Interestingly enough, it is cheaper than in the US. Service is somewhat spartan. Laudry? You have to bring it down to them- unheard of in better hotels. Shuttle? They tell you it runs every 30 minutes to Central Station between the station and the Water Taxi landing. However, you need to set up a reservation in advance. Even then I had some difficulties and had to cajole them once or twice into running me back or forth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: LSEdwards
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with Hotel Moevenpick. The staff were really helpful, it's in a good location close to the Central station. The room was quite spacious, very clean and well equipped with an excellent view of the harbour. I didn't try the food as breakfast wasn't included in the package.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, exceeded expectations, felt like home”
Reviews.Author: YogaMaria
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived at Centraal Station in Amsterdam, we looked east and saw the Movenpick Hotel looming on the horizon.
