The hotel was perfectly situated for us, a short, pleasant walk from the city center (10 minutes), but far enough away that we weren't assaulted by noise and traffic at all hours. We chose the hotel because we got a great rate online, but we were surprised at how personal and comfortable this hotel was for a "business class" hotel. The rooms were extremely soundproof, and the cleaning staff was very respectful and quiet in the hallways in the morning, so we slept soundly. We requested a view of the River Ij and got one. The panoramic view from our window on the 12th floor was breathtaking: we could see the river and the entire city spread out before us. Every morning on our way out, we grabbed an apple from the front desk, and in the evening when we returned, we helped ourselves to a refreshing glass of mineral or sparkling water in the lobby. Bottled water was also complimentary in our room...a nice change from the American model of charging $5 a bottle! We very much appreciated the security safe in our room, the coffee and tea service, and the free wi-fi for our laptop. As we never eat breakfast in the hotel, the high price of breakfast didn't bother us at all. It's a better deal, and more fun, to find a cafe in town anyway. For late-starters (like us), eat the Cafe Panorama, on Raadhuisstaat--they have a great fried-egg, spinach, and feta on toast deal that is scrumptious! Probably the best thing about the Movenpick, for us, was the ability to rent bikes downstairs, in the parking garage, from Amsterbike. We were blessed with great weather all week, so we decided to explore the city like the natives, on two wheels. Our friendly and helpful bike rental guy, "Rad," set us up with sturdy three-speed cruisers, complete with bike locks and head- and rear lights. He even set me up with a basket one day, so I could shop at the outdoor market on Saturday. I would HIGHLY recommend renting from Amsterbike, even if you don't stay at the Movenpick. Rad was super helpful, his bikes are top-notch, and they have a special underground bike lockup area that made it easy to get in and out. We spent very little time in the hotel bar and fitness area, but both were very nice. Overall, the Movenpick was a wonderful experience, exceeding our expectations in every way. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel with 1st class service”
Reviews.Author: baddy95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the movenpick for 4 nights, found everything to be perfect, except the location. but didnt let that spoil our visit. if you come out of hotel turn left 100 meters and the number 25 tram stops there every 15 mins. and goes to central station or dam sq. or the hotel has a mini bus that goes to central station every 30 mins (must be booked in advance ) or if your feeling fit a 10 minute walk to central station. The rooms in the hotel were beautiful, spotless clean, and if your lucky enough to get a room on a high floor, with view of the city even better, i asked for this at reception and they give it me.the view was fantastic. the rooms had tea coffee, bath robes slippers, iron ironing board, tv and radio,also pay tv for movies but found these a little over priced, think they were between 10 and 17 euro. the reception staff were very helpful and talked or said hello, good morning ect every time you walked past. also room service was fast phoned down for some drinks and they were there in minutes Breakfast in the hotel was excellant, great selection of everything from full english, to a chef cooking eggs any way you fancied them and your usual contiental, never tried the resturant in the evening but looked very good. service at breakfast was fast, i have read on other reviews that it was slow, but cant agree, maybe they have got more staff? even when very busy coffee was constant. Didnt try the gym or spa area but looked very good. Bar area was very modern and price i thought was expensive untill we went into other bars in the city and noticed the prices were very much on par. about 5.00 euro a pint of beer. staff in the bar were like the rest of hotel very plesant and helpful. overall could not fault the hotel itself in any way, just the location was a slight problem, we didnt let it spoil our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of out of the way”
Reviews.Author: dkracerfl
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, new with good ammenities. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Shower pulsated very strangely, bouncing from scorching hot to ice cold about every other second. Switched rooms and it did the same (7 floors lower than the first room). Made a shower rather unpleasant. Free wireless a plus in a city where everything seems extra and overpriced. However, this hotel is really out of the way. It is geographically near Central Station, but it is really not convenient to it. The hotel is built adjacent to a commercial pier and there is absolutely nothing within walking distance. In order to get into the city center, you really have to work for it and it takes much longer. Next time I will likely stay at a hotel truly within the City Center area.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MartandSteph
Reviews.Content: I have stay in a few tacky central Amsterdam so called 4 Star hotels but this is without a doubt the best hotel in Amsterdam! The swiss chain really know how to give you a good stay for for money. We had a breathtaking view - it was hard to drag yourself away from the window! Everything was perfect here - can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “everything was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: travelolsen
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is 10min walk away from downtown Amsterdam. The staff was outstanding, and the spa facilities they have is just great. They had 2 shared sauna's for men and women, so I advice you guys to use a towel. The room was in 20th floor and overlooked the canals, an amazing breath taking view. One of the better hotels in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sms6778
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate for this hotel in Priceline. Stayed in a double room with my mother, and we both loved the beds, the bathroom and especially the view (asked for a room in the upper floors). The service was good, everybody was nice, and didn't find the location terrible, just a short straight walk to Central Station, or one tram station, or the hotel shuttle that worked just fine to us. Had their buffet breakfast the last day and, tough it was good, i think it is to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam so far - only minus the location”
Reviews.Author: supahero
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in MÃ¶venpick for several times and if you don't mind the location, it's the best hotel in Amsterdam. Stunning breakfast, clean rooms, best view to the city (if you ask for a room at the top floors), several saunas, ok gym, nice lobby bar etc. Worth of all the money!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: impcinder
Reviews.Content: Hotel was outside of the city center, easy 1 tram stop from the Centraal Station (could probably walk). Adjacent to the hotel is the new Muziekgebouw (Concert Hall) and Bimhuis (ranked the worldâ€™s fifth most well-known jazz club) and Passenger Terminal Amsterdam. Take tram 26 (Ijbourg) from Centraal Station, it's the first stop - just walk across the tracks and street. Location was easy to find, very quiet area. Room was clean, modern and comfortable. Bathroom nice layout, shower room was huge. For a center city hotel, the room was spacious. Hotel followed European towel alotment, no problem in receiving additional towel. Fast internet was available at no additional charge. Our room was on the 14th floor and had a nice view of the port. Shuttle service offered on the hour and half hour to Centraal Station, vehicle could only hold 7 people, found it easier just to take the tram. Did not eat at the hotel, did not see any restaurants or food vendors closeby. But, it was not a problem to hop the tram to Centraal Station and eat at the surrounding places or just connet to a different tram. Dam Square was an easy 15 - 20 minute stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Movenpick and Amsterbike - A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Chitown67
Reviews.Content: Due some unforeseen changes in our travel plans, we needed a hotel in Amsterdam for a couple of nights right away. We had never heard of Movenpick but it was the cheapest on the list that didn't look like a dive. So we took a chance and booked it. It turned out to be a very upscale business hotel with plenty of amenities, very well appointed rooms and excellent service all around. My only complaint would be the breakfast buffet, which is bad to say the least and expensive at â‚¬23 and should be skipped. The hotel is also about a 25 minute walk from Centraal Station, but there is also a tram station not too far. Another pleasant surprise was Amsterbike, a bike rental place in the garage right under the hotel. The rates were very reasonable (â‚¬20 for two days) and I got a nice new bike that looked like a regular Amsterdam bike, not like the usual tourist rental bike. The owner was very friendly and suggested a couple of tours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: InTheSpa
Reviews.Content: Although not located in the centre of Amsterdam, the hotel is easy to access by tram, 1/2 hourly free shuttle bus, taxi or on foot. It is only a single tram stop or EURO 7 taxi ride to Centraal. The out of town location means you get a lot more for your money- we paid about Â£110 per night which is excellent value for the facilities. We didn't have breakfast but chose to head into town. The concierge recommended an excellent place for breakfast just off Dam square. The reception and bar staff are very helpful, polite and attentive. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The bar and reception area are also well decorated, attractive spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in slightly inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really quite lovely by most US, UK or European standards and was a pleasure to stay at. The only negative was the location, but the positives far outweighed this and we would definitely stay here again. In fact we immediately booked it upon returning to Amsterdam the following week. Positives: Rooms and beds: The rooms are a great size, and well designed for comfort. We thought the beds were extremely comfortable, nice and firm â€“ rather than many of the European beds one tends to sink into and wake up with back pain. Bedding was not top of the line like some other major hotel chains, but perfectly comfortable and very clean. The window seat/couch allowing you to gaze out on the great views was very well placed. I imagine every hotel room must have a good view at this hotel. The rooms had every typical amenity â€“safe, coffee maker, complimentary water, fridge, iron. The best part for us was the extremely thick door which killed all noise from the hallway. The rooms are built to isolate you away from noise. Bathrooms: Wonderful. Thoroughly modern, with great amenities, fantastic hot water, and nice water pressure. Even better, they were always cleaned impeccably. The only thing I would change would be the towel quality. Lobby: Adequate and modern. There was ice water, apples or various treats available each day at the reception. Nice touch usually found with Moevenpick. (Now if they could get the staff to smile more....) Internet: Free wireless access in rooms! What more could one ask for! Negatives: Staff: While some of the staff were very helpful and nice most seemed cold and unfriendly. Smiling did not seem to be an option. We spent a long time arguing with one such staff member that we would not be paying an additional â€œfeeâ€� on top of our priceline fees. He was adamant in wanting to charge us a nightly fee â€œunique to Moevenpickâ€� that priceline and â€œsome customersâ€� simply â€œcannot understand.â€� The level of condescension toward us could not have been made more clear in this conversation. Needless to say, as per our priceline agreement, we did NOT pay any additional fees. Location and Access: This is really the only major flaw with this hotel. You definitely cannot walk from this hotel to central Amsterdam â€“ you must take the tram. It comes very regularly but not in front of the hotel. In fact getting to and from the tram stop was quite irritating. You have to either cross a dangerous highway-like street to get to the hotel, or use an overpass that actually takes you to another building -and because of the crazy construction obstructing the way to the front doors, you have two choices â€“ going up a long series of stairs to a platform and then down another series to get to the hotel doors, or walking all the way around the construction. Either way we always found ourselves nearly run over by the bicyclists that use this street while attempting to quickly cross it â€“ and then trying to choose the best route to the hotel. Were the other merits of this hotel less, the location issues would have caused me to give it a lower rating. It is the only reason I am not giving this hotel a rating of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Scalding Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: MuppetExpat
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I spent 3 nights in late October at the Movenpick and the view from the 14th floor was spectacular. It was our birthday celebration and they left a Best Wishes Birthday note, a box of cookies and a 72% chocolate bar for us. Very nice. The reviews here are spot on with comfort zones that will please Americans and English speakers, so I won't repeat them. Seems we heard more English than Dutch while visiting. The one down side to this visit was taking the first shower. I couldn't figure out the water spout switch between the tub and shower head. As I was bending over the faucets, I inadvertantly used the right handed control which controls the hot/cold water and not the direction of the water. What happened next is that scalding hot water fell from the shower head and burned my back and feet. My spouse had to come in and turn the water off because I was screaming in pain, nearly slipping on the wet floor from the lack of a shower curtain. It took over 30 minutes to recover from the burn and I had marks on my back the rest of the day. I don't understand why scalding water is allowed to the guest rooms or why they insist on these new fangled switches with no instructions on which way to turn them for a shower or tub filling. The second negative is that we had breakfast in the restaurant at 9am the first morning which was 23 euros each and the hot food was cold which is obscene for the price. Everything was self serve, so the price is way out of the reality of 'typical breakfast service'. We didn't return for another meal. We hope to revisit Amsterdam someday and we will probably select this hotel to stay in again only if we can get decent room rates. The prices for this hotel were way over the top but considering it is a newer hotel, I guess it's justified.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Moevenpick Standards”
Reviews.Author: Deutschlander
Reviews.Content: We had looked forward to stay there,when we arrived there was nobody to offer any help with our bags as porters seemed uninterested.Receptionist was very kind.After we were checked in,we picked up our luggage and went towards lifts and again no reaction from porters who were looking on internet.Room was nice,good quality furnishings,comfortable beds.TV had no music channels like Viva or MTV available,strange but no big deal. Internet also kept dragging and disconecting from time to time,when we called reception we were informed that there is a problem and that`s all they knew.Breakfast was good but then we noticed that following days some items were not available,and people who clear tables try to get you out of there as soon as possible.Have stayed in Movenpicks before but this one lacks the standards and passion that the rest of Movenpick hotels has.Seems like staff there has no motivation or interest I am not talking about everybody but the ones we noticed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler2000
Reviews.Content: Walk or one tram stop from the central rail station. Has free shuttle to/from train station.Over looks the water. Got it for $ 115.00 a night on Priceline. Next to cruise ship terminal. Brand new hotel in perfect condition. FREE internet and business center. Went up late and had ice cream sundae at hthe restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A real find for Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_son
Reviews.Content: Movenpick Amsterdam. 4 * rating. 4 x night weekday stay. A Hotel review is based on a personal and subjective opinion. What may be acceptable to you, may not be to me, and vice versa. Location: 5 mins from Central Station next to the Ferry Terminal. Some find it inconvenient. It really isn't, and I actually find it an advantage. Great river views from the higher floors...no city noise or drunk British people, larger modern rooms. I have stayed in many central Amsterdam Hotels, and this is my new favorite. Do as I did and rent a black granny bike for your entire stay....from Linda at STAR CYCLES, literally visible from your room window, and a 5 min walk away. There is the Hotel affilliated Yellow Cycles in the Hotel basement parking lot, but lots more Euro's and not as funky. Besides, Linda makes great coffee. Safety: Very good. This is Amsterdam. Well lit pedestrian pathway from Station to Hotel, or go one stop on Tram #26 from Central Station. It can't be easier. 8/10 Property: 20 floor modern construction. Swiss owned chain. Nice, clean, modern... oh, did I say modern? Well, it is Swiss. Check in: Good. Arrived early, but was assigned a room on arrival. Helpful international staff. Asked for, and was given high floor away from elevator etc. Great view of the passenger ferries going across to N Amsterdam, plus all the regular Euro barge traffic and river cruise ships. Bar: Enjoyed several cups of excellent coffee on morning of arrival. Restaurant menu and breakfast looked pretty god, although I didn't eat there. Extensive room service menu at reasonable (for a Hotel) prices. Room: Ahh...at last a room size comparable to the USA. Curiously a king bed, with 2 separate duvet sets. Bed is one base unit, not a euro splitter special. Good pillow choices. Mid quality sheets. Bed way too hard..... Great bathroom, sleek and modern. Towels, surprisingly threadbare. Nice personal care products. Useful sofa area under window. Shower good....had a little fun working out the bath/shower mixer tap...beware, this water is HOT. Free use In-room safe, ironing board and iron etc. Excellent in-room tea and coffee making facilities. A great touch. An empty fridge for all your room swag ! More kudos ....can it get better ? ....yes, read on. Could do with a flat screen tv upgrade. Tons of CNN/Bloomberg stuff but english speaking channels a bit limited. 500 satellite channels available for eurox5 per day. Internet: Free wifi in room and public areas. At last a Hotel that recognizes that wifi is essential today, and does not abuse their customers with ridiculous overcharging for puny 11mbs connections masquerading as broadband. That in itself will keep business amd tourist travelers alike coming back. WTG Movenpick! 9/10 Conclusion: An unexpected impressive experience. Lots of facilities including a Gym and a Sauna at no extra charge. Its the attitude that counts. No nickel and diming, and a genuinely positive experience. Stay again? Yes. US Rating: Solid 4* Value: Good $$$ 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic in almost all aspects”
Reviews.Author: wupohan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Moevenpick hotel for 6 nights in October. We agree that the hotel experience is one of the highlights of our exciting trip. We give it a 4.5 stars rating, not a 5, for some minor flaws. Pros: 1. Hotel and Room: The hotel is new unlike many other hotels in Amsterdam. The contemporary design of the hotel building together with its neighboring Muziekgebouw (Music Hall) makes a new landmark. The room is coherently designed also with minimalist concepts. The hotel is built by the water and each room has a beautiful water view through a large window. Its washroom is roomy. I however find its 1/4" frosty glass washroom door with no lock an odd idea. 2. Foods and Room Service: Its Silk Road restaurant offers excellent dining experience. But if you are lazy like we were, do not miss its room service. It has an extensive menu. The food is excellent, especially the deserts - hands down! 3. Service: The staff is polite and genuinely helpful and seems always available when you need them. There also is training staff on site in hotel's exercise room. All phone requests are nicely handled by knowledgeable staff. 4. Location: It takes 15 minutes to walk to the Central Station, which takes you to the airport in another 20 minutes. It's convenient for those stay for a short period of time. It's neighboring "Music Hall" offers frequent music events (up to 4 events a day) covering classical, jazz and "world/folk". The Concertgebouw, which is quite distant from the hotel, often offers more interesting musical alternatives. Cons: 1. TV and TV Programming: Its TV is very small. It's difficult to enjoy movies (10 Euro each) on such a small screen. The hotel offers about 32 channels in 8 languages. English speakers get CNN world, BBC world, Bloomberg Channel and MSNBC world only. 2. Location: For those who love to stroll in the city, it might be wise to pick a hotel in the city centre. It takes 15 minutes to walk to the Central Station and might take another half an hour just to get to the Dam Square. The hotel however offers free shuttle services to the Central Station by request. There are also two tram (street car - 1.6 Euro per zone per person) lines that have stops near the hotel. 3. Gym: Its gym is more like an exercise room. It has fancy equipment and dumbbells up to 10kg. Bodybuilders will not find this facility useful. 4. Price: Moevenpick Hotel is expensive, but all good hotels in Amsterdam are expensive. I've stayed in a few hotels at the same price range. Moevenpick Amsterdam is by far the best by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: EaganTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Movenpick Amsterdam hotel in mid-October. Previous reviews of this hotel are spot on. If you arrive at Central Station and plan to walk to the hotel, exit out the back (towards the water), cross the road and turn right. You will see the hotel as you take a leisurely (10-15 minute) walk along the water. If you plan on taking the 25 tram, exit the front of the station and turn left. Tram 25 departs from the end of the station. We found it easier to disembark the tram at the second stop (going past the hotel) as you did not need to cross the road or walk the ramp. Also, the hotel runs a shuttle service to the station every thirty minutes (hour and half hour) dropping off at the loading area at the back of the station. This is by request and it does not operate if no one is coming from the hotel, but we were able to catch a ride back to the hotel by waiting for the shuttle one day. Definitely use the shuttle to the station as an alternative to walking or the tram. Tram tickets are good for two hours. The staff at this hotel is superb. Very friendly, willing to assist with any questions and there is an adequate number of people in the lobby. We arrived early (8:00am) and knew our room was not ready. The cordial desk clerk gave us keys to the fitness center so we could shower, change clothes and then check our luggage prior to heading into the city. Stopped back after 3:00 pm and our room was ready for us on the 17th floor. Our room overlooked the city and harbor. Marvelous view with boats coming and going, cruise ships docking and the lights of the city. We enjoyed a bottle of wine, great Dutch cheese and crackers in the room each evening just to take in the view. As others have mentioned, the rooms are basic but comfortable. In room safe, refrig, tea and coffee packets provided. Nice size modern bathroom with tub/shower. I still am trying to figure out the crazy half glass shower wall as each time I used the shower the bathroom floor ended up wet. Could use an upgrade on the locker room quality towels. Bed was comfortable but surprised there were no mattress pads. Duvets were o.k. Heat/AC is easily controlled on wall thermostat. TV had many stations in Dutch but a few English speaking stations as well. Lobby has two free computers with internet connections and printer for those who do not want to haul a laptop. Spent our time visiting sites in Amsterdam, a day trip to Harlem (great/charming city) and walking the canals. If you want a great dining experience, have the staff make a reservation at the Fifteen restaurant. Fifteen is located in walking distance from the hotel and was started by Jamie Oliver, The Naked Chef, in late 2004. Fun environment, great food and wine and pleasant young staff. Overall, we would highly recommend the Movenpick to anyone looking for a nice hotel, close to the city central with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fibo74
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, go for the executive room if possible. Friendly staff, great breakfast and close to the centre of Amsterdam but far enough away for a restful nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Movepick!”
Reviews.Author: leenNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Movenpick Amsterdam for 3 nights in September. We arrived late on a Sunday evening (due to Eurostar & IC train delays), but I had emailed the hotel in advance and late check in was not a problem. We booked our room through Priceline (got a great rate) and I requested a room with a nice view. We had a great view from our 16th floor room. The hotel was very clean and modern (and quiet). Our room was well furnished and we enjoyed that the mini-fridge was empty so that we could put things in it (they will stock it with products for sale at your request). A complementary bottle of water was provided each day, and there were coffee and tea making equipment in the room. The hotel room was larger than the other hotels we stayed with during our holiday in Europe. There were lots of hangers, etc for clothes, an in-room safe, and corkscrew provided as well. We ordered room service one night, which was reasonably priced and arrived very quickly (no additional service charge). We also had a drink in the hotel bar one night as well, which was very nice. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, so I can't comment on that. We found it to be about a 10 minute walk from Central Station. In the mornings, we booked the shuttle to the station and would then walk back later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - slightly off pitch for a city break”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghEuan
Reviews.Content: Modern and clean hotel. Our room was large with fantastic views of the city - great value for money. We stayed for two nights and the hotel had everything that we required. The staff were friendly and helpful (particularly booking restuarants). Our only criticism was the location - you felt slightly out of the way as we were there for a city break. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Central Station but it is a boring walk along the side of a busy road. Central station itself is about another 10minutes from many of the tourist areas. Central station has a good left luggage area and so you can leave your bags on the day you check out. Movenpicks are good modern hotels and this is no exception - it is just a shame about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: Martin68
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews on tripadvisor, I was really looking forward to my short one-night stay at Movenpick but came away disappointed. The location wasn't a problem but realistically it is a 15 minute walk rather than 10 from the station and if you're dragging a suitcase, you might want to reconsider the healthy option. The check in process was friendly and efficient. My booking request for a high floor had been noted and I was given a room on the 16th floor. No cruise ship in dock that night unfortunately but really amazing views. The room was absolutely top notch, just beautiful. Really nicely designed, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was equally impressive apart from the strange lack of washcloths and an extractor fan that whistled constantly like a haunted house. I used the (very welcome) free wi-fi and it seemed to work fine. I slept well and woke up to a beautiful sunrise over the river. So far, pretty good but now for the bad part. Breakfast was included in my room rate and what happened in the restaurant totally soured the entire experience. Without doubt it was the worst service I've ever had in a 4 star hotel. I arrived at 0930 and it was not busy but seemed very disorganised. The range of food and quality couldn't be faulted. The tables were not laid properly so I had to ask for cutlery. I'd been been sat and eating for 10 minutes but not one of the three waiting staff had offered me coffee. Again I had to ask. I had to ask again for a refill (have NEVER had that in any hotel, the waiters are usually falling over themselves to top your cup up). All the time I was there, I didn't see any of the waiters instigate any communication with the diners. Everything had to be asked for. But this is the strangest thing - 20 mins before the end of breakfast service, there was a sudden flurry of activity and the staff started to lay all the tables! They must have laid for about 40 covers when there was only maybe 5 people that came through the door in that time. Unfortunately they didn't even do it properly so a man opposite sat down and had a coffee mug and placemat but had to awkwardly ask for some cutlery. It really was an amazing shambles. So to sum up, a very nice hotel very seriously let down by a complete lack of service in the restaurant. A great shame.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of problems, especially with service”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights post-cruise, and the stay ended up being a very long nightmare. The only advantage I saw to this place is that if you come post-cruise, it's right next door to the cruise terminal. Its location is otherwise a problem. The nearest place of interest, the train station, is a 15-minute walk. The hotel charges 25 Euro for breakfast (yikes!), and there's nothing within close reach. Well, for two of the mornings, we went to station and bough sandwiches for 2 Euro or less. There is a tour boat, but since it comes only every 40 minutes, it's not very practical (and really only serves as a slow leisurely tour). The best that I can say for the place is that it was clean. We got two thin hand towels and two thin bath towels--not even any washcloths! You have to leave your key in the room for the A/C or heat to work, so there was no way to avoid walking into a stuffy room every day. The wireless worked intermittently. Despite being outside the main part of town, it wasn't that quiet because the hotel is near train tracks against which the train wheels squeal as they come into the station. But our biggest nightmare was the service. Since our ship came in the morning, we had to leave our luggage in storage. Some dufus put my carry-on back on the ship, despite the name on our tags (which also had the earlier sailing date)! As horrible as that was, I'm not as upset by the stupid mistake as by the hotel employees' response to it. When I asked them to attempt to locate the bags by calling the ship, they told me they were forbidden by Dutch law to call the ship, and they only contacted port authorities who claimed they couldn't find the bag--a preposterous claim since the bag had my name and former cabin number on it. All the help I received came from the cruise line, whom I had to contact myself (they did locate the bag, of course--although it was on its way to Norway). The bag had my medication (and travelers' checks, reading glasses, and other stuff). Although none of them were controlled substances, the hotel said they couldn't replace it, claiming "Dutch law" prevented them from doing so, and only offered to have me waste a day going to a doctor and a pharmacy myself (I decided to suffer for the sake of my traveling companion). The management even refused to write a letter explaining the situation so that I could make a claim with my travel insurance company. All the manager could ever say was "I'm sorry, but there's nothing we can do," although I finally said at one point "You could offer us breakfast on our last day," which he seemed taken aback by but did oblige. Even a week after we got back, the hotel refused to contact us to confirm they had sent the bag back. What information I received came from the cruise company, whose helpfulness was a sharp contrast to the hotel's. Would it have killed them to take 60 seconds to let us know by responding to my e-mail that they received the bag, and give us a tracking code? Without cooperation from the hotel, I wasn't even able to get refunds on my American Express travelers' checks--which came in three weeks after our return. If you click on my screen name, you'll see that I'm a very seasoned traveler with lots of reviews to my name, and I very rarely give a hotel 2 dots. I have Gold status with Hilton and Starwood, and Platinum with the Intercontinental Hotel Group. There are times when traveling that unforseen unfortunate events happen, and this is when a hotel can show its true colors. Shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Super impressed---Outskirts of City Centre”
Reviews.Author: AllieandJerry
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a 5/5 if it weren't so isolated. The hotel was clean, and very nice. The view of the harbor was very pretty. The staff was some of the best I experienced in Amsterdam. The rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. Wireless internet is free. (Most 4-5 stars are charging 19-22 Euros for 24 hour access. This is definitely a bonus.) The room had a flat screen TV and refrigerator. ~~Even though Movenpick is technically in the City Centre, it is on the outskirts of it. It is kind of isolated, so activities require a bit more planning, and knowledge of tram system. That is really my only complaint--one has to catch a tram or a cab to do anything. ~~A cab to Leidseplein is about 10 Euro. Your best bet is to use the tram. It operates all over city until midnight. It is a ten minute walk from Central station. ~~HINT: Buy Tram pass at Central Station. (There is a 24 hour option, punch card or week long option. Use it right away to get to hotel.) Take # 25 tram to "Passenger Terminal" from Central Station and you only have to walk about 1-2 minutes to hotel. ~~If you are trying to get into town, the 25 is your best bet. (26 is also option.) The 25 goes through Central Station, but you don't have to get off. Dam Square is only 2 tram stops from this hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, and am planning on returning this year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the moevenpick”
Reviews.Author: stephers84
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! It was clean, the staff were helpful, we had a great view of the harbor etc. It's a ten min walk from central station, (take the back exit and take a right you can see the hotel from there!) there are also bike hire places and a canalbus stop outside the hotel. The rooms were large and very clean with tea and coffee making facilities, a good safe, a fridge, an iron and ironing board, the beds were comfortable too. Overall a very good holiday. The only thing that let it down was the restaurant, the food was okay but the service was very slow (although it wasn't busy) and we didn't receive all our order. Also it was 23 euro per person per day for breakfast!! We bought some bananas from the local shop lol

Reviews.Title: “clean and New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momokee
Reviews.Content: This is a very new hotel, it is a non-smoking hotel, which was pleasant. The location is very close to the center, tram way is outside the hotel about 1 mins walk, and there is a bike hire place on the basement of the hotel which was very convenient as cycling is one of the easiest way to get around Amsterdam in the day or at night. The room is very big and the toilet is state of the art. Only complain is the free wifi is on the slow side of things. The buffet was really good, and the dinner at the restaurant is nice with very nice view of the river and the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - limited communication”
Reviews.Author: BrickBikkit
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay on the phone directly with the hotel as we wanted to book a special summer package. I was not able to book this online. On arrival the staff had my reservation but had not prepared the package for us - a special room rate that included 3 nights accomodation, IAMsterdam cards for 24hrs, evening meal on the first night, and breakfast for the duration of the stay. I had to give the reception staff a copy of what the package included - fortunately I had printed this from the Movenpick website. We encountered a few other issues during the first day of our stay - getting a reservation for our evening meal (which they lost), being refused entry to breakfast on the first morning, and a few minor inconveniences. I took my complaints to reception, who were appologetic and helpful. We had no further problems, and a bottle of wine was delivered to our room with a nice 'sorry' note. The hotel itself is clean, modern, and well looked after. We enjoyed our stay. It is a bit of a trek to town, but quiet and very safe. I wouldn't reccomend anyone try to walk to the hotel from the station with their bags - a shuttlebus is available (phone the concierge to arrange), and it is not as near as it looks! If you are going by Air, take the train from the airport to Centraal station, then a shuttlebus or tram 25 or 26 (stop at Bimhuis Musikegebaum or the cruiseship terminal next door) to get to the hotel - expensive airport transfers are a bit unneccessary if you have luggage you can manage.

Reviews.Title: “Bad manners and unable to give a solution”
Reviews.Author: PedroSS_2008
Reviews.Content: We had a very sad and disappointing experience in this hotel. We booked a room for three adults, as it is specified in the reservation form from the hotel when booking. Of course, it is presumed a minimum of comfortability for the three people in the room, but it was a sad surprise when we arrived and the bed for two people was fine, as expected, nut not the third one. We already knew that the third person had to sleep in a sofa bed but we could not imagine that such "bed" was in fact a plank with a very thin mattress!! It was so surprising that I took pictures of it. We explained to the person in the front desk that it was really impossible to sleep there. The only reply (with very very bad manners) was that some people had complained about this issue before but this was not a major problem, according to this employee. We asked to talk to the managing director: he went with us to the room and he recognized that the sofa bed is not suitable to sleep. But the only solution given was either put another mattress of the same thickness (obviously it was not a solution), or to pay 80 euros for upgrading to a junior suite. Finally we had to be reallocated in another hotel, of lower category and far from the city center. We consider defrauded by Moevenpick, since this is not the service you expect of a 4-star hotel. One more thing: we asked for an official complaining form but they rejected to give it, they said that with a blank sheet of paper was enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Liko1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for a few days and they all agreed with me that this hotel was wonderful. The combination of the modern design, the many amenities and the friendly staff make this a great hotel. Here's my breakdown: Check in: Was smooth and quick. They spoke excellent English which made it more comfortable for me. The card key is required to operate the elevator which puzzled me at first because I didn't know it required it. Some other guests I ran into also had the same difficulties. I guess it's for security reasons. Hotel: A relatively new hotel so expect it to be modern. Includes a bar, restaurant, gym, sauna and conference rooms. A business centre is available free of charge to guests on the main floor. The lobby has comfy couches, a flat screen displaying the news and a screen displaying train information from central station. A nice touch. Rooms: I can't say enough about these rooms. Again, you need the card key to turn on the electricity in the room. A great idea to prevent wasting electricity. The design of the room is a modern one. Rooms offer a safe, fridge, bottled water and all other amenities expected. Take a look at the photos on this site to get a better idea. The glass door to the bathroom does not fully close or lock (twin rooms). The beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows. One neat thing they offer is a variety of different pillows that may better suit your needs. Call the guest services and you can receive a different pillow. View from the room was good too. A cruise ship docked next door and was quite nice to look at. Location: This is the only part about the hotel that did not exceed my expectations. Located on the harbour, about 10 - 15 mins walking from central station. The area surrounding it has close to no shops or restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel has made available a shuttle service that runs every 30 mins to the central station that was very convenient for me and my family. Getting back depends on preference. People can arrange a pickup around the same time the shuttle makes the round to the station, or the can take the tram (#26). I took the tram each time to get back and it took 1.60 euros and 5 mins of my time. Taxi is a more costly option. A great alternative is to rent a bike. I think there is a rental spot in front of the hotel. Most (about half) of people in Amsterdam ride bikes because it is the most effective way to get around. Staff: The people who work there are true professionals in the hotel industry. They were always courteous and helpful when approached. Staff were top notch, especially those at the concierge. Conclusion:This is a great hotel for almost anyone. If you can get a good price then it is definitely worth it. During rainy days we looked forward to heading back to the hotel. The location is not great but there are many options available to get back and forth. This hotel made our stay in Amsterdam that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: D3n50n
Reviews.Content: A real hotel in Amsterdam city centre. I was really impressed. The previous reviews say it all. The only complaint is that you have to walk 10 mins to the front of the station or catch a tram before you hit any cafes, bars etc. as there is little in the immediate area and access to the city centre is obstructed by the railway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buttons2008Ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean, with spacious rooms/bathrooms and very friendly staff. The service in the bar and restaurant was a bit on the slow side but we soon learnt that most places in Amsterdam were like this! As other reviewers have stated the location of the hotel is a bit of a walk from the city center - about 10 minutes. But in my opinion worth the extra bit of a walk! Or use the shuttle bus (drop off at Central Station) or alternatively the canal bus also has a stop alongside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: liales
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel because we were sailing on a cruise departing from Amsterdam, the cruise terminal is next door. Excellent choice for that pourpose, but a bit too far from the City center and the Museums. Would recommend it for people taking cruises, or with a busy work agenda; it is very comfortable for its price.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: eylon
Reviews.Content: The hotel's summer promotion proposed 4 nights in an executive room at 586 euros breakfast included. We were given a large and modern room on the 20th floor with great view on the harbor. As many reviews indicate, the hotel is very modern and has all modern facilities needed. It is a 20 minutes walk from the central station (those who say 10 must be quick walkers) but there's a free shuttle every 30 minutes however often overbooked) and also frequent tramway located 100 meters from the hotel. Breakfast is excellent. The only defaults I may state are the lack of clarity of the reservation message (price doesn't include city taxes) and the inability to use a cheap operator to call abroad (this number must be blocked by the hotel) which is meant to forces customer to use the hotel phone which is 30 times more expensive (1 euro per minute instead of 3 cents). I believe this is illegal! However the overall note is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, unconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Vlod71
Reviews.Content: Business trip in July, I stayed one night at the Movenpick. The room was a superior room with a beautiful view of the city and the bay. The room was very nice, with king-bed, very comfortable pillows and wireless internet service. Buffet breakfast was good and well assorted. The only negative point is the location of the hotel, that is not in the center of the city, but I did not care that much because I was in Amsterdam just for work. Anyway, the hotel offers free shuttle service for the train station (each 30min). Probabily I would choose another more central hotel for a holiday trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: BridieBrady
Reviews.Content: We have just had a superb stay at the Moevenpick. The rooms were spotless and the staff were very friendly and efficient. We had breakfast included in our rate and there was a huge choice available. We also had some snacks in the bar which were very good and well priced. It was a pleasant 10 minute stroll to the hotel from the station even though I am not a fast walker and like to look around and enjoy the views. I was really pleased that I hadn't booked one of the hotels close to Dam Square which I had been considering. Amsterdam is a beautiful city with lots of gorgeous areas, but Dam Square and the streets immediately adjacent had a really downbeat feel (and appearance) and I was glad that we weren't staying near there. The Moevenpick was beautifully situated and the views from our 19th floor rooms were stunning. We enjoyed getting around town using the Canal Bus which has a departure point right across from the hotel entrance, and we also did a lot of walking which was great in such a flat city! For dinner, we asked the concierge for recommendations, and had some lovely meals out at the restaurants suggested. One thing that may be helpful is that if you get the train into Centraal from the airport, you need to leave the station using the exit that says Noord, then turn right, and you will see the sign for the hotel. If you go out of the main exit it is a bit more tricky to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far Away to Walk!”
Reviews.Author: BijouxButtercup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just one night on our way out of town. The location of this hotel is behind the central station along the river. It is a beautiful hotel and the rooms were nice and large and modern. The staff was terrific as well. The location is not great for anyone planning on spending some time in Amsterdam as a tourist. You can walk into town but it is at least 10 minutes just to Dam Square. And while Amsterdam is a safe city, I would not feel comfortable as a solo female alone at night walking in that area. Another drawback is that there aren't a lot of eating options. There is only one restaurant and it's a more formal, asian themed place. The bar does serve small bites but those are the options unless you leave the hotel. Being very tired from a long trip we weren't interested in walking any distance for dinner.The breakfast was incredible. There are hotels in the same category much more centrally located. IF! however you're booked on a cruise, this would be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place”
Reviews.Author: justanothaday
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of July. We were very much looking forward to our stay and we were most definitely not disappointed with the hotel. We arrived at about 11am (thinking we were unable to check in til 2ish) hoping to leave our luggage in the hotel. However they let us check in immediately, which was fantastic as it meant we could have a much needed sleep! The hotel was modern and well furnished. It was very clean and we had no complaints about anything. The use of a fridge was good for storing cold drinks etc. The only slight hindrance I would mention with regards to the Moevenpick is that it is a bit out of the way of shops. I mean, Central station is about a 15 minute walk away, but it would be beneficial to have a small shop near the place or something. Despite this, the location had it's perks. It was close to centraal station and because of this when coming out of the station on our first day and trying to look for the hotel we had no problems as the big MOEVENPICK letters were obvious! Overall I would recommend this hotel, it was everything we hoped for and more really. I would go back again anytime. The views were fantastic and watching the boats was pretty interesting. :)

Reviews.Title: “High specification and comfortable hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: JohnWDarlington
Reviews.Content: This is a very high specification and comfortable hotel, but we had a couple of niggles. The hotel is situated just a bit too far from the centre of Amsterdam to have easy access, which is what we want from a city centre stay. Also, horrified by the cost of breakfast. Often one does not want much, say a juice, coffee, roll and croissant. There was no alternative but to pay for a full breakfast, at a very high price, which would add almost a third to the room rate for 2 people. Apparently there is a cheaper breakfast available for some guests, but not us, which rather adds insult to injury! We used the cafe under the concert hall next door and had very adequate breakfasts for less than half the hotel price. It opens every day at 10am. and has spectacular views over the river. We found out, by chance, that there was a half-hourly hotel mini bus service to the central station which was invaluable and, if we had known, would have saved us a rip-off taxi fare from the station when we arrived. This service operates from about 7am until around 10pm. Operated by a very helpful concierge desk in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: hmsoapy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Moevenpick through Expedia and got a very reasonable deal. The rooms were modern and clean and I really couldn't fault anything about the hotel. It is about a 10 minute walk from Centraal Station, but there is a tram line right across from the hotel and also one of the hop on, hop off boat cruises stops infront of the hotel too which is very handy! The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is also a complimentary mini bus shuttle service to the hotel from Centraal Station, but you need to contact the hotel and book it before you arrive in Amsterdam. This is one of the things we didn't know, so ended up walking with all our luggage. :-)

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel For 4 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: phaagen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my 2 daughters Thursday- Sunday. Got a good price through Hotel Connect. Everything I had read about the hotel was true: Friendly interested staff, nice large spotlessly clean rooms(we had a triple room with modern amenities), ok Fitness, great breakfast buffet, quiet location with nice view of the harbour and the city - but not more than 5 -10 mins walk to the centre, excellent shuttle service. The only minuses I can think off was: Slow cleaning up of the breakfast room when the hotel was full, but don't let that stop you from going - THE HOTEL WAS GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: n00btraveller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a great price. Payed $140 US taxes in. The service and room were excellent. The decor in the room was especially good. The restaurant in the lobby has great daily specials fro 12.5 euro and there is a free shuttle to the trainstation. Staff in the restaurant were especially friendly and very helpful. Which is about a 15min walk otherwise. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Phool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while our daughter played soccer in the area and found this hotel modern, clean and the staff very helpful. There is a 10 min walk to Central Station, but a tram stops right out side the hotel. We booked through Expedia at around $120/day which I thought was a decent value. All in all we really enjoyed our experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: SunchaserPriorLake
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect jumping off point for our cruise to Norway. It literally shares the same space on the water as the cruise ship making it as easy as it gets to start a cruise. Upon arrival at Central Station, we walked about 15 minutes with our suitcases along the water to the hotel. Being careful to watch out for bicycles it's an easy walk for most people. We were greeted professionally at the front desk and check-in was very smooth. The hotel itself was excellent. The room was large and bright with a fantastic 16th floor view of all the water traffic, looking back toward the central station. There are free computers in the lobby area which allow you to easily check email etc. Another nice touch was mineral water at the front desk. We stayed two nights, using the hotel as a base for our walking trips to various parts of Amsterdam. We love to walk, but for those who prefer other modes of transportation there is a tram stop right outside the hotel. All in all this hotel was the equal to the nicer Hyatts etc. that we use in the US and is run in a typically efficient Swiss manner.

Reviews.Title: “good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Tuuli
Reviews.Content: We got good price trough Priceline; 115 USD = EUR 84 with taxes and fees. Hotel is totally non smoking, modern; rooms are spacious and have clean with firm beds. We asked for a room on upper floors, 12th floor was the highest they had available. Views were good. Hotel is right next to the passenger terminal, 10 min walk from Central station. There is a tram stop about 3 minutes walk from the hotel door and also complimentary shuttle every 30 minutes. Didn't use restaurants, bars, sauna or other amenities except complimentary internet and printer downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome decor and views!”
Reviews.Author: flaii
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Movenpick. It was slightly far from the city center - even though only a 15 minute walk to Central Station, keep in mind that Amsterdam is a city where it only takes 15 minutes to cross from Central Station on the north side of city center, to the south! So 15 min walk is sort of a while. There is a shuttle to the station if you can plan in advance (need to reserve, although the times that I took it I was the only passenger!). In the near term, it is very convenient to the Stedelijk Museum CS, the temporary location of the Stedelijk. The hotel is only about a 5 minute walk to it. The hotel is really gorgeous inside, with an awesome bathroom. The bathroom was bright, clean, and contemporary without being unnecessarily trendy. I asked for a nice view and got an awesome one. I could see the trains, trams, boats, and planes of the city, plus all of Amsterdam city center (that should also give you an idea of the distance to the tourist parts of Amsterdam). Sometimes I just felt like sitting in my room, admiring the view, rather than touring the city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashlyn2
Reviews.Content: This was the first night of a European coach trip and was the best hotel we stayed in. It was very modern and clean with a great bathroom. The view out the window in the morning of a large cruise ship passing by was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - No Disappointments Here”
Reviews.Author: KerrytheBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Moevenpick in Amsterdam for 3 nights. He had travelled from Australia and I met him off the back of a trip I was having in Paris. We both were thrilled with the room we were given (ask for a harbour view) and the windows were able to be opened for fresh air! Yes. The service at the Moevenpick was absolutely fantastic - not once were we disappointed. The shuttle bus into town was there for anytime with just a little notice and the staff were full of great information. The restaurants and bars were great and everything gets a full thumbs up from us.

Reviews.Title: “A Near Perfect Pre and Post Cruise Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: This is a new, clean, modern, non-smoking hotel adjacent to the Cruise Passenger Terminal. It is not downtown but it is close to it. There were many nice free touches in the room including a fridge, safe, wine glasses, tea/coffee and a bottle of water. We enjoyed the "menu" of different pillow types, view of the river, free internet in the business centre and apples or water when checking in. The hotel was relatively quiet as compared to hotels closer to the city centre. We did however hear faint rumblings from the numerous trains across the street. The highlight of our stay was the super friendly and helpful concierge service - at all times a concierge was both visible and available. For us, they reserved and operated the half hourly shuttle to Centraal Station, provided luggage storage and advised on travel times to the airport. They were always happy and spoke perfect English. Do not be put off by the distance from Centraal Station. It is either a pleasant 10 to 15 minute walk along the river, a free hotel shuttle ride away or a 3 minute tram ride. It is not difficult at all to take the train from Schipol airport and get to the hotel with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hg4ever
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and I would recommand everyone to stay there. Good location, great staff, great room and everything is great there. Just one tram station away from the Central Station. The view to the river and the city center is GREAT! I can't ask for more from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: guitargal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five fantastic nights at the Moevenpick. The hotel is beautiful, very clean, and quite comfortable. The room had all the amenities and overlooked the water. We even watched the sun set from our hotel window! The king bed was very comfortable, as were the down pillows and covers. I loved the location. We were able to walk (ten minutes) to/from Centraal Station as well as walk into the city. It was nice leaving the city noise behind at night. We also ate at the restaurant (twice for breakfast and once for dinner) and the food was delicious. Staff was very helpful and courteous. I loved that there were free computers for the guests in the lobby, too. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamtpo
Reviews.Content: Getting to the Movenpick took a little effort, but was not a problem for me. You can take tram 26 (right in front of Centraal Station) or tram 25 (across the street from the south east corner of Centraal Station). Trams run about every 15 minutes so if you miss one there can be a bit of a wait. Trams take about 3 minutes to get there. They stop right in front of the hotel (1st stop after CS), but there is a canal in between so you have to make about a 2.5 minute walk around it to get to hotel entrance. I timed the walk from centraal station and it took 9 minutes at a brisk pace. For reference, the hotel is almost exactly the same distance from Centraal Station as Dam Square is. The walk was scenic but windy and cold at this time of year. The hotel staff are great and I was always treated with a friendly smile. I was given a standard room on the 8th floor. It had a great city view (facing west). It was very quiet, and I did not hear any noise from the other rooms, outside traffic, or cruise ships. The room itself was very clean and in good condition. It was larger than I have generally experienced in other European hotels. Large bathroom, couch, and desk. I could not get the WiFi or Ethernet internet to work, but did not follow up with this to the staff as I did not really care. TV had probably about 25 channels that came in with good reception. Mattress was VERY comfortable - felt like the Hyatt mattresses. I booked through Priceline and got the rate at $150 a night. I did not try the resturants on site. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will try to stay here again on my next trip to A'dam!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: peanut13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a short walk from the train station, it does not look anything special from the out side just a tall glass building, but when you walk through the door you are greeted by polite staff who couldn't do enough for us. when we got to our room the pull out bed was not made and we had feather pillows which one of the party is allergic to but we spoke to the reception and by the time we got back up stairs the pull up was being made and the pillows were changed. The rooms had a lovely view over the river and the city, the room and en suite were nicely decorated and more than we required. I am a ceoliac so require gluten free food so we went to the restaurant and spoke to the manager who knew what the condition was and went straight to the kitchen when he came back he told us they would be able to adapt most of the meals on the menu for me and bread had been ordered in for me and would be there by morning. we did not ask for this and it was greatly appreciated. we would definitely recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you want quality, service, location and style”
Reviews.Author: Erin100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three-day break and it was great. Whilst the previous reviews are mainly positive, there are some comments about the distance and also the apparant "'lack of toilets'' on ground floor near to the bar. The toilets were actually located next to the hotel reception on the ground floor!!!! Firstly, the hotel excelled in the usual 4 star quality and service you would expect from a recently constructed hotel. The hotel's website certainly lived up to all its expectations when we arrived. It was clean, modern and the staff were so friendly with a strong focus on customer service and genuinely making you feel welcome. The breakfast selection was fantastic with a range to suit all tastes and diets. We dined in the restaurant on two occasions and the choice of menu was good and the food was really nice. It was pretty resonable priced with the average main course around 17 euros. In terms of location, it is right on the harbour with excellent views across the city. We had a 19th floor room with a river/city view and it was breathtaking. It was a fifteen min walk to the city or if you fancied the tram (located directly outside) then it was 3 minutes with a tram stopping at the hotel every 5 mins. I would definitely recommend it - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay--I'd give it a solid 8 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Sluggo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Easter weekend, as Amsterdam was the only place we could think of in Europe that would still have most stores and attractions open over the holidays. We booked the hotel on Priceline about a month in advance, using [--] to give us an idea of what price we could get. At 85 Euros per night over a holiday weekend, we thought this was quite lucky...I saw the prices just before the weekend, and they were several times as much. The Moevenpick is easy to get to from Centraal Station. The easiest way is simply to walk. Head East from the station and follow the coast...the Moevenpick looks just like the picture on its website, and is very easy to spot once you hit the harbor. The second thing to do is to take the #25 (to PTA) or #26 (to IJBurg) tram and get off at the first stop. These trams run every 15 minutes apiece and stop in front of the hotel. However, since there is a canal in between the tram line and the hotel, you'll have to walk an awkward route for another 5 minutes to get there. The staff at the Moevenpick were very friendly. We arrived 2 hours before our 3 pm check-in and they gave us a room. The hotel is only 2 years old, so it has a very modern look with great furniture. The rooms were very clean and quiet. They were also larger than any 'standard' room I had stayed in while in Amsterdam. A few pluses and minuses: PLUSES --Location. Its away from the action, so its very quiet. As I'm no longer in my 20's and out for a raucous time, this was a plus. If you catch the tram as it pulls into Centraal Station, you're just minutes away from the hotel. --Elevators. Amazingly fast and efficient. A minor thing that was a nice touch. --Staff. Really seemed to go out of their way to be friendly. Alex and Mohammad, in particular, were a credit to Moevenpick. --Shuttle. They have a shuttle van that goes to Centraal every 30 minutes. If you're going there, you need to sign up, as they only have 8 spaces per trip. If you're getting picked up, there usually isn't a need to sign up. If you happen to be leaving the hotel at the top of the hour, its very convenient. --Non-smoking. The entire hotel was non-smoking, which we both personally liked. MINUSES --Location. Its away from the action, so its very quiet. As I was trying to pretend I was in my 20's again, this was a double-edged sword. --Phone assistance. I had to call the Front Desk a few times during my stay, and each time it took at least 15 rings for someone to answer. They need more dedicated staff. --No robes, and the towels were pretty flimsy. Invest in better towels, Moevenpick! Overall, it was a very nice stay and I would return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Rouen_Lover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Movenpick for 4 nights in March 2008. I had a room made for 2 (two twin beds pushed together) but it is perfect for 1 person. There was a closet but no place to truly store your clothing. Loved the super modern bathroom which was a good size. The bed was a little stiff and hard, but I got over that pretty easily. I was very happy to find the room had a small refrigerator. There was no place close by as an alternative to eating in the hotel restaurant, so the frig came in handy if you wanted to bring and keep your own water, juice and snacks. My room was on the 10th floor which gave me a wonderful view of the IJ. However, it is a bit away from the action of Amsterdam. The hotel provided a shuttle to Centrale Station every hour (depending on if they had enough gas for the van) or if there is enough space. I called to have the van pick me up and was told they had no gas. 20 minutes later while trying to hail a cab, the van driver waves at me from a stop light - and keeps heading back toward the hotel. It costs 8 Euro to cab from Centrale Station but tram line 26 will put you about 5 minutes walking away from the hotel for 1.60 Euro. Outside of those options, you can walk to the hotel from the train station in about 20 minutes. I felt safe and very comfortable at this hotel and would stay again if I can get the same EXCELLENT rate thru Priceline (less than $150 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: knocklofty
Reviews.Content: Hotel close to Central Station. Rooms clean and well kept. Large and comfortable bed good size room. Bathroom large with large shower. Views from upper floor rooms gives a great panorama of the city. Breakfast was a good hot and cold buffet. Travel from airport by train was quick cheap and efficient. Trams easy to use and tram 25 & 26 leave you outside the hotel. Work on a new bit of canel outside the hotel meant a slightly longer walk but tram to pier terminal (Stay on Pier Terminal tram to line end just past the hotel as you do not have to cross the road) was slightly closer. Canel boats pick up is close to hotel and was worth the day ticket. Transport day(S)Travel pass is cheap and worth the cost even if only used several times as walking covers the city easily. Tram stop from Central Station to pier terminal was hard to find due to construction work outside central station ask for help it is near the bus station. Loved Amsterdam and the hotel was great for our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but I'll never go back”
Reviews.Author: grillettoparlante
Reviews.Content: I spent a long week-end in Amsterdam staying in this Hotel. It was my fault not to have checked before that the hotel was a 100% NO SMOKING structure and clients themselves could be fined of 150 euros if smoking, even inside their own rooms. That fact, even if didn'nt affect me, as I am a no-smoker, drove my wife close to a hysterical crisis as she is used to have a cigarette when she wakes up and before going to bed. Even if I understand that it is my fault, still I think that it sounds strange not to have care for the "poor smokers" in the in city of the red light district, of free drugs, homosexual weddings and a long tradition of tollerance. A second problem was the the duvets were synthetic and this fact ended up with a erythema. The girl at the concierge understood immediatly the reason of my problem and I had duvets changed with no-synthetic ones. But, I ask, if they know that that fact can give problems, why they do not put no-synthetic duvets from the beginning. I do not think I'll ever go back tho Mowenpick, even if I have to say that position is fantastic and rooms are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcob
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last week of January 08. All in all it was a enjoyable stay. Few pointers - Atmosphere - This hotel it appeared to me is geared for business clients, for which it caters very well, with free WiFi, excellent conference facilities and a business centre. That said it lacks atmosphere, there was no life in either the bar or restaurant. Room - Very clean, spacious and modern. Staff - For the most part very friendly and helpful in particular the bar staff. Location - As with other posts hotel is outside the main centre but easy to access by tram. Taxis do not touch as very expensive and it is a long 15 min walk particularly in January !! Food - Hotel offered either bar food or Silks restaurant and again no complaints - tasty and affordable (but my company was paying) Overall - Very comfortable business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Hotel, Not So Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: bowmore
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights at the Movenpick City Centre Amsterdam. It is a modern 20 storey building. I got a room in the 19th floor and hence enjoyed a really great view on the harbour and the town. The room was very clean, nicely furnished with a rather modern but warm design. The size of the room was decent, the bed very comfortable with good blankets and pillows. Other positive equipments to mention are a (empty) fridge, a flatscreen TV and a sofa by the window. The bathroom is well designed with good quality shower products (from Bogner). The staff was friendly and helpful. The down part is the location; it will take you about 15 minutes to walk to the city centre (central station) which might be easily doable in normal weather conditions but I had to endure heavy rain and even a hailstorm which made this a bit of an unpleasant experience. The taxis in Amsterdam are very expensive but there would have been the option to take a tram which stops close to the hotel (apparently 3 stops to central station). Altogether it is a very nice and modern hotel, way above of the average standard of an equally priced hotel in the city centre but you have to live with the disadvantage to be a bit away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not 5 stars, website misleading”
Reviews.Author: MrSoft
Reviews.Content: Another ultra modern hotel needing an injection of soul. The look is well done but very spartan. You will stare at a big, unbroken blank wall from your bed. You may think that's cool, but it just looks like a blank wall to me. I would strongly recommend against booking the Club/exec rooms. We chose these because the price differential is small and the website virtual tour clearly implies you get a mini suite with separate living room. Not true! It is just a regular room. And also, it indicates that this tariff gives you free wireless. However, the whole hotel has free wireless. Bottom line, do not bother. Club rooms are also on a low floor (3rd) so you'll miss the lovely views. Pot luck whether you get a bath and a shower or just a shower. Silly curved glass desk which is not practical for work. Not really good enough TBH. The club lounge was OK but something of an afterthought. None of the "freshly cooked snacks" as promised. Now you can also take your breakfast in this club lounge if you wish, but all they will bring you is a pre-plated continental breakfast. If you want to go next door to the regular buffet, they try to charge you another 12,50e! One of the oddest things about this hotel, which I never saw anywhere else, is the complete lack of toilets. If you're in the bar (ground floor) and need the loo, you have to walk across the lobby, get in the lift, and go up to the 1st floor. If you're in the restaurant (3rd floor) and need the loo, you have to leave the restaurant, get in the lift, and go down to the 2nd floor. (You get the picture). Baffling really. Anyway, the hotel is essentially OK but no more. Service is very mixed. Orders were confused and in some cases forgotten in the Asian restaurant. Slow slow service in the bar. If you're coming to a conference, you will queue for a long time as the lunchtime buffet set-up is completely inadequate for the task. Anyway if Movenpick are serious about the rating then they need to get some stronger management in and pep the whole place up a bit, which is frankly not as posh as the website suggests!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms but not a very good location”
Reviews.Author: butterbloodvoodoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has modern rooms which all look exactly the same. The price is unreasonable for such a location. It's about 15-25 min walk to the city center. I would recommend this hotel ONLY because of the view. If you book this hotel make sure to tell them you want a room on highest floor possible.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: therealmikeymouse
Reviews.Content: Went there for a company confrerence - around 300 people. They managed the numbers well. Lots of nice treats at break times etc. Evening meal at little slow, but for 300 people the food was very good. Breakfast was a bit of a cattlemarket, the room and servng area seems too small and benches for seats not what you'd expect of a 5 star hotel. Rooms were very nice, modern and stylish, great views from higher floors although mainly of the harbour and other tower blocks. A little basic for a 5-star but not overpriced either. Great location if you arrive by ferry; near the central railway station but too far to walk with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel With Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: salsprite
Reviews.Content: This hotel puts others to shame. the staff are so helpful and friendly and will go out of their way for you. We took our 16 month old and they made a fuss of her and looked after us so well, ensuring we had a fantastic stay! They even offered to babysit. There was a personal touch to their attitude. The food was nice and the room was very clean and nicely decorated. We also had a lovely view from our room of the river, and at night you see all of Amsterdam lit up! It annoys me that people are so lazy saying this hotel is out of the way it is about a 10 minute walk to centraal station(which is the centre!) which is not far at all to the centre! plus there is a free shuttle bus so you dont even have to walk of youre too lazy. I will definately go there again without a doubt. For me the staff made it a lovely xmas break!Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paultsams
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay in this hotel through Expedia who was offering 3 nights for the price of 2. There were 3 of us sharing one room - there was a huge double bed and the sofa next to the huge window turns into a bed which any dult would be more than comfortable on. The rooms are clean and modern as this hotel is brand new. The receptionists are fantastic and the room service is perfect and I thought quite reasonably priced. I called the hotel a couple of days before we got there to ask for a room on a high floor with a view of the city centre. I got this and the view from the hotel room is amazing. The hotel building juts out over the river so when you look out the window it gives the impression that you are floating 20 stories above the river. This was my seconed visit in three months to this hotel and I would definately go again. As for location, well its not in the best place. A walk to Centraal Station is only 10mins, and from there you are within easy walking distance of most attractions and in my opinion the ONLY way to see any city is by foot so the location for me was never an issue. And if you are that bothered you could either get a number 23 tram or jump in a taxi for the minimum fare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel excellent value”
Reviews.Author: petrol1967
Reviews.Content: Booked the Moevenpick Hotel Amsterdam via Priceline, as I am not happy to pay the silly prices for Hotels in large Cities and not get value for money. Using Priceline, I set the price I wanted to pay and ended up with the Moevenpick which I feel gave a good account for themselves, baring in mind, that this is the first time we have stayed at this hotel. Check in was no problem, and we got into our room for midday, which was good baring in mind check in is 3pm. Room was very nice and clean and modern with a nice bathroom and spotless. Towels were a bit on the small side but a minor issue. This being the first time we used the hotel, we used the shuttlebus to take us into town which was great, and had arranged for a pick up that evening but they never showed up, which was irritating. Use the 26 tram to get back to the hotel if you cant face the walk, its just one stop, very handy. All in all very happy with hotel, but only problem was it was no smoking but again thats my problem not theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Korta
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our short 2 nights break in Amsterdam and booked this hotel via priceline for a reasonable rate.
