We were very excited about this new Moevenpick hotel as we have stayed many times in their other hotels around the globe. I have never experienced such a lack of interest of staff in any other Moevenpick property. Maybe because it is relatively new and staff is not well trained yet ... We have booked 2 rooms and arrived quite early in the morning and did not expect rooms to be ready. It took a while to find our reservations and we were given 1 room that was ready and were told the other one will be ready at 3 p.m. because itÂ´s official check in time - fair enough. We came back from town at 5 p.m. and room was still not ready so I asked for explanation and got a response that housekeeping is very busy and did not manage to clean all rooms - each maid has 25 or more rooms to clean - I thought - what do I care ?? I paid my rooms and want a serious explanation - this is an issue for the management they are short on staff... Finally I said please give me a call to our second room as soon as our room is ready to pick up the keys..they said OK, we will. At about 6.p.m I came down again to ask and room was ready but they forgot the room number to call me?!?.. Next day we wanted to take a boat trip, I took brochure at the hotel and found out there is a timetable until 4th November only - so went to concierge and asked if they have a new one or this is still valid and there is no change - concierge stared at me..this is not possible , checked it twice, went to back office and brought a pack of new actual brochures saying thank you for information sir...I thought OK but there were enough staff there they could notice - we have met lots of other people at the hotel dealing with same problem...Finally we wanted to go to Heineken brewery for a tour - we have double checked directions with concierge and went there - we were quite surprised the exhibition was closed more than 1 month ago until end May 2008 and they did not know about it at the hotel... Rooms were OK, nice view over city but it was quite cold even we set up a heating for maximum. All in all I was very dissapointed with this Moevenpick property and will definitely not stay here again - will choose one of the NH hotels in the centre - Krasnopolsky, City center or NH Schiller. I would not write this review if I would experienced at least an interest from staff and a short word of apology or any other signal they do care I am a guest at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Low Prices”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaytag
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay on Priceline ($105 per night) and as usual Priceline deceives by stating that this is in City Centre which it surely isn't. Its a half mile approx from Central Station and on a nice weather day the walk isnt really all that bad. One day this neighborhood just might be the City Centre but at the moment it's a lie. The hotel left us with mixed feelings. The staff is cordial and did what they could to provide us with our requests. Though we had to ask daily for washcloths and the towels in the bathroom are a slight ply above toilet tissue. Breakfast is quite good if you can eat $21 worth of food at a sitting. There's a lot to choose from and it is constantly being refilled. The rooms are small but clean. The shower/tub is strange and I left after staying 5 days there without understanding how to use the shampoo dispenser. The beds are small and a king sized bed isnt a king sized bed. The highlight of our stay was the dinner we had at the hotel's Silk Road restaurant which was quite good. Don't miss out on this spot especially in light of the fact Amsterdam doesnt have too many decent restaurants to relax in esp without smoke being blown in your face. Great view of the harbor from the upper floor which we occupied!

Reviews.Title: “Best 4-Star Value in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HankOakland_CA
Reviews.Content: This Swiss owned and managed hotel is an outstanding value. I paid US$100/night through Priceline. This four-star property is only about a year and a half old and offers outstanding views of the city and waterfront. Rooms are modern, quiet, extra clean and comfortable. The Duch make up their beds differently than Americans, so the pics on their website make them look like two singles put together. I can assure you that the beds at the Movenpick are nice king/queen size. The staff is courtious and efficient and they provide a free shuttle service between the hotel and Central Station that runs every half hour. As an option, you can also take tram #25 that will drop you, or pick you up at the far corner of the building. The food is great and the bar is quite fun. You will have no distressing 'surprises' if you book your next stay in Amsterdam at the Movenpick. With the currency exchange rate as unfavorable to Americans as it is right now, this hotel offers the best price : value in Amsterdam. It's completely non-smoking, too!

Reviews.Title: “First Class - Start to Finsih”
Reviews.Author: JohnEB
Reviews.Content: Flew into Amsterdam from Chicago, arrived at 7:30 AM (12:30 AM body time). No rooms ready. No problem - store our bags and let us shower and clean up using their spa facilities. Toured city, had breakfast, and returned around Noon. "We're so sorry we couldn't accomodate you when you first arrived. Allow us to ugrade you to a suite at no extra charge". And the service never waivered from there - "we'd be happy to get you tickets to tonight's Ajax soccer game, please check with us after your nap", etc. What are you doing still reading this review? Book your reservations already.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuslac
Reviews.Content: Rooms where very quiet, modern and clean. Size of the room was larger than average for Europe. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel was a little far from the main tourist sights but there was a metro/train station next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo1179
Reviews.Content: Before we booked this hotel we read a few reviews which complained that it was too far from the centre of Amsterdam. Rubbish. You can see the hotel from the train station and it's a 5-7 min walk away, or one tram stop. It's perfectly placed if you don't want to be right in the centre of Amsterdam, it also has great views of the river. The room was modern, very clean and comfortable, much bigger than the rooms you'd get in central Amsterdam. Breakfast was pretty expensive, â‚¬21 a night so we didn't bother... The gym is pretty small, but theres other facilities at the hotel for free I think. All in all though, a great hotel and a good break.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to American standards - but still nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: Ok, Ok - I know I'll probably get slammed by saying "not up to American standards"... but this would not be a 4 star hotel in the states. I travel a lot to Europe -- so I do know this is a nice hotel with pretty spacious rooms compared to most hotels. The Movenpick is a chain of hotels owned by the Swiss and it reflects the Swiss charm nicely - very clean and sleek (think upscale IKEA). My problems included VERY spotty service from the staff (some where knowledgable, some had no clue -- including the concierges!) An example - on one day I asked about the tram and was immediatelty told that the shuttle didn't run except on the half hour and you needed a reservation. That seemed very odd to me -- that you would need a reservation for public transport. So I asked again, in a different manner (I thought perhaps a language barrier) and then was told "OH -- you mean the TRAM. -- yes, it does run often" -- he pointed out the tram station (about a block away) and off I went. So he had jumped to the conclusion that I wanted the hotel shuttle and gave me wrong info. Later that day a co-worker (I was there with a large convention) told me you could get a public transportation pass and/or a "strip" ticket -- so you could ride the tram often, and at a lower price. (Why hadn't the concierge offered that earlier?) So I went to go buy one and was told that no, they didn't sell them. Luckily, another staff member overheard us and countered that now they DID sell them. So I went to the front desk and bought one from him. Later that day, another co-worker had the same experience. Other problems - our towels had HOLES in them! The bed linens were never changed (and we were there for a week!) I complained 2x to no avail. One of the days I did not receive my wake up call. The next day I got THREE of them!! 2 of my coworkers had reservations -- (we had confirmations in writing, thank goodness) -- but they hotel had them on the wrong day (started a day late). They tried to tell me that it was full and nothing could be done -- but when I was firm -- they were able to find rooms (had to upgrade one co-worker -- and wanted to charge us -- but I refused). But my shy co-workers (these 3 were from the Czech Republic) would have taken this crap if I wasn't there to insist. Other things: the phone system was a bit hard to use (no instructions on the phone, the info in the binder was wrong). No easy way to call room service or get your messages. (My co workers phones were all different -- some were ok, some not -- again, very varied in the way things work!). The gym was nice but while they offered services (massage) -- I could not schedule one to save my life. The maids sometimes left new shampoo/soap and sometimes did not. (Why? Why the randomness??). Etc., etc. Anyway -- I hope the management reads this and the comment form I filled out (but I had the feeling it was being shredded the moment I turned it in... there wasn't a "safe" place to submit it that I could see...) and works out these kinks. On the positive side -- the food is delicious. Its not at city center (can be a plus) but easy to use tram 25 or 26, canal boats, or taxis (and the shuttle if you make a reservation). The conference crew was quite good (Simone and Peter made my life VERY easy during this week). It is clean and quiet. The little gym was nice (but be aware that the saunas are co-ed, clothing optional!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: rhys172
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to back up what most other reviewers say and recommend the Moevenpick. It's a short 10 minute walk to the central station, the hotel run a free car shuttle service every 30 minutes which you can book via the concierge or you can just get on the number 25 tram which goes from just outside the Ferry Terminal next to the hotel. The rooms were clean (although I did have to ask for some extra room service after dirty cups were left in our room) and modern. The view from the room was excellent, and I imagine would be just as good whichever side of the hotel you stay on. If you want to be right in the middle of Amsterdam then this probably isn't for you but if you want to be very close but benefit from a nice clean and, importantly *quiet* hotel, then I cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Pick Movenpick”
Reviews.Author: yankeejnorthofBoston
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of staying here Mon through Sat of one week, while on business in Amsterdam. This hotel has four stars but must have no maintenence program. The first room we were checked into had a safe that didn't work and couldn't be repaired by maintenence. They moved us(we had to repack ourselves, of course) to another room, lower floor with a safe that worked for a few days. Guess what? As I am writing this review maintenence is trying to fix the safe in this room!! And this hotel is barely a year old and has four stars. Also broken in this room was the telephone for four days. I missed a most important message and because of this,an enormous problem was caused. If you want a room with no safe and no phone why pay for a four star hotel!! The service at the front desk is terse and insensitive to business needs. They seem to have no maintenence program at all. Also mundane things as well, such as no soap and tissues were constant problems. Swiss efficiency? Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking, yes, non-smoking hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: scoremedia
Reviews.Content: That's right folks, there is a non-smoking hotels among all the madness that is Amsterdam. The one year old Moevenpick (Swiss parent company) Hotel is a beautiful property that sits on the water in Amsterdam. Staff is very friendly, courteous and customer focused despite the fact that it's one of the largest hotels in the city. Nice bar downstairs that also serves food until 11pm and the beds are among the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Location is about a 10 minute walk from Central Station and 20-25 minute from the infamous Red Light District. They will provide a free shuttle on the hour to and from the Central Station but not the airport. You can take a shuttle for 12.50 euros and taxi to airport would be approximately 45-50 euros. Was upgraded to a suite (Europeans have a different definition of suites than Americans, it was a large room) and it was immaculate. Can't miss by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, trendy and friendly, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pauls71
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is really a good choice. We had a very quiet room on a high floor, it was tastefully decorated, and came with a luxurious bathroom, comfy beds, great view looking out over the harbour. The hotel is within walking distance of the central train station and the city center. After some Internet deal hunting, we finally got the best deal by contacting the hotel directly. The buffet breakfast was extravagant! There is also a nice trendy bar. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and classy”
Reviews.Author: Tarff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Moevenpick over a weekend, Fri-Mon, at the end of August '07. To be honest it's a step up in class from the hotel I would normally stay at, mainly due to us getting a fantastic '3 nights for 2' deal via Expedia for booking 'early', though I only booked about 4 weeks in advance. The hotel itself I believe is fairly new, opened in Nov 2006 (?), so it's all very clean and fresh looking. The staff who greeted us at the front desk were polite, helpful and spoke very good English. The room itself was spacious, clean and comfortable. Although we had booked a room with a King-size bed we were informed when we booked in that this was now unavailable and 2 twin beds were all they could offer. Although the bathroom was clean and the shower worked well there was no lock on the glass (!) bathroom door, which I think is taking the traditional Dutch relaxed feel a little too far. That said we had no real complaints about the standard of the hotel, and despite being situated next to a busy port and what appeared to be a main road there was no noise at night. My only real grumble with the hotel is that it is situated about 15 mins walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station. To find the hotel, if you're coming by train, take a left out of the station until you reach the end of the large, grand station building. Take another left underneath a bridge then a right. You should be able to see the Moevenpick somewhere in the distance. While I dont mind a good walk it was a bit of a pain with the suitcases, and cost 10 Euro in a taxi to get to/from the city centre. Also I feel that for the price the Moevenpick charge there may be better and more central alternatives, such as the Victoria which is right outside Centraal station. Although to be fair there is a tram stop almost directly outside the hotel which I did not even attempt to use as it seemed impossible to buy tickets anywhere. All in all I would recommend the Moevenpick, but only if you are not put off by a bit of a walk, or if you are able to find a good deal on the internet. There are fantastic views on the port and the city if you get a room high enough and the rooms are comfy and clean. If walking is not for you, I would suggest shopping around for cheaper and more central alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: CindysReviews
Reviews.Content: Modern clean hotel with close proximity by tram to central station and dam square. Room size & design good. Nice views of the city and Amstel River. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: arrycat
Reviews.Content: My husband daughter & I stayed at the Movenpick for three nights in mid August. We had read a variety of reviews on this hotel but deceided to book anyway. We had a fantastic time, the hotel was clean & modern. Our room had a king size bed & a separate sofa bed for our 13 yr old daughter. The bed had two single quilts rather than one king size quilt, this wasn't a problem for us. The bathroom was large with a walk in tiled shower, the bathroom also had a radio that was linked to the T.V. We had a choice of 5 different pillows which we ordered 4 of they were delivered to our room within 15 mins. The free WiFi broadband was excellent, very fast & had no problems connecting. My daughter used the gym which was open 24 hrs a day. We had the breakfast which was on a special price of 15 Euros, this was good value for money as there was a large varied choice and it kept us going till dinner time, also children under 16 are free. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the tram 25 or 26 to get into town, this was no problem as they were frequent. We also walked into Dam Square which took about 25 mins. We bought a 48 hr tram pass for 10.5 euro which allowed constant use of the trams. All in all we had a lovely time at this hotel and would certainly use this hotel & chain again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of the city and sunset”
Reviews.Author: BlueWoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 minute amble from the train station and situated right next to the Music Museum right on the harbours edge. Reception was very clean and welcoming and we got a bright greeting. We were told our room was on the 14th floor and that we had a great view........ and boy did we! On the first night we just sat and watched the most amazing sunset from our room......... plus we were entertained by watching all the little boats going along below us. The room itself was immaculate with a very comfortable bed, free wireless internet, a sofa and tea and coffe making facilities. The shower was clean and worked very well and toiletries were provided. Of special note to me was the fact that they had a real hairdryer. I loathe those stuck to the wall, have to keep your finger on the button to make them work ones. So this was a great bonus to me. The TV had loads of channels and was a really good flat screen with English channels if you want them. There wasn't as much storage space for clothes as I would have liked and have yet to find a hotel that ever has enough hangers, but this was much less than normal, however it wasn't a major problem. The mini bar was empty but a trip to reception and a form later we got it stocked with our choice - although at 40 euros its not cheap. The hotel is a little out of the way, but the walk to get back to it is really lovely. The rooms feel like new and everything works, the staff are really friendly and we had no complaints at all. Oh and they offer a courtesy shuttle from the train station which is excellent. I would most definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, ignore the bad comments!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: meekyone1420
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my wife and 14 year old son. was a bit concerned about the position of the hotel and the attitude of it's staff. Firstly may I say that walking to the hotel from Central station took us 8-10 minutes, and thats was after a few beers at manchester airport!! The walk is safe but because there are not many people around you may feel a little starnge. I have been to Amsterdam many many times and it is by far and away the safest city I have EVER Been to. Secondly the hotel staff were very polite and helpful (as most Dutch people are!) The hotel is excellent in all departments, the rooms are well equppped and a lot roomier than other hotels in the "centre" prices in the bar/restarant were a little high , but this is a five star hotel in one of the top 10 most expensive places in Europe!!! Now for the basics. The tram number 25/26 stops right outside the hotel across the road and services the town (dam square and central station) until 1am. The hotel shuttle bus now runs till 100pm and there have upgraded the bus to a seven seater VW, Just book with the door man. If you have been to the Dam before you will know exactly where the red light district/coffee shops are. But there is so so much more to amsterdam than these two. My advice is get a (free) map from the hotel and explore, you will get lost there is no-doubting that!! but will discover small areas where you would not think you were in a city that has all the excess a man can handle. Go and enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just a bit off city centre...”
Reviews.Author: Roffe77
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights with the wife in July 2007. The hotel offers large rooms with beautiful bathrooms and a splendid view of the harbour. In our experience, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful - room cleaning very efficient. There is no mini-bar (can be ordered), but there is a small refrigerator - very useful for stocking a few beers or sodas... The hotel also offers a buffet breakfast (at 15 Euro per person - evidently a summer special, normal price 21 E), which was worth every cent. Otherwise it's absolutely no problem getting a hearty breakfast (at practically any time!) in town. Travelers should be advised that the hotel is not exactly in the city centre, but rather a ten minute-walk from Central Station - which is really no problem if you're used to walking a bit, but elderly people might find it uncomfortable. On the other hand, there is a free shuttle service (from 7.30am - 11pm), but you have to book in advance. The 25 and 26 trams also run outside the hotel. It is a bit difficult actually seeing the entrance, but there was a lot of construction work going on, so probably some solution to this is planned. There is also a lack of just about everything in close vicinity, so you can forget about 'just stepping outside' to grab a morning coffee (or beer!). Taxi from Schipol will set you back about 50-60 Euro, but the train ride from the airport to Central Station is only 3,5E and takes 15 minutes, so if you have heavy luggage (and would prefer to spend your Euros elsewhere) it's probably best to take a cab from the station. All in all, the great standard of the hotel offsets its disadvantageous location - but only just. I would recommend the hotel to others, but might not be staying there when I return to Amsterdam - and I definitely will return. If you haven't been - go. Don't miss out on Jordaan, probably the most charming city district I've ever seen. Amsterdam is the definitive city to just amble about in, with an abundance of cafes, restaurants and cosy, brown pubs. Also try some Genever!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweet_science
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and with very pleasant and attentive staff. Furthermore, the view is nice and the rooms are a very comfortable size. Perhaps because most of the guests were business travelers, the hotel atmosphere was also quiet. I suppose any negatives about Movenpick depends on how much you paid. If you paid full price, you won't appreciate that it is just north of the city center. About 1 mile north of Dam Square, but much closer to Centraal Station and other trams. Also, you must walk up to a bridge and then under it to get to the heart of the city. At night some might find this intimidating, but it is quite safe. Again, it is not a long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights on business. The hotel was chosen for me. After reading several reviews before my trip, I was worried about the distance of the hotel. It's not that bad. 10-15 min. to Centraal Station, or a couple of stops on the tram. It worked out well for me, since I was couped up in the hotel all day in a conference. A nice 15 min. walk to dinner was welcome. And walking to and from the train station was quite safe, even when I had to catch the 4am train to Schipol for an early flight. I do agree with some that it is inconvenient to get from the hotel entrance to the main road. Not sure if this is something that will ever be remedied. The hotel was clean and modern. Check-in staff was VERY nice and helpful. My luggage was 24 hours late in arriving. Both the front desk and concierge helped to keep me informed of the location of my bag, and provide me with any essentials I needed until it arrived. The hotel restaurant was delicious, and the bar was comfortable. I'm a big fan of the non-smoking policy in the hotel. My room was clean and in a great location. I recommend an upper floor room with even number room. This will give you a view of the waterway and city center. I found it quite relaxing to sit at the window and watch the water traffic. The cruise ship dock is right next to the hotel, and it was quite impressive to watch these large ships navigate the waterway. So why only 4 stars? A combination of several little things, and there is no option for 4.5 stars. House cleaning was spotty. Maybe they just do it late in the day, but one time they didn't stop by to clean my room until 7pm. I was already in for the night. A couple of my business associates didn't get their room cleaned at all. While I didn't have a problem with the location, I recognize that it is not ideal. Getting to the hotel from the main road was the most frustrating upon my arrival. Great place, nice staff, great views. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: Naish
Reviews.Content: Just came back from amsterdam Stayed there with my wife for 6 nights The hotel is new ! Very nice rooms - big, new and has everyithing. We stayed at the 19th floor - the view is amazing ! Excellent breakfast. Staff was very friendly The hotel is very close to the old city Tram no. 25 is across the street and comes every 15 minutes until 1:00 AM. 2 stations and you are in Dam square (1 station from the central station) For us that arrangement worked just fine. One thing - they didn't have king size double beds when we came. We got a room with 2 beds attached one to another - did not bother us... The hotel hosts conferences so many of the guests are business people participating in the convension. To conclude - We recommend this hotel very much !

Reviews.Title: “Movenpick Hotel Amsterdam NOT IN THE City Center”
Reviews.Author: tymothy
Reviews.Content: I find it funny that the hotel offical name is Movenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Center. This hotel is not in the city center. Don't get me wrong, its not in the suburbs, its only about a 15 minute walk from the central train station. But by European standards its not city centre. The hotel offers a shuttle service to the central station but it only sits 4, only runs once an hour and stops at 6pm, plus you have to reserve your seat. This is one of the things the hotel could improve on, more regular shuttle service. But on the other hand the hotel is new, sleek, modern with great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: manishnandha
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent user of hotels in Amsterdam due to business and I can say the hotel itself is one of the best. The very modern and minimal design is perfect for me and everything worked as it was supposed to. The gym is small but good and the restaurant is good also (if slow service). I would still choose other hotels over this because of the location. It is not particularly conveniently placed for getting into town (you can walk with 10-15 mins) or do the same journey in a tram which is roughly the same time once you account for waiting time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but far from centre”
Reviews.Author: swiftshoes
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick is a modern, well-apportioned hotel with large rooms and reasonable ammenities. I stayed there with my family and it was a good choice as it had many facilities- elevator, internet in lobby, and workout room. But, the location is a real drawback and the shuttle service is not very convenient or reliable. We used taxis several times per day (10-15 euros per trip) and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “The Movenpick in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: theresaandbob
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the Netherlands, and a good part of the credit goes to this wonderful hotel, the Movenpick. We stayed there for four nights. They were kind enough to help us out by finding a room for us on Queen's Day!!!! The hotel is clean, the employees very nice. The food in their restaurant is expensive, however there is a nice place on the dock a few meters toward Amsterdam with good food and reasonable prices. While the Movenpick is not in the center of town, (we were somewhat happy about that, especially around Queens' Day) it is very accessible via the Tram # 26, ( runs very frequently, takes about six minutes to get there from Station Centraal). Read Rick Steves. When you arrive buy at least the part of the IAmsterdam pass that gets you on the buses and trams...best deal in the world. We bought a three day pass, but you can customize that to your plans. The Dutch were very helpful, friendly, and really organized when it came to managing what we were exposed to. A majority of the Dutch speak English. Downside...look out for pickpockets in the crowds. Use a money belt. We took public transportation to De Hoge Veluwe, a national park, a wonderful place, google it....and to the Keukenhof, highlights of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Dm0
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal (less than US$100) using Priceline on the Movenpick for three nights. The walk from Central Station wasn't bad (about 10 minutes) but started to wear thin toward the end. Could never figure out where to catch the tram to get back, but didn't try very hard. Checkin was pleasant, and they (thankfully) allowed us to check in early when we arrived from our transatlantic flight at 8:00 am. The room was small but clean, with terrific views of the harbour and the city. Free water was provided, but only on the first day and was never replaced. Our rate didn't include breakfast, and the one day we chose to eat breakfast at the restaurant the food was uninspiring and the price was a shocking EUR21 per person. Like I say, we only made that mistake once... We didn't make it to the bar. Security personnel was very helpful when I had to call them from a cab on my way back from the airport to ask them to retrieve our passports and various other valuables that we forgot in the room safe! All in all, was OK, and I wouldn't complain if I got this hotel again via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “nice view of the river but several blocks outside of main city and station”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior69
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a solid 10 minute walk from central train station, not bad but the hotel is NOT in the thick of the city, like some are. I dont recommend this hotel if you want to be right in the middle of the city. There are hotels right outside the train station that are in the middle of the hustle and bustle but the Movenpick is a several block walk. They do offer shuttle to the train station every hour which is nice if you have luggage that you dont want to carry several blocks. The hotel is super clean and nice, but I think the price of $150 USD was too much. I thought I got a good deal on priceline but later I heard that $150 is the going rate for most people (even though their website says $250 USD). The breakfast buffet was 20 Euro and the dinner was 25 Euro. the price was high but the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not City and surely not City center”
Reviews.Author: Eshech
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights There is nothing in the surrounding â€“ nothing The only way to get to the city is by Tram (not really frequent â€“ and it is not really worth to wait in the cold for 15 minutes to take you from the city to the hotel) or Taxi - thus it is really unclear why they call it city center ?? Rooms are nice but the impression is you are in a 3 star hotel (e.g. IBIS) not a 4 stars (in some rooms they have only Shower) Amsterdam is nice, be careful if you want a City Break it is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: freely
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great rooms nice & clean. Small do-able walk from the centre (not a prob!!) and if it is tram 25 or 26 takes you to central station every few mins for 1.46euros. Overall very happy with the hotel but found the bar staff to be extremely rude & bad mannered. They were actually fighting over who would have to serve us. Excellent representitives for the hotel!!! But dont let that put you off, Great place to stay would recommend it despite the idiots in the bar!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for one night on a Saturday night - Hotel is in walking distance of Centraal Station (but definitly not in the centre of town ) if you do not have a big suitcase - located near the Cruise Ship Terminal it is a very large hotel - the area outside it still looks unfinished and it is hard to see where the entrance is . The Hotel is strictly non smoking and you are reminded everywhere of this and the associated penalty. Mr room was great on the 11th floor with great views of the River and Amsterdam. Rooms are very modern in decor and have a nice clean feel to them - alas only a shower no bath which I was looking forward to. One dissappointment was that the room service menu was very limited and dissappointing. The breakfast items were a la carte and overrpriced. Complimentary internet access in the Lobby as well as a shuttle bus to the Station every hour on the hour. All in all I would go back ...

Reviews.Title: “ok, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Wingk
Reviews.Content: this is a new hotel, but it has some major problems for biz traveller like me. firstly, the wireless internet is free, but it hangs every computers connected to it, a few of my business buddies were having the same problem. breakfast, the buffer breakfast has limited choice of food, it a far cry from any 3-stars hotel that I been to, I hope their rating is at least 3-stars. housing-keeping, they provide fresh towels, but bed is not properly made. checking in, only 1 staff was around when our group check in, there is no welcome drinks, but the staff smile sure brighten the day. there is not even currency exchange at the hotel, we were advise to go to the town center for currency exchange, but after a day at the office, after 7 at the evening. most banks would be close. like the same review from others, the room is clean & hotel is new. that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable MÃ¶venpick”
Reviews.Author: larina
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of days is this hotel recently, and was not satisfied at all. For this price I would like much better service. We arrived at the hotel at 6 p.m. not too late, not too early for check-in. The check-in was however ridiculous. We - a group of twelve - entered, nobody at the door said a hello or hi. In fact there was no doorman or boy, who would help with the luggages or parking the cars. The only entrance is a revolving door, it's really fast, and I had to watch out even without luggages not to get hit by it. In my opinion there is a great risk of accident at the door for old or disabled people or guests with huge and heavy luggages. At the reception we had to wait approximately 30 minutes to get our keys. There were three girls at the desks, two of them didn't seem to care of the guests at all. The third one was illeterate. She said, she couldn't make the check-in, because she couldn't spell the names because of the foreign characters. The following characters are in my colleague's name: A, B, C, J, L, S, Y, Z, all printed in Latin capital characters is his passport. I'm still curious which of those is "foreign" in the Netherlands. There were beautiful clean windows everywhere in Amsterdam, except my hotelroom. In MÃ¶venpick windows has not been cleaned for at least half a year, or maybe since the hotel was built. It is a non-smoking hotel, and if you smoke a cigarette, you have to pay a penalty of 150 euros for "cleaning". However I don't think rooms are cleaned very often. My desk was dusty, and there were unidentifiable brown stains (faeces, puke, blood?) in my bathroom. The brochure promises free wireless internet in the rooms. But my laptop couldn't find any wireless network, and other guests also complained that there were no wireless internet in their rooms. We could only use cabel internet, for which guests have to pay. The most ridiculous is that the receptionist distrained 300 euros on the guests' credit cards for using the minibar. But minibars are totally EMPTY! There were no slippers, no bathrobe, and only one piece of tissue in the tissue-box in my bathroom. If guests ran out of instant coffee and cream, soap etc. on the first days of their stay, the staff would not give more automatically. So it's really advisable to pack everything you might need (tissue, soap, body milk, coffee whitener, sugar etc.) in your baggage. We attended a conference, and the lunch was served in the hotel. I like hot meals, but the Asian soup was so hot and spicy, that none of us could eat more than a spoonful of it. The "main" dish was some potatoes with cauliflowers, not really tasty. Only the dessert was edible. The breakfast costs approximately 20 euros, the food is average: eggs, bacon, cheese, muesli, cornflakes etc. The only "speciality" is that guests can't serve coffee and tea for themselves, they have to wait for the staff. Actually five or six waiters are standing around, watching, and walking all the time, but they do not want to serve anything. Once I had to ask the waiter five times to bring some coffee, before he finally served me. It is also very uncomfortable, that the elevator works only with the roomcards. It takes a while to learn how to use the cards. If you put them in the slot too early, or too late, the elevator won't work. Besides this roomcards often spoil.

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant hotel what a find”
Reviews.Author: coysh
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in this hotel for the weekend and it was very good. Having read the reviews left by others I was wondering if I would find it OK and would it be a problem getting in to the centre and back again. When you come out of the station take the exit Nord with a picture of a boat and look right you can not miss it is the very big building with Movenpick in red letters which are lighted up at night. It is very reassuring when you arrive at a strange city to be able to get to your hotel so easily. It is only a 10 minute walk and not 20 as some have suggested. The walk will do you good and it is not far. A small tip as you approach the hotel there is a bridge go over it do not attempt to stay by the river bank as you will have to walk up a flight of stairs at the end. The entrance is very clear as you come over the bridge there are three giant flag poles with massive banners with Movenpick on them how people said they could not see it is beyond me.. Walking back at night I felt perfectly safe. It is well lit with plenty of passing traffic. The one time I did take a cab due to overindulgence late at night cost a reasonable 9 Euro from Dam square. The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms are very modern with great views out across Amsterdam on a sunny day you can see for ever. Both check in and check out went very smoothly. There where 6 people on duty and it was very busy but we were signed in within minutes of arrival they even had a niece drink awaiting you. All the staff are very polite and happy as you would expect. If they still have the happy hour take advantage drinks half price. 17:00 to 19:00. There are two free internet terminals on the ground floor I wish all hotels offered this service instead of trying to charge for it. I would stay at this hotel again but I doubt I will get the cracking good rate I did this time as I am sure if they maintain the excellent levels of service I encountered it will only become more and more popular. This is the first time I have stayed at this chain but I will look out for them in the future well done.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views!!”
Reviews.Author: Autumnearthangel
Reviews.Content: 11-13th February 2007 My friend and I had the most wonderful room on the 20th floor (we were asked whether we wanted higher or lower floor accommodation) with spectacular views over the harbour- night-time particularly magical.... The room was quiet ,tastefully modern, comfortable and scrupulously clean. A really expansive breakfast - with just about anything a body could manage to eat!! Service prompt and respectful -nothing was too much trouble. As I am a regular visitor to Amsterdam and surrounding district with plenty of experience of both hotels and self-catering properties I would recommend this hotel, I shall certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Actionfilter
Reviews.Content: I had none of the problems mentioned by previous reviews, so it looks to me that they have taken things to heart. The location is a beauty, a gorgeous harbor view. Admittedly my view is in large extent based on the rate I got, which was pretty low, 87 E incl. breakfast. For that same rate I had given up a room on the Buerstraat which did not incl. breakfast, no brainer. I did not find it that far from where I wanted to get to mostly, which is the Central area, Singel, Damrak to Dam Square. There is a good tram service very close to the hotel and a Shuttle - You need to reserve this btw. The walk is fine, there is an interesting way to do it which was not mentioned. You can take the promenade and get off at the Music Gebouw, next door, then walk down the steps to the same level as the hotel, it's right there. This Musicgebouw can also provide you w/ a very nice cafe, reasonable drinks and food. Gin was 2E a shot, there was beer, Belgian a bit more exp. Tapas at 4.5 E. A wide and interesting show range. Another way to walk is to stay on ground level and go under the bridge you get to a parking lot, and go straight, where there are small offices, very picturesque. Still another option is to take the Promenade straight not making a left at Centraal Station, this will get you to the Singel area eventually. I liked the bar, especially the happy hour! Room was fine, exceedingly comfortable bed. Breakfast was a feast. I took advantage of the non-breakfast items the Kimchi Korean Cabbage/Ginger salad, Cous-Cous, many vegetables, Pasta, fruits, soy milk! Seating is a bit awkward but not that bad. Internet connection is great, 24/7, 2 terminals. What is not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deepdvr_ca
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Across the street from Central Station and on the bay. The people were very friendly and helpful. They gave us free shuttle rides and were very helpful setting up dining reservations. The bar was very cool. The room was nothing short of outstanding. Extremely comfortable bed. Very modern. The bathroon was excellent!!! I especially enjoyed the naked Germans in the no charge sauna at the no charge spa. My only complaint is that we ordered a cheese tray that was embarrasing. It was the equivalent of a plate of Kraft Singles here in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: TizzieBelle
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the previous review. This hotel has lots of issues. We stayed from the 27th January for three nights. The hotel is about a 5 min drive from the train station (take a train from Schiphol not a taxi as it is only 4 euros each and the trains leave from the airport every 15 mins). The hotel is 20 mins from the centre, the walk is fine and that was not a problem. It was the access that was the problem. There are no clear walkways and you have to walk under dark, un-lit bridges at night to get back to the hotel. It is really frustrating as you can see the main entrance from the bridge but you then have to walk for another 5-7 mins to the end of the bridge and the walk back in the opposite direction (there is no walkway or staircase available). Taxis are way over priced and best to avoid or agree a price before you set off. Hotel staff are not really friendly (bar staff are very nice though) and we only encountered one smiling face on check in and that was the guest standing next to us!! The concierge are non existent. We had to drag luggage to our room only to find we were not given the right type of room, then to come back down again with luggage in hand. Rooms are clean and adequate BUT be aware if you book a king bedroom, you get a kingsize bed with two small single duvets. They do not provide one king duvet. This meant cold feet all night and this "style" is totally couple unfriendly. You might as well book a twin bed and sleep separately. I asked for a king duvet and the guest relations just said "well this is our style". I said well we are both cold and with a king bed you would expect an adequate sized duvet and all she said was well "you can turn the room temperature up". Apparently this is a normal procedure for a Dutch hotel. I can't honestly believe it and I think the world has gone mad if they really think that a couple can sleep adequately together in a king bed with a single duvet per person. I think the hotel is totally over-rated and would only be suitable for business travelers traveling alone who donâ€™t really need to leave the hotel during their stay. We will highly recommend using the trams and buy an "I amsterdam" discount card from tourist information as it gives you free entry to loads of attractions, free bus and tram travel and also discounts on other attractions and restaurants. Restaurants to recommend; Restaurant Brasserie Di Poort (part of Di Poort Van Cleve Hotel), is near Dam Square and serves gorgeous meals. It is fairly pricey if you go for three courses and wine and come to about Â£50 per person but it is worth it. Amsterdam is a wonderful city and very beautiful but try to avoid the Movenpick.

Reviews.Title: “would not go back or suggest it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: vouvoune
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice looking and modern but everything else about the stay was painful, long and no way a 4 star service. Location: To start with, it is NOT AT ALL in the center. It takes 20 minutes to walk to the center or a pricey $40 cab ride both ways. It isnot a convenient location at all and the walk from the hotel is pretty sketchy. The most bothersome of the whole experience was probably the location. I truly felt that it was false advertisement. It was so far from the center that we feel that we didn't do things we would have otherwise done if the hotel was REALLY in the center. I fell that it truly tarnished our vacation. We REALLY wanted to be in the middle of the action and were far from it. The staff was inefficient, unfriendly and SO slow. My first impression was already bad. We arrived at the front desk, there was 3 persons working with one costumer so there was no line. It took 15 minutes for us to be addressed! At no point were we welcomed, told about how long it would take, or to take a seat for a while we wait.The type of things you expect in a 4 star establishment. We were not even acknowledged. When we check-out at the front desk, my husband rested his foot to tie his shoe on the little shelves meant to rest your computer bag on and a manager got off his cell phone to reprimand him on this act. Again, this is not very 4 star attitude. My husband was dressed in a suit with spotless shoes and this reprimand was quite unnecessary. Cleanliness: the room had not been not really cleaned after our first day there -although the beds were made- and the second day, no one came to clean. It'sclearly unacceptable in a 4 star establishment. Elevators: Only 4 elevators for a 20 story, 408 rooms! They are supposed to hold 13 person but even with 10 thin looking individual it was uncomfortably tight, so imagine what it's like with bigger people and suitcase. Everybody was complaining about how slow they are and often time, when they stopped they were full. Also, for some reason the elevators would not stop by our floor. We would press the button and we would see the elevators passing us up and down without stopping. One time we waited 15 minutes for one. Another time, the elevators were not working after we arrived from long day of walking around the city. We were exhausted but since tons of people were waiting in the hallway we decided to climb the stairs to the 10th floor only to find out that you couldn't! Some staff members told/showed us that at each staircase you need a special key to get to the next fly of stairs.I am not sure how that will work if there is a fire or during a blackout. Concierge: very unhelpful, every time we had a question it felt like we were bothering them and our questions were left unanswered. City tax: at the end of our stay the hotel charged us with a city tax of about $20 which I don't feel we should be accountable for. I have never heard of that before and usually when I use the reservation system I use, everything is included and if I don't use hotel services, I shouldn't have anything more to pay, I have never had until then. Amsterdam and I would NOT recommend it to other costumers. I await more from a 4 star hotel and to me this hotel is not up to the standards I have been accustomed to. I used an all inclusive reservation system (priceline) and I would like to be refunded the city tax as in all my travel I never had to pay such a thing and priceline did not mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Movenpick”
Reviews.Author: tvldiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for three nights Jan. 10-13, 2007. The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable. The bathroom was in pristine condition, with a tub. The decor is modern, with down comforters. They had different types of pillows you could request to maximize your comfort. Any requests, i.e. pillows and extra towels, were delivered very promptly. We were greeted at the door when we arrived and a bellhop immediately got a cart for our luggage. There was also fresh juice provided to us while we were checking in. They have a free shuttle to take you to the train station every hour from 7 am to 1800 pm. It is just a ten minute walk from the hotel to city center. I have no complaints and would definitely stay at any movenpick hotel in the future. Also, there was a great breakfast included in the price of our room. It would have easily cost us $30 or more for a similar breakfast anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bigdawg9
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. I was there in Dec. 2006 - the hotel is new and beautiful with large rooms and a decent spa. When I got there, the staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and there was a complimentary drink given to you during the check in. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Amsterdam Central station - if you have luggage, spend the 10 Euros and take a cab. With no luggage, it is a nice well lit walk back to the city. The food was good, internet connections all worked well and the staff was excellent. All in all, I highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location!”
Reviews.Author: LC2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find for a quick weekend trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is not directly in downtown Amsterdam but is only a few short blocks away from the train station and anything else you might like to do. The room was immaculate and decently sized compared to most European hotel rooms. All in all it was a great experience at the Movenpick.

Reviews.Title: “Good looks, No bath, and Long Walk!”
Reviews.Author: mdudfp
Reviews.Content: hi i stayed in this hotel in Nov 2006, with my girlfriend. It had some good reviews, and thought it would be good place to stay. It is a nice airy hotel, with lots of nice modern touches. But it had some SERIOUS downside to it! 1) Firtsly , there was no bath in the room, it was a walk in shower, which was fine, but am used to baths. 2) Service at the front desk was very poor, it was like waiting at an airport check in counter, as there just wasnt enought staff to deal with the ques. 3) the hotel entrance is a small revolving door, hidden beneath a bridge!!! this is absoultely shocking!!, although you can see the hotel from the station, when you get closer, you just dont know how to get to the entrance!! 4) it is about 20 min walk form central station and the nigt life areas, but WOMEN be careful, as it is a little scary , and dark when walking back from a night out to the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel With A Few Problems”
Reviews.Author: rdwacw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. A good breakfast buffet is served for 15 Euros. The hotel staff needs a little more training. I think because the hotel is so new various problems need to be addressed. The rooms were very warm and the cooling system did not cool the rooms. Upon opening the windows, the sound of the trains is constant because of the proximity to Central Station. On our third night at the hotel, a band was playing outside so loudly that we were not able to sleep until after 1 AM. After calling the front desk in the afternoon to have my room cleaned, the room was never cleaned. The staff did bring clean linens after I complained to the front desk. It is about a 20 minute walk to Central Station. Central Station has some restaurants and a grocery store. If you walk out on the other side of Central Station, there are many restaurants and sites to see. For the kids, there is a Burger King upstairs at Central Station. I feel that this hotel will improve with time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Modern, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Adyson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Movenpick for two nights on December 10th. The hotel is brand new, exceedingly clean and modern with great views of the harbor and city. The staff provided superb service (the women tending bar were delightful.) Their breakfast buffet is extensive. It is a hike from the true city center, although I used the tram which was fairly convenient and inexpensive (less than 2 euros.) Although other locations may be more convenient, this hotel provides more modern clean comfort than probably any you can book closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Fab Service, Upgraded Room A++++”
Reviews.Author: David Bristol
Reviews.Content: Fantastic new hotel 10 mins walk from Central Station. As some reviewers have pointed out, it is a fair way from town but is only around 10 euros in a taxi to dam square, central station etc. got it for a fantastic rate of 100GBP per night plus city tax so a good deal. arrived at 10am left luggage no problem. returned at 1pm (an hour earlier than advertised check in) and recived an upgraded room (junior suite) as no standard doubles were available. Room was immaculate and obviously less than two months old. shower hot and powerful, aircon didnt seem to work meaning it was rather hot but not a huge problem. checked out over an hour late, no doggy looks or snide comments. First class throughout. A note to the bad reviewers... no-one claimed it was right in the centre and its a brand new contemporary style hotel, not a 90's marriott with floral curtains and bed covers.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Impressed by the Movenpick Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ams
Reviews.Content: Having read recent reviews from other guests here, I was a little anxious about my stay. However, thus far (1 night into my 3 night stay) I am really rather impressed. Leaving Central Station, you have the choice of trams 25 (inconveniently located stop at CS) or 26 or a walk along a somewhat industrial waterside road to get to the hotel's stop, beside a large music building. Ongoing construction in the road outside the hotel makes direct access inconvenient: crossing the footbridge to the music building then walking down the steps and along is the most direct route, although some might find the many steps up to the bridge for the return trip somewhat arduous. This hurdle overcome, I was pleasantly surprised upon entering the lobby. Calm, clean and light sums up the area, which was well staffed by (admittedly young) well turned out staff. I was checked in by a girl who was being trained by colleague: she did a fine job and I was directed to the elevator after being given a summary of the property. Having requested a high, quiet, room I was directed to the 11th floor; my room enjoys sideways views of both the water and the city. Looking across to a deserted evening building in the evening, I was able to leave my curtains open to enjoy the night lights across the area. The room is well designed with enough space (though it's not roomy by US standards, certainly) to move about. I understand the sofa can convert into a single bed: it'd have to be a very small person who slept on it comfortably, though! A glass desk fairly well lit by a lamp (with a worryingly flimsy plastic switch) gives ample space for your laptop and is connected to a unit with kettle, tea/coffe-making items. The A/C worked well and was unobtrusive and each bedside table has a power outlet in case you have lot of phones, etc. to charge. The room has been designed to maximize floor space - it is very uncluttered, which provides plenty of room for those travelling with large amounts of luggage. The bathroom has a very spacious shower (no bath/tub) and a good-sized basin with a small selection of nice-smelling toiletries. The glass door is opaque for privacy and the sound from the TV is piped through so you don't have to miss a second if nature calls in the middle of a show. Adequate storage space contained self-setting PIN-operated safe and a small refrigerator containing a complimentary bottle of mineral water - a nice touch, I felt. A small glitch with WiFi was explained by the helpful reception clerk: apparently, the hotel's system currently allows only 50 rooms access to the WiFi network at any one time - clearly inadequate, and frustrating if you happen to be the 51st person trying to access his/her email. I was informed that the system is due to be upgraded this week to one which will be capable of allowing all rooms simultaneous access if they so desire. To sum up, I am enjoying my stay here - while certainly it lacks the convenience of the downtown hotels, you do have a wonderful feeling of space and a short, efficient tram ride takes you to/from the action of the city centre in 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, certain drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: je135
Reviews.Content: Two college students studying abroad stayed here for a weekend 10/19-23. Priceline gave us the Movenpick Amsterdam for a great price. We arrived at Centraal Station, went outside and saw the massive building and just walked to it, taking about 12 minutes with a backpack and carry-on each, no sweat. Checkin was a breeze, staff was nice, and they honored our request for a room on the top floor for the views. Room was beautiful and we couldn't complain much. Free Wireless internet was nice but it kept working, then not working, then working again, then not working again, which got a little frustrating. Almost every time, we walked to Centraal Station and then up towards the rest of the city because Movenpick does not have a prime location to the city centre. However, this walk was not bad, and I just had to keep reminding myself that it was worth it for the price we paid. Had we paid full price for the room, I probably would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bring supplies”
Reviews.Author: darealbiz
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Amsterdam for the weekend for business meeting on Monday and stayed at the Movenpick fairly blind. This hotel is definently having teething pains: 1) bathrooms doors are glass and relatively see through, nice privacy for others in your room 2) No vending machines, store, water, ANYTHING. Good luck if you get thirsty. 3) It is 10-15 minutes walk to get to everything - not terrible - but reality 4) Breakfast buffet isn't very good 5) This place is COLD - very institutional - there is NO COLOR - bring something with color on it so you can find your way out 6) I don''t think this place has a sprinklers in the rooms 7) The place isn't "ready" yet, no room service menus, etc The good 1) Free internet access - but it did go out on us 2) New hotel, everything is new; beds are comfortable Bottom line - stay downtown - you're here - why walk 10 minutes?

Reviews.Title: “Er... what can I say?”
Reviews.Author: MrAndMrsFoodie
Reviews.Content: I got to Amsterdam a lot and this time, some friends and I decided to stay at the new Movenpick. I felt compelled to post a reivew this time. I'll start with the positive points: The room and bathroom were lovely. We had a great view over the city and harbour. Pillows etc were really comfy. Interior was great and it was very clean. Now the rest: Most of the staff, with the exception of a few, that we encountered were rude, could not understand simple questions or requests and simply had no idea what was going on. Both my friend and I agreed that there was bit of an attitude problem going on. This was surprising to me because at any other hotel I've stayed at in Amsterdam over the last 9 years, from the 1* to the 5* I've never had those issues. For example.. We found that most (not all) the day time reception staff pleasant however the night time staff were a different story. They were unhelpful, not bothered and rude. An example: Simple questions like 'Do you have internet here?' or 'Do you know of / can find me a mechanic?' proved too difficult or too much of an effort to understand and answer. One member of staff thought our questions were beyond the service the hotel provides. We had only asked him about where we could find a mechanic and NOT asked him to fix the car. When asking if they had internet, she replied 'NO'. I asked 'do you have a business centre'? she replied 'NO'. I said well do you know any internet cafe's near by she said 'NO'. I assume the reason for her unhelpful abrupt answers because I may have interupted her having a happy chat with the colleague even though I had waited for her to finish. We had 3 people staying in our room. 2 people for 2 nights and 3 people for 3 nights. On the last night with the 3rd person We were given 2 towels and no extra bed linen for the sofa bed. Fair enough but then when we called reception to ask them on late saturday night to bring extra bed linen and a towel up - they didn't! I ordered a taxi - The concierge told me to come down as it was there. It was not there. I asked and was told 5 mins. I waited for 20 mins, asked again but then no one knew, until thinking it'd be quicker to walk or take the tram rather than wait for the hotel to do anything for me. On check out I asked the receptionist to put a certain amount on my credit card and the difference on my friend's card. I explained this to her three times. She then charged my card for the full amount. When I mentioned her mistake, she said, rather annoyed, that 'I had told her to do that'. I looked at my friends rather puzzled as we had explained three times. She corrected it. I think it would be a better hotel once fully done and certain staff members get lessons in communication and interpersonal skills. I wouldn't stay here again. I prefer a hotel thats more centrally located so I can walk to most places in 5 - 10 mins as opposed to 20 - 35 mins but on that note it is our fault for choosing this hotel and interpreting 'walking distance' as meaning 5 - 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Newly opened, a lot to improve”
Reviews.Author: prisoner1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on business. Very modern and only 5 mins by tram from Centraal Station or 10 euro by cab. Had to use the ironing facilites, asked 4 times, still waiting. Lunch was for around 200 people with absolutly no organisation. Saying that the food was good especially breakfast. Perhaps I will return one day when their service problems have been addressed!! Saying that, a huge company such as Movenpick should have them solved before the doors opened initially. WI-FI was not working which, as I was there on business, was very frustrating. All in all a nice hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay again!”
Reviews.Author: beakbubble
Reviews.Content: we were on the 17th floor with a big window and an amazing view!!!! the facilities were good although we didnt get chance to use them with only staying two nights and seeing amsterdam. bar was a bit pricey and no lock on the bathroom door but so so very posh - loved it! the room was very fun with lots of hidden storage and gadgets to explore and buttons to press. nice decor, clean, friendly - i could just live there!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of things to fix”
Reviews.Author: Capebrux
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a great hotel for the business traveler once they work out all the bugs in the hotel facilities and finish the hotel. At this time, I would not recommend that anyone stay here. During my October 6-8 stay, there was no hot water in the hotel one day, and neither the free WIFI nor the paid ADSL worked on a consistent basis. Additionally, certain wooden furnishings in the bathroom had not be finished. This was actually funny because when you left a most towel on these furnishing it lifted the stain off. Also, please note that this hotel is not in the city centre as advertised. It is a good 15 minute walk to Centraal Station. The walk is a bit scary at night when the Tram is not running. You have to go under the train tracks and across traffic in a dimly light area.

HotelInfo.Name: Moevenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Center
HotelInfo.Address: Piet Heinkade 11, Amsterdam BR 1019, The Netherlands
